I’m glad to hear the supervisor handled it properly for you.  Yes, holidays are typically busier with larger families here with us enjoying their time. Glad you were able to stay into the following week as well.  We hope to see you again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Incredible resort with one downside
review: What a great Marina! Super clean, great pool and amazing hot showers. Very impressed. The only strike against them were the bicycles they offered. Rusty and squeaky and not well maintained. Staff was WONDERFUL and so professional on a crazy Memorial Day weekend! Shuttle took us up to the resort for an after dinner drink and lounge music. All in all, one of the best marinas for a "staycation"

title: Wonderful 80% of the time...
review: My third holiday at The Resort at Longboat Key Club, I was extremely excited to go back with such fond memories of previous holidays with my fiancé and his parents, we counted down the days and couldn't wait to arrive.   Since being taken over by 'Opal' we have noticed changes but most positive and generally for the better. However we were left feeling disappointed and undervalued as guests on the first week of our two week holiday. A huge convention group arrived on the Tuesday and without a doubt overpowered the resort. Two of their three nights, the resort took over a section of the beach where bars, food stations and stages were erected for private parties for the group. While it was all very interesting to see at Longboat Key Club (this is like nothing they've ever done…

title: Happy campers
review: My husband and I we have been there multiple times with friends and family , we like it a lot , the service is great , the staff makes u feel very special , a very big thanks to Vincent our server at barefoot , Devin &Leo the beach staff and Anita , Stacy Delaney & Flavia the pool attendants...can't wait to be back soon

title: Resort was good but CAUTION...Our Wedding was short of average
review: Where do I begin? We started planning our Wedding a year prior, so a lot of money and effort went into  the "perfect day". My husband and I are not picky or high maintenance but we felt like we were taken advantage of immensely.          A few months after planning with Brynn, the previous Wedding Coordinator, she had left for another job. Then we were introduced to Kristin, who turned out to be amazing and on top of everything. She made me feel confident that my day who go without a hitch. Plus after all the MONEY and TIME we spent planning this once in a lifetime Wedding, it was good to trust someone with your special day.     Two days before the big day I get an Email (NOT a phone call) that Kristin is going to be out of town because of a Emergency. So I was then appointed to…

title: Simply the best
review: We have just got home from 4 nights here and can only say we were blown away by the standard of this resort.  From the second we arrived we were welcomed by the valet parking/concierge  team, reception was informative, efficient and welcoming...we were then taken to our junior suite which had almost everything you could possibly want, except a full length mirror....(I was always being asked how does this outfit look, on behalf of all husbands, boyfriends and partners, please look at putting in full length mirrors).  Our suite (7201) overlooked the lagoon and we would sit having drinks on the balcony just enchanted by the wildlife including dolphins and manatees.  On one of the days 9 manatees visited the beach and just hung out with us for a couple of hours which was simply…

title: BEAUTIFUL DESTINATION RESORT
review: Fantastic resort with a beautiful beach, golf, tennis, marina and 6 restaurants.  The food was great but the service was a little slow at the Italian restaurant Portofino.  The pool is well protected and just a few steps to the beach.

title: Affordable Luxury
review: Recently visited the Longboat Key Club for a conference and was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it. We were upgraded to a beautiful two bedroom suite; far too big for us, but it had a spectacular view of the water, an expansive balcony, a functional kitchen, and comfortable but stylish decor. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the space was immaculate. I found myself imagining how nice it would be to have a condo that size in that exact location, which certainly means I felt like it was a home away from home. The resort has excellent food; the breakfast buffet offered by the conference was one of the best I had at similarly priced resorts; interesting dishes with a lot of variety. The pool was lovely with a nice little bar nearby; the beach was clean, with warm…

title: Blew Away Our Highest Expectations!!!
review: Dear Basianov: Thank you for the “5” !!   It is wonderful that you were pleasantly surprised by how much you liked our resort.  I agree , the view is breathtaking and I never get tired of enjoying the wonderful views of the Gulf.  Great that you enjoyed your conference with us and that the food was one of the best you have had.   Also pleased that you had time to get away from the conference to enjoy the beach and pool.   Thank you for mentioning Rob V.  I agree that he does a wonderful job and is genuinely gracious and attentive.  We look forward to your next stay with us (hopefully for pleasure). Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: A bit outdated, but the pluses far outweigh....
review: We went to the Resort at Longboat Key Club for our anniversary. Basically we found a great deal on a flight to Punta Gorda and started googling nice beaches within driving distance. Our search found Siesta Key, but there weren't many options for 4 or 5 star accommodations there. Longboat Key Club showed up in the search and we liked the fact that they had a golf course and a spa. I'm telling you, the pictures online don't do the room justice! When we looked out at our view of the crystal blue water our mouths actually dropped. We have been all over the Caribbean and the Florida Keys and we had no idea that the water was that amazing on the Gulf Coast of Florida. They upgraded our room to a 2 bedroom suite, so we had 3 glass doors (one from each room) leading out to our amazing…

title: For Florida, high end but affordable
review: Dear Samuel H: Thank you for the “5”!!  Your review is amazing and I do not know how I could make the resort sound any better so I will simply say “Thank you”!  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great trip with friend to a first rate resort
review: A recent stay at the Resort at Longboat Key Club was very nice. The rooms were comfortable, but slightly dated. The internet was horribly slow. And quite frankly, everything else was wonderful. The food was beyond compare at our banquet. A whole suckling pig, whole red snapper and a fantastically seasoned beef tenderloin were the stars of the show. The little things like hearts of palm salad and mango flan were unexpected and tasty. The pool is quite nice as is the poolside bar. The beach was clean and chairs were always available. Excellent shopping and golf close by. Highly recommend.

title: Amazing stay
review: Well what a hotel! Beautiful contemporary rooms that overlook the private beach. The beach at night and during the day you can see Dolphins swim sooo close by. The water and view is amazing. We were looked after in the hotel as well as on the beach. We were given a basket of fruit on arrival along with a welcome note and the beds were sooo comfy! We will be back, we had such a great time with our friends ;-) the facilities are spot on!

title: Wow!
review: Dear Thehayescouple: Thank you for the “5” review!!   So glad you enjoyed the hotel and the beach and all that we have to offer.  We look forward to seing you again in the near future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Paradise found on Longboat Key, Florida
review: My wife and I make annual trips to see friends in Orlando. As a special treat and something different we booked into the Resort only for a night. Each couple had a suite in building 4 and were blown away!   We had intended to go and visit the amazing beaches and restaurants along the cost but never left really left the resort.   Once we had the opportunity to make ourselves at home we spent our time on the private beach snorkeling with the dolphins and seabirds. To unwind we had pizzas and wine on our generous decking into the night.  We can't thank the staff and resort enough, it was an absolute pleasure and we'll certainly be back.

title: Relaxing and beautiful!
review: Dear Jason H Thank you for the “5”!  We greatly appreciate you being our guest and am so glad you decided to stay with us for the night.   I agree the beach is absolutely amazing.  Yesterday, I saw 7 manatee on our beach playing with each other in the turquoise sea.  Usually I may see one or two, but this was amazing.  You never know what is in store for you at the Resort at Longboat Key Club.  Hopefully you can come back soon for more than a night and enjoy the balcony with wine and pizza again. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Relaxing 10 day break!
review: The Longboat Key Club Resort is family friendly and our children and grandchildren look forward to staying there because there is so much to do...golf, Tennis, the beautiful Gulf of Mexico beach with cabanas, chairs, umbrellas that are set up for you and offering food and beverage service, large pool for the kiddies, along with Kid Kamp and Club activities for all ages, it is the perfect getaway. There is a marina and 6 restaurants so you may not want to leave the property.  But if you do, there is lovely St Armand's Circle where you can shop and stroll and you have the beautiful city of Sarasota just a few miles away for all of the Art & Culture one could ever imagine.  Make your next family, couple or business vacation more memorable by staying at the Longboat Key Club Resort.

title: Falling Stars
review: Newly acquired by Opal Properties, The Longboat Key Club has seen 2 of its 4 star  ratings fall into the Gulf of Mexico.   I have been a guest 2 times a year for several years and am disappointed that now one can go for rest and relaxation only Mon. through Thursday.   Priority at the beach and pool is given to local residents who are members of the Beach Club.  Be prepared to tip the the staff,  sit shoulder to shoulder at the beach and pool and not leave your chair or umbrella unattended ( even for a short swim or walk) or it will be taken.  Competition is stiff with the big tippers in attendance. Friday through Sunday the resort takes on a nightclub atmosphere. Private functions on the beach that  include disc jockeys have you wanting to know where the plug to the amplifier…

title: Nice weekend getaway
review: Dear skm2010: Thank you for being a repeat guest with us over the years.  I appreciate your viewpoints and we will work to change your mind over future stays.  I will respond to your points as best as I can in order to hopefully offer another point of view.     I have been here 10 years and also have a long term perspective.  I understand that this year has been busier from an occupancy standpoint than some of the past years, partially due to marketing, partially due to property improvements and partially due to an improved economy.  I am very thankful for the millions of dollars new ownership has physically put into the property recently  to make improvements including wellness spa and fitness areas, golf courses, outdoor furnishings, etc. The Inn also improved the suites with new carpet, exterior and interior painting and other improvements.  I have had many conversations with repeat guests who recognized these improvements.  We do sometimes have beach events.  Typically weekends comprise of Wedding ceremonies that are usually a joy to watch from the suites and occasionally smaller private beach dinners, etc.  We do a couple larger beach evening events a year that may include entertainment and typically these are tied to a charity where we are raising money for a local charity while serving fabulous dinners and wine.  I am not sure when you were specifically here, so I cannot comment with full certainty of the event you mention.  I would be happy to speak to you further in detail on your experience, but our true desire is to provide an excellent experience for our guests.  I am sorry that we fell short on your most recent stay. Service and ambiance should always come first and I request you will give us another chance.   Thank you for taking the time to review us and I look forward to seeing you in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Warm Water,Cold Drinks, Great Golf
review: My husband and I traveled from Orlando for a weekend anniversary getaway.  Danielle at the concierge desk was very helpful in getting us a car and dinner reservations.  Cheryl, the bartender at the main bar was very helpful and friendly. Our room was very nice.  We stayed in 6201 on the lagoon.  It was plenty of space and i loved the balcony.  The beach service including the chairs and wait staff were very helpful and accommodating.   Some improvements to consider: The resort fee should mean that water sports and bicycle rental is included.  "Access to" means there is a fee. Paying  $50 for 2 breakfast buffets is a little outlandish!  $18 per adult, $4 for juice, and a 20% service fee.  We would be back because we love the beach location.

title: Exceptional service
review: Dear TXAmanda: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay and I am glad you and your husband enjoyed your anniversary weekend with us.  Thank you for mentioning Danielle and Cheryl and how helpful they were. I agree they are wonderful.    I love the Lagoon View suite like you stayed in.  Hope you were visited by the manatee that travels the lagoon often.   Thanks for mentioning the positive beach experience.    On the Resort fee, it does include complimentary use a bicycles, beach chairs and umbrellas as well as many other items through the club.  We do charge for water-sports equipment like the stand-up paddle-boards and kayaks.   We look forward to seeing you again on your next stay.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Gorgeous Beach, Beautiful 2BR condo with a view, wonderful service
review: Stayed with friend at Long Boat Key ,Nice place,Little older resort but clean and good service. Beach was great 79Deg, water was fantastic,Warm and blue.Resort Golf course is in great shape but the Members course if available is beautiful. Three nine hole courses along Sarasota Bay and the boat docks,perfect condition generous fairways.Will go back again next year

title: can't get any closer to the beach
review: This one is really on the beach....beautiful long beach walks, but also very convenient to Sarasota downtown.  We had a two bedroom suite, very roomy with two balconies overlooking beach.  We were only a couple (we got upgraded! I think because we made reservations 3 months in advance....but I think the 2 BR would be comfortable for a family of four.

title: Mixed Bag
review: Dear 603gracie:  Glad you enjoyed your long beach walks while staying with us.  Happy that you also liked the proximity to the beach as well as to Sarasota. We look forward to seeing you again in the future. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great location, fabulous condo
review: I was disappointed in this property, especially relative to the price.  I had a double room facing the ocean.  The buildings and room were somewhat dated and not up to par with other luxury properties.  The bathroom was dated with finishes that were 3 star caliber.  The cabinet door to my vanity didn't close properly.  The service was very friendly but there were a few issues.  At least twice during my week long stay the in-room coffee was not replenished and I had to ask for more at the reception.  The hair dryer was outdated and quit working while I was drying my hair.  The staff, however, promptly brought me a brand new dryer.  By far the most serious issue that I had relates to the noise level.  We had a double room with a door that apparently adjoined a unit next to ours. …

title: Longboat Key Club -- a great beach destination
review: Dear Cellapink: Thank you for being our guest and taking the time to offer your feedback. I’m glad you found the service on property to be very friendly and that you found the beach to be top notch with wonderful amenities.   I’m equally pleased that you found the food to be top notch.  I’m sorry that your connecting room experience was not good with noisy neighbors.  If you ever have a challenge like that in the future, please let us know and we will resolve.   When you’re back in the area, please let us show you our Junior Suite which is about three times the size which will give you the space it sounds like you were looking for. I have sent you a separate private note to gain your contact details to have membership reach out to you. Again, thank you and we hope to see you again in the future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations

title: Spectacular property not staffed to handle the holiday crowd.
review: My husband and I only had one night here (fast business trip), but were so impressed that we are going to schedule a return trip. The location is great, just over the bridge from St Armand's Circle, with its great shopping and dining. The condo was very well appointed, with a large balcony (we overlooked a golf course), full kitchen with laundry and every amenity you could wish for. The property was immaculate, the staff were very pleasant and quickly responded to requests. We hope to return soon!

title: Great place for a family
review: The apartment style was great.  We had a 2 bedroom apartment.  My parents stayed in one room with one bed and my brother and I stayed in the other room which had 2 beds.  There was so much closet space, it was awesome.  We had a beach view which was amazing.  The restaurants were ok, the food was mediocre, so that was my only complaint.  It is expensive but well worth it.  Otherwise, I loved it and would return there again.

title: A great property, but a bit overpriced
review: Dear SDCG1983: Thank you for being our guest and for taking the time to review us.   Glad you enjoyed the spaciousness of the 2 bedroom suite as well as the closet space!   I agree the views from the suites here are amazing.  I will share your restaurant comment with the Food and Beverage Director.  We very much look forward to seeing you again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Nice but flawed
review: This is a very nice property, however they charge as if it's an Outstanding property.  The service and food was very good and the rooms were nice, but not "over-the-top" as you might expect at $600 per night.   We stayed in an ocean front room with a nice lanai area and a great view.  The beach was clean and welcoming with beach chairs and umbrella's.  The spa was very nice and the service was excellent.  Overall I would give this property 5 stars at $400 per night, but not at $600 plus.

title: Mixed feelings - I rate it a 3.5 star hotel
review: Dear ReviewsbyRich: Thank you for your review.  Glad you found service and food to be very good and the rooms nice with a nice lanai including a great Gulf view.  From your pictures it appears you stayed in our 675 Square foot Junior Suite.  I see you also enjoyed the Spa and had excellent service there as well a clean and welcoming beach.    Please come back and visit us again in the summer and you will find the rates more in line with what you are looking for.  Thank you again.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations

title: You are paying for the beach, certainly not the room
review: This is a very nice resort where the staff are very attentive and the rooms are nice but they could do a few things to improve it: 1. Most sea view rooms look out over the beach and the swimming pool. The swimming pool is open till late( supposedly 8pm but there were lots of people in the pool way after 9 pm). When all you want to do is relax and have a quiet drink before dinner overlooking the Gulf this is spoiled by the noise of shrieking kids (I have 2 of my own) in the pool and teenagers in the hot tub. Please management.... Shut the pool by 7pm and have staff make sure no-one is using it!  2. Wanna get a sun-bed by the beach. Forget it unless a) you wake at 6am and go down to "reserve" a bed or b) bribe the beach attendants with a big tip for the week and they will reserve…

title: Remarkable service on the beach
review: We stayed on the resort for a week in building one. We had an awesome view of the beach. The staff was very well trained and helpful, especially Ozzy at the beach ! He was always helpful and upbeat always willing to help !!

title: Beautiful Location & Tennis Center
review: Dear Silviparada:  Thank you for the “5” review!  So glad you enjoyed your time in building 1 and that Ozzy took good care of you at the beach along with the rest of our team.  We hope to see you again soon.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations

title: Wonderfully relaxing spring vacation.
review: This was my second visit to the Longboat Key Resort.  We go to Longboat Key for an extended weekend-mostly to play tennis but always have some beach and pool time. The tennis center is great. Beautiful Har-tru courts and a great clubhouse with a bar/restaurant. The tennis concierge arranges competition for you based on your level.  There are also clinics and lessons available. The only drawback is the tennis center is a few miles from the resort. There are shuttles but I miss the convenience of being able to dash up to my room in between matches. The hotel was a little disappointing. We had a room on the 10th Floor which offers a great view of the beach and area. But there were some issues with the room. There was no ice in the room. The refrigerator has an area for ice trays…

title: Nice Secluded Hotel
review: Dear Michelle S Thank you for your review of the resort. I’m glad you enjoyed the tennis center and hat the tennis concierge (Zo) took very good care of you.  Our guests truly enjoy the Tennis Gardens and it is a wonderful area of our property.  All four rooms have ice makers except the “guest room” that you stayed in.  I’m sorry that the area for ice trays was frozen over and it took longer than it should have to resolve.  As far as the servi-bar in suite, we are happy to remove the items if you don’t want the convenience items in the room.   I appreciate your other observations and I have shared them with engineering to review.  I hope you will consider staying with us again.  You may want to consider staying on a junior suite based on what you are looking for as conveniences.  Thank you again.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations

title: Nice despite the weather
review: My college senior daughter and I took a mini vacation down to Longboat Key during her spring break.  I had stayed in the area a few years back while attending a wedding in Sarasota, and remembered Longboat Key as being very nice.  The nonstop flight from Boston is a real treat, Sarasota Airport is a breeze, and the short drive the the resort made the trip so easy. We were very comfortable in our oceanfront junior suite.  The accommodations are clean and spacious, we appreciated the quality linens, and the balcony gave us the opportunity to spread out a bit.  Morning coffee on the balcony overlooking the beach was wonderful.   The beach is perfect.  Lots of beach chairs and umbrellas are available.  Towels and chair covers are provided.  Even though we never did this, the ability…

title: Short and Sweet
review: I recently went to visit family in the Sarasota area with my college age daughters.  To surprise them I booked 3 nights of our stay at the Longboat Key Club, Resort.   We had a Jr suite in bldg 2  overlooking the pool area.  The room was comfortable for the 3 of us (1 King bed and a queen size pull out couch).  There was a small kitchen and eating area where we could have had breakfast.  However, we opted to go to the restaurant and eat outside.  The a la carte menu had healthy choices that were not outrageous (for a resort).  Within a few steps we were on the beach where an employee was waiting to bring cushions and umbrellas to the lounge chairs provided.  There were cabanas available as well, but we were content with an umbrella as we wanted to be in the sun.  The grounds…

title: LOVE this resort!
review: Dear Ivb663:  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  I do not know how I could improve on your review, so let me just say thank you for your kind words and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.  I bet your friends were very happy with you for such a thoughtful surprise.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Unbeatable location, friendly staff, comfy rooms
review: My daughter and I stayed at the Resort at Longboat Key Club in early March and it was an excellent experience.  We were given a suite in building 6, which I am guessing is the newest of the many resort buildings.  Although we did not have a Gulf view, our very spacious suite had a beautiful view of a lagoon off of a huge balcony.  Views of the moon were amazing all week and it was truly serene. The room was clean, modern and had every amenity we could ask for: full kitchen, washer/dryer, huge closets, lovely furnishings and, as mentioned, a large balcony with a chaise, table and 4 chairs.  Service was great all around, but really exceptional at the pool and the beach. We were there before the real Spring Break rush, so no over-crowding or problems getting chairs at the pool or…

title: Do not hesitate to get to the Longboat Key Club Resort as fast as you can!
review: Terrible northeastern weather. This resort was the prescription! The location is fantastic, our room was located in a building facing the ocean, with unimpeded sunset views and the sound of the surf through open windows. Our room are well equipped, with a mini-kitchen, sofa, big TV and lots of closet space. We did not feel cramped at all. One of the quietest hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. Outstanding hi speed wifi everywhere, which took little time to log in.  TV had hundreds of available channels. The pool was a little bit busy in the afternoon with a small army of very happy kids. But with ample chaise loungers available, we were able to locate a little bit away, We dined in several of the restaurants, and will review separately. This is the classic big Florida resort,…

title: Great beach! Outdated accommodations...
review: Dear Lawrence2300: Thank you for the “5” review and the 2 thumbs up.   Your prescription is ready for a refill whenever you are! I’m glad you enjoyed your suite, surf and the sunset views.   Good to hear you were able to take advantage of the wifi as well as the healthy selection of HD TV channels we offer.   Being break time and family vacation time, there are more people at the pool than usual, but as you mention, you can find areas of respite there as well as ample beach space to hide away.    We hope to see you again soon. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: A little disappointed.
review: We have been here several times over the years but this last visit was just not that great. When we checked in and I went to plug in my computer the baseboards were dusty. Not something you expect when you pay $550 a night. The food was just average and the service was very slow. They need to up their game or lower their prices. It does not live up to the luxury resort billing.

title: Very enjoyable vacation
review: Dear Deesgirl66: The suites should be perfect upon check-in.  We have reviewed baseboards with our housekeeping team and they are all being checked this week.    I am sorry you had some difficulties on this stay , but hopefully since you have been here many times over the past several years, you understand that is not our standard or typical.  We are here to deliver excellent service every time and we will show you that on your next stay with us.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations

title: Excellent
review: Our stay started off on the wrong foot.  We were supposed to get an early check in, but had to wait over three hours for our room to be ready.  Once we were settled in and "learned the ropes", things went smoothly. The accommodations were quite comfortable and we had a very nice gulf view.  The pool and beach were very nice and crowded, but that is to be expected since it seems to be spring break somewhere all of March and April.  Several dining choices and food was good.  Staff pleasant and accommodating.

title: average at best and in need of major upgrades
review: Dear abarasol: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  I apologize you were not able to get in early as you hoped.  We typically run 100% this time of year and due to the size of our suites, it may take some time to get them perfect for you.  We do encourage our guests to begin their vacation even before the suite is ready.  Upon stopping by the desk, we give you a pre-check-in access card to get you full access to the resort.  This way our guests can enjoy the beach, golf, spa, restaurants, tennis, etc. even before getting into their suite and can also use all of our facilities all day on departure day after leaving their suite..  I’m glad that outside of not getting you in as early as you hoped you enjoyed your time with us and we hope we will see you again in the future for another stay. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort

title: A Great Find on Vacation!
review: We stayed at LBK twice in Feb. The Junior Suite was very quiet with a great balcony and the 2 bedroom suite we were upgraded to (without asking) was very good.   Although the bathrooms are now rather old - for instance neither of the rooms had a walk in shower this did not detract from our enjoyment of the hotel.  The service in the hotel was first class     We ate at the Lazy Lobster, Dry Dock and the Toasted Mango, lunch and dinner, all of which were very good.  BTW we much preferred the LBK beaches to those in Siesta Key.

title: Good relaxing time once moved
review: My wife an I came here for a wedding and stayed a few extra days. This property has seven buildings and there is a BIG difference in views and noise. Our first room was located on the second floor overlooking the pool. Lot's of noise and you barely knew you were at the beach. I asked to be moved and they were not able to do so until our third night. We were moved to building 4 and it was like we went to a new hotel.  We had a great view of the gulf and the room was in much better shape.  The staff tries hard. The property management is good...not great.  Ask to be put in building 4 as high up as you can and as close to the gulf as possible. You'll be glad you did.

title: Recent chill-out trip
review: Dear WVTraveler8  Thank you for being our guest and for your review.  I'm glad we were able to move you into the building of your choice and it was the experience you are looking for.  There are advantages to each of the areas you mention and we do our best to exceed our guests expectations.  We hope to have you visit us again in the future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: longboat key club review
review: I booked a week at the Longboat Key Club looking for a week of relaxation and the odd bit off tennis and the resort did not disappoint. I booked a junior suite overlooking the golf course which was huge and very well equipped. It wasn't overlooking the beach but I knew that the weather likely would not be warm enough to be sitting out in the evenings for too long and the few was certainly nice enough. The resort itself was really nice. The pool is great and the beach was fantastic. The tennis centre was amazing - anyone wanting to brush up on their tennis skills for the odd hour must try it out - their daily tennis clinics are really helpful. The spa is also a great place to relax - I had a wonderful massage and floated back to my apartment. The selection of restaurants was huge…

title: Spectacular
review: Dear Mark W:  Thank you for the “5” review.  I’m very please that you found the tennis center to be amazing and the clinics really helpful.  Great to hear the massage at the spa and dining at the restaurants were also great experiences.  We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.    Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: A great beach resort
review: my wife and i have stayed here many times.  The beach is a short walk from any hotel room.  The beach workers are most helpful especially Yony!!  He gets to know you and is always ready to serve.  All the staff is well trained to help in any way possible. " The best place to be is on longboat key."

title: Beautiful beach, great location for families or old-timers!
review: High priced but gorgeous.  Vacationed over Easter, 2014.  Last stop on college search. Resort had family activities for young kids for Easter, little bonus with stay.  We also did Easter buffet which was a little pricey although certainly good. Service was fine. Pool was nice, more crowded because of holiday, which is expected. Room had small but full kitchen another plus with family!  Best reason to go is the beach, the sunsets, and fun shops at St. Armand's.  We have also stayed at Casa Del Mar down the road a bit for a longer stay.  Equally efficient, clean and can get larger space (2 bedroom) living and kitchen for an entire week as opposed to 3 nights at LB Key Resort. It's all about the beach!

title: Wedding Weekend
review: Dear Jill G Thank you for your review. Glad you enjoyed Easter with us last year.  It is hard to believe it is almost Easter again.  Yes, we will have the Easter Egg hunt again this year for the children and Easter buffet as well.  If you are returning, we suggest you book the buffet in advance.  Thanks for mentioning that you enjoyed the service and the pool and beach areas of the property.    Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Very relaxing resort
review: We just returned from a 2 nights stay! 8 of us stayed in Suite 5307 - The two bedroom suite was perfect for 8 adults. The furnishings are updated and beds super comfortable! The sofa bed was not, but it is to be expected really.   Room service was delicious. We had two gourmet thin crust pizzas that were outstanding. We also ordered a full breakfast on Saturday morning for 8 people which was delivered in less than 30 minutes.   All that said - the wedding part was only a small percentage as amazing sadly. The ceremony was beautiful of course, but the reception was pretty poor. The staff appeared to be bothered to be working the event. The food was tasteless. Salads had no dressing. 6 top tables were set for 8. There was no dressing, salt + pepper on the table.   We had a great…

title: Very disappointed
review: Dear Christina G: I’m glad you enjoyed your stay in 5307 and the 8 of you liked the 1,750 square foot suite. Thank you for mentioning your positive experience with room service and the timely delivery.   I apologize that you did not enjoy the experience at the reception.  It is certainly our goal for everyone in attendance to have a great time and positive experience .  Our meeting planner had spoken with the Bride and Groom at the reception who mentioned ” This day could not have been more perfect”.   I do wish it would have been the same experience for you and I have reviewed your comments with our team.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Lovely Location but needs sprucing up
review: My husband and I visited end of February for a few days for his birthday. We have stayed at the Ritz in Sarasota as well. By comparison, I have to agree with other reviewers that the LBKR is outdated, but well kept in general.   This was our first time in a resort that does not accept any form of payment other than your room key.  No cash , no amex, no visa, nothing. Everything has to be put on the room and paid for at the end of your stay.   All of the service fees (for example, gratuity for servers) are included in the check , so beware. They automatically charge 18% for everything.  You could opt to give more gratuity at restaurants, etc based on your experience.   We found the pool to be very crowded and not relaxing . A lot of little kids jumping around and shouting.  We…

title: vacation review
review: Overall, Longboat was great.  Room was great as was the service during our 4 night stay.  Grounds were clean and staff was friendly and very cordial.    One suggestion would be to offer more of a variety of food choices at restaurants at the resort.  Outside of that our stay was great would most definitely plan on returning.  Attaboy to Brittney of the pool and beach team-- great personality and pleasant everyday !!!!!!!!!

title: Great for a high-priced beach vacation but not so great for business groups
review: Dear Terry C:  Thank you for your “5” review.  I’m glad you enjoyed your suite as well as the service you received during your four nights with us.  Thanks for mentioning how you found the grounds to be very clean and the staff friendly.    I have mentioned your food suggestions to our chef.  We are in the process currently of updating the menus in several of our restaurants as we do very often.  So proud of Britney!  Thanks for mentioning her specifically.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Beautiful Beach
review: One’s conclusion regarding this hotel will vary depending on the reason for your intended travel. As a gulf coast vacation get-away for the well-heeled leisure traveler, this resort receives 5 stars. However, if the reason is for business travel or business meetings, this facility is not up to standards for today’s business meetings. The hotel’s setting is a true resort located on a multi-acre gated property in an idyllic Gulf Coast beach compound. Upon arrival, first impressions of the dated appearance of the hotel’s exterior leads you to question whether you made a wrong turn and ended up at a 1970s motel rather a high-priced luxury resort. Let’s just say that the exteriors of their buildings are in need of a makeover for an updated, fresh, new look. However, what the hotel…

title: A great location!
review: Dear ByronDallas_Texas: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  Sorry you did not find the look of the buildings to be modern and fresh.  we are currently painting all of the buildings and adding new signage as well as sprucing up the building lobbies.  I’m glad you found the interiors to be luxurious and full service as well as your mention of the chocholates and orchids.  Thank you, as well for mentioning the staff had a “can do” attitude and would remember your name.  As far as your meeting concerns, I do appologive that your experience do not measure up.  We do have additional meeting space in additon to what you mentioned.  We have the John Ringling room adjhacent to the hotel lobby as well as the library. We also offer meeting space in the Islandhouse location as well as a small meeting room in building 5.  Additionally, we have a grande ballroom located at our harborside complex as well as a small meeting room at our tennis Gardens.    I am a bit surprised that you felt the meeting room allowed noise from the lobby as the entry is very solid and I have not heard thei complaint before. That being said, I will find a busy check-in day and stand in the meeeting room to observe and make any adjustments needed.  The wifi in the meeting rooms are a multi-tiered network.  We have much faster bandwith available for meetings.  I’m not sure who gave you the speaker cable but that is certainly unacceptable and  unexcusable.  In March, we just replaced the cooling system for the main building as well as the vents you mention.  This ongoing maintenance and replacement is required regularly and i apologize it was not done prior to your meeting.  I do hope we have another opportunity to host you for a meeting in the future so we may be able to give you the same impression when it comes to meetings as you have as a liesure customer. We contantly take feedback and continually improve. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Florida away from Theme Parks
review: Lots of plusses to this resort - the staff could not be more helpful, lots of tennis courts, a nice fitness center and a lovely spa.  I had a really great massage there (I think her name was Christine).  The beach is just about perfect - long and deep with smooth white sand - no seaweed or shells, and you can walk for miles.  The water was quite chilly when we were there, but temps all over the East coast were cooler this past winter.  There are plenty of chaises, cushions and umbrellas (and staff to get it all for you, and position them perfectly, and cold water for the taking.  There are even little flags you can raise if you need assistance or someone to get you a food or drink from the bar.  The fresh water pool was large and heated, and the hot tub next to it was a good…

title: Excellent room, Great tennis center, Steep price
review: Service was quite good (say 4.5 of 5) and the lobby restaurant comfortably perfect. We stayed during the coldest week of February, so much that we would normally enjoy (i.e. Warmth and Sun!) was left for the next sojourners. Acress the street is the Dry Dock Waterfront restaurant, which is great (and is not part of the Resort.)

title: Our return to Resort at Longboat Key Club
review: Dear RayNYC9: Thank you for rating our service very high and for noting the Sands Pointe restaurant to be comfortably perfect. Even though you may have found it cold, we were still much warmer than the rest of the country and within a few days were right back in the mid 70’S.   We hope to see you again soon.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Awesome location, on the beach,
review: This was our second stay at Longboat, we returned for a longer stay based on our experience last year.   The rooms are, by European standards huge, we had a king size bed, a bathroom with full bath, acres of storage, a balcony with furniture, a dining area and kitchen with dishwasher, dryer and washing machine.  By American standards the fittings in the bathrooms and elsewhere are perhaps a little dated.   Our room overlooked the golf course, which we would recommend if you like peace and quiet rather than the noise that sometimes comes from overlooking the pool. Our building was full but we had no disturbance or disruption from our neighbours.  If you want an ocean view, you need to be in another building but building five was great for us.  Overall we have no hesitation in…

title: Probably better than average but not 'very' good
review: Dear SandJA_11 Thank you for being our guest and for taking the time to review your stay. I’m glad you found the suites spacious and you found it well equiped. Glad you enjoyed the tranquility of the Golf Course view building and you had an overall good experience. I appologize housekeeping did not come as early as you would have liked. Upon checkin, we are happy to note your prefered time for serivices and cordinate with housekeeping to ensure service times meet your requirements.   Afar as updating, we are currently replacing all carpet and have other upgrades in store in the near future.   Welook forqward to seeing you again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Oh what a disappointment
review: Overall great stay, rooms very nice and large facing Gulf, Bathrooms are ok nothing super.  Most of staff very good, beach server was awesome.  You can order food and drinks right on the beach, sweet!   You don't need to valet your car, although this is available, parking lots are right there close to your building.  My wife went to the spa and she said this was one of her best massages, when  I asked she simply said, Wonderful!  I think that says it all.  The guys played golf, right on property, well kept, lots of waer and sand but fun, Modern carts with computers staff at course friendly.  Beautiful part of Florida!  We went to the hotels Italian Restraunt off property but part of the hotel, very good, Northern Italian.  We will go back!

title: To see Florida!
review: We stayed for a week , arrived a little late our welcome was not very friendly after a long flight  from the Uk we were disappointed.our lagoon/ golf view apartment  spacious  , but never got any sun expect briefly first thing in the morning so was very cold all the time there was good heating  thankfully also the housekeeping was never done until 4.00 or later in the afternoon very late .. We loved the beach , the pool , and gym was very well kept . Enjoyed the golf course although not very challenging the ladies tees were very uninteresting. We wouldn't stay again loved the area very attractive.

title: Fabulous, with one caveat
review: Dear Jane M I’m sorry you did not get the welcome you deserve.  I am reviewing your comments with our guest services team as it is always our goal to welcome you as if coming home.  The lagoon view suites and golf course suites  are going to face more Easterly and therefor will have morning sun.  The beach view suites will face more Westerly and will provide more afternoon sun.  Our housekeeping cleans suites throughout the day and we are happy to have them clean at your preferred time.  If you decide to say with us again, we can review your preferred housekeeping times at check-in.  Thank you again for taking the time to comment on your stay. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Escape From Winter
review: My husband and I spent five nights at this resort, joined by our son, daughter-in-law, their two year old toddler and 3 month old baby. We expected  the resort to be somewhat crowded as we were there at the height of the season. However, there was rarely anyone in the large pool, and only a few other guests were ever on the gorgeous, immaculate beach. Staff were all incredibly pleasant and efficient. The grounds are well kept. There are several restaurants on the property, but we only ate at the one by the pool and the one in the lobby, both of which offered the same menu. Good fish tacos, burgers, chicken quesadillas. Our "kids", who are foodies from Manhattan, drove into Sarasota every night to sample various gourmet restaurants and found them to rival those they enjoy in NYC.…

title: Nice weekend
review: Dear KLZBoston: Thank you for the “5” review.   We appreciate you being our guest.  Thanks for mentioning how much you enjoyed the beach and pool as well as Barefoots restaurant and Sands Pointe restaurant.   I’m glad Matt was able to work with you to get you into the suite of your choice and you had a pleasant week with us.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Absolutely horrible service
review: This was our first non-business trip to Florida. The Resort at Longboat Key was recommended and it lived up to all expectations.  We were upgraded to a two bedroom suite, which was bigger than most city apartments.  With an ocean view the respite from the mountains of snow at home was relaxing.  The unit had a complete full size kitchen and the suite even included a washer dryer.  The staff service level was superior.  The only problem, which really was not the fault of the resort, was the fact that we could not get in to the unit prior to 4:00 pm, which is the published time.  Due to the weather problems we left many guests were extending their stays, which limited the available rooms.  We are planning another trip for next year and it will be at Resort at Longboat Key Club.

title: Top Notch
review: Had a wonderful visit.  The staff were excellent. Very friendly and accommodating.  Our view from the 3rd floor balcony overlooking the beach was fantastic.  The junior suite was so clean and fresh.  The king size bed had lovely linen and was very comfortable.  I could go on and on about this fabulous place.  Will definitely want to return again and again.

title: Great week on the Gulf of Mexico
review: Dear Irene S Thank you for staying with us and for commenting that the staff was excellent, friendly and accommodating.   Happy to hear your junior suite was clean, fresh and with a great view.  We look forward to welcoming you again next visit.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Simply Wonderful!
review: We really enjoyed Longboat Key Club for the week we were there.  Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the Gulf and the swimming pool.  We had a small kitchen and a washer/dryer which was super.  We enjoyed spending time in the sunshine, and took advantage of the free bike rental to ride to St. Armands Circle and other areas on the island.  There was also a free shuttle to St. Armands that I used on my own the day my husband went golfing.  We also enjoyed the restaurant on property and had a lovely meal at Portefinos.  The resort uses a "no-cash" economy so that was very convenient as you needed your room key only for everything.  A great week for two snowbirds from Virginia.

title: Magical Wedding
review: Dear EvelynMarie: Thank you for the “5” review and for being our guest. So happy you had a wonderful week with us and you were able to enjoy the time in the sunshine.  Glad you were able to take advantage of our complimentary bikes while here and enjoy the nearby sites.   From golf, to beach to Portofino’s it sounds like you made the most of your time with us.  Look forward to seeing you again.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Short trip to longboat key
review: The resort has everything that anyone can want.  Golf, tennis, health spa, fitness center,bicycles, wonderful food, beautiful beach setting with creature comforts galore, heated pool, incredible knowledgeable staff, free parking,  and so on (not in any special order.)   We had a gorgeous junior suite facing the ocean with two terraces, a full kitchen and even a washer and dryer.  (We even had the New York Times delivered to our door!) Location to St. Amend and Sarasota was ideal.  So many things to do if one wants to take advantage of them.  Truly surprised since this was our first trip to Longboat Key.  Hope to return soon.  One caveat.........the weather is a little uncertain.....though sunny, it was between 60 and 70 degrees when we were there.

title: Very Good
review: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our Room was a junior suite and was in building 3 on the 6th floor. Loved the room, loved the view!!! Loved having a kitchen and washer/dryer. Ordered room service a few times, food was very good. The beach is beautiful.. Actually one of my favorites to date. We were there on MLK day and I guess schools were out, so there was lots of kids..I don't think they were all staying at the resort, just members using the amenities. ALOT of noise from pool due to this.  Everyone that works there from the time we walked in treated us wonderfully. All professional and well trained.   I do have to say as far as guests, members, or owners, we didn't meet one friendly person, not one. (Very stuck up and snobbish.)   We will plan another trip here as we enjoyed…

title: Compliments of service on the beach !
review: Dear Tbird42004: Thank you for taking the time to review us and I’m glad you enjoyed your 2 nights here. It’s great you enjoyed the room service as well as the beach.  On the holidays we do have lots of families staying with us.   I greatly appreciate you mentioning that all of the associates were well trained and professional.  We look forward to seeing you again on another trip very soon.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Wonderful  stay and great pool & beach staff
review: We are long time owners here at the club and want to compliment the service that we received on the beach by two young men named Ozzy and Yonny. There help have been outstanding and the best we have ever received in the last 12 years. Thank you for your wonderful crew . Dr Lura and Alan wechsler

title: Amazing stay and great pool & beach staff
review: Dear Weschsler2: Thank you for your very nice review.  Ozzy and Yonny greatly appreciate you taking the time to recognize them and the outstanding service.  We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Not worthy of its rating except beach crew
review: The hotel experience was wonderful, I spent three nights and surely going back some time.  The rooms and common areas were clean. It is a strong 4 star resort. Some staff were quite friendly. Yony, at the beach, was always smiling and pleasant. I have never felt so pampered!  The resort is beautiful. We even had a special treat of dolphins swimming in front of us.

title: The good, the bad, and the not so ugly...
review: We have stayed at the hotel over the years, and in particular we have stayed numerous times over the past year while remodeling a condo on Longboat Key.  The resort is a "semi-public" facility in that they also sell memberships and provide amenities to members of the "club", while also setting themselves out as a resort hotel.  The good - Facilities are very nice, though the hotel and rooms can be a teeny bit dated.  Gorgeous pool area, extraordinary beach, beautiful golf facilities, exceptional tennis facilities, and an excellent spa facility.    The bad - At peak times, the restaurants do not have the capacity to serve all guests .  We found the restaurant staff to be inconsistently trained and supervised.  In fact, we had some truly unacceptable experiences.    Also, the…

title: Best Vacation Spot for All Families
review: Dear Richard K We appreciate you being our recent guest and for taking the time to offer feedback.  Glad you enjoyed the facilities including the pool, beach, golf, tennis and spa.  The are all areas that have had recent upgrades and I’m glad you found them excellent.  I’m sorry you had an unacceptable experience at a resort restaurant.  I would love to speak to you to get more details and be able to have our restaurant manager follow up with you.  We strive to learn from every situation so we can continually improve service.   Next time you are with us, please let us know when you would like housekeeping. We are always happy to do services at times that are best for you as our guest.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great resort!
review: We have been coming to the Resort at Longboat Key Club for over 30 years.  It is by far the very best place to bring a family and enjoy the laid back pace with the very best service.  The Staff continues to be of the highest quality.  Sherman, Gloria, Gregg, Lynn, and the other employees at the front desk can't do "enough" for the guests and always have a smile on their faces.  The pool is staffed by such a friendly group.  Brittney at the Pool and the entire Beach Team make every day so special and enjoyable.  Can't wait for our return in 2 months.

title: We had a great stay for anniversary
review: Dear Barbara D: Thank you very much for the very thoughtful review of you time with us over these 30 years.  We appreciate the “5” rating.  Thank you for recognizing Sherman, Gloria, Gregg and Lynda.  We do have a great team through the resort.  We will keep smiling until your return. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Excellent place to stay for a relaxed family/couple trip
review: We stayed here over Christmas -  it was great!  The food is amazing at all of their restaurants.  The service is friendly and the entertainment was wonderful! We are tennis players and played everyday with John Woods and his team...learned a lot!  The gym is packed with equipment as well.

title: Superb
review: We continue to return here because of several factors: the facilities are excellent, and everything is clean and well-maintained. More importantly, the staff are uniformly attentive, responsive, and overall top-drawer. That goes across the board, from the management (Rick  and Matt for example), to the front desk folks (Jung) to the folks at the pool and the beach, to the folks who take care of the rooms.    I should also note that Beach Yoga offered by the hotel is excellent, and is almost other-worldly given the serenity of the beach. Plus, the instructor Maria is terrific. Highly recommended.  Note that the hotel is not inexpensive (except in summer), However, given that you get what you pay for, and that we got a lot, I have no complaints at all, even though I tend towards…

title: Lovely place to stay
review: Dear factlaw: Thank you for the “5” review.    We truly appreciate you continuing to return to our resort over the years and appreciate your mention of the excellent, clean and well maintained facilities.    Jung, Matt and I appreciate your kind mention of us as well as pool and beach, housekeeping, etc.   I am very proud of the team I work with and am happy we had a positive impact on your stay.  Yoga with Maria is amazingly popular and I recommend also.  Guests can plan as much (or as little) activity while they are our guest here at the resort.  We look forward to seeing you again soon. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Wonderful time
review: When we stay in Longboat Key we have always stayed at the Hilton but as it is currently closed for refurbishment we booked a Junior Suite overlooking the Gulf at the Longboat key Club. We arrived at lunch time where it was very busy and our room wasn't ready so we had lunch by the pool and was then found by the reception and given our room. We were travelling as a couple and all I can say is if you're not sure whether to book a Junior Suite or One Bedroom Suite then we'd recommend the Junior Suite because it is everything and more than you need. It is very clean with good quality furniture, the kitchen is fully equipped with everything from a corkscrew right up to a washing machine and dryer, there are two large wardrobes, two sinks so no arguments withe wife over who uses first…

title: Great stay
review: Dear Steve E  Thank you for being our guest and your review.   I’m glad you enjoyed your Junior suite and the kitchen had more than you would need. Thanks for mentioning how clean your unit was, well apointed and glad to hear it was perfect.  Thank you as well for mentioning the staff as being very friendly.  I understand you concern with the smoking policy. We do not allow smoking in any of our rooms and we encourage our guests to refrain from smoking on property.  For those that choose to smoke, the balcony of the unit is the area where smoking is allowed to keep in from within the unit. It is a very small number of our guests that do this and I will take back your concern to the team for consideration as to even stricter policies.  Glad outside of this challenge that your stay was perfect.  We hope to see you again soon. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Getting it back together
review: We had a great time at the Resort. The beach was fantastic (white and fine sand with some shells) and the staff there took great care of us (thank you again Matthew)! We saw a lot of Dolphines during our stay. The location is great if you like to have some quiet time. A Publix is nearby and you have good possibilities to go shopping in Sarasota or do some sightseeing in the region. We can defenetly recomend this place.

title: A perfect place to relax
review: Spent 10 nights in total at longboat key , the location is fantastic only minutes from st Armand's circle where there are Lots of restaurants and shops to browse around at night .The beach is pure relaxation with white sand and blue waters with great fishing also. The staff at the beach especially Matt are very attentive. There are no criticisms of this place , just perfect 😃

title: Lovely location
review: Dear Conor17: Thank you for the “5” review and your comments. Glad you truly enjoyed the beach and that Matt and the rest of the team were attentive. I cannot top your “Just Perfect” comment, so I will just leave it with THANK YOU! Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Beach makeover
review: My girlfriend and I spent three nights last weekend.  The rooms and common areas were clean.  It is a strong 4 star resort.  Some staff were quite friendly.  Ozzy, at the beach, was always smiling and pleasant.  The chamber maid had put away our curling iron.  Hence, it was not packed and it was very nice that a manager, Gary, sent it via FedEx.  The shower was the only weak part of the room as the nozzle did not work 100% and the liner was old fashioned and did not allow much room.  The availability of the water craft, bocce, pool, gulf, bicycles & beach chairs makes this a fine resort only minutes from St. Armands Circle.

title: Longboat Key Club
review: Dear Brian2929 Thank you for your review and recent visit.  Glad you enjoyed the service from our team and appreciate you recognizing Osvaldo on the beach team as well as Gary in shipping.  I apologize about the shower and we will resolve the nozzle issue.  We hope to see you and your girlfriend again in the near future for some additional beach relaxation time.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: GREAT EXPERIENCE
review: We've been going to this resort for 30 years the beach and pool area have never looked so good.  The new service they brought in to maintain the pool/beach has made a huge difference.  The beach is raked daily with artwork in sand.  Kenny Gonzales who heads the operation made sure all the guests were attended to immediately and continually thru their stay.  Hotel staff was great, Sherman the concierge was extremely helpful, Ed, Steve, Dawn and Carol at the bar will become your best friends while staying there.  George and Sally perform every night in the bar where you can dance if you choose. They play all types of music and are thoroughly enjoyable.  The only downfall if any is that the rooms are a little tired but it is our understanding they are rehabbing the room this coming…

title: Tennis? Sure but 10 min drive
review: The rooms are freshly painted and clean-- nice enough but no high end finishes or large sizes. The beach is nice but they put people on top of each other when they have a huge beach. Seem to be a lot of corporate events here. The biggest disappointment was that tennis isn't even on site-- it's a 10 min drive away at their other property. They closed the tennis center and all but a couple of unmanned courts down at the resort where everyone stays.

title: Beach Getaway
review: Dear cmq62: Thank you being our guest and taking to time to review.  I’m sorry you felt the Tennis Gardens were too far from the resort center and that it was disappointing portion of your stay. It is 3 miles from the resort center and we offer shuttles at any time for anything within our property including the tennis facility. About 6 years ago, we completely rebuilt and expanded our Harbourside Tennis facilities with an investment of millions of dollars.  We have won many awards and recognition for the quality of the tennis center as well as the professionals we have working there.  Do to the expansive grounds including 2 1/2 golf courses, our property stretches over the lower portion of Longboat Key.  With our internal shuttles, everything is within easy reach. Also, either located directly at or within 2 blocks from the resort center include, the beach, pool,  2 bars, 3 restaurants, Spa, Fitness Center, Links on Longboat golf course, playground, basketball hoop, Camp Loggerhead, 8 walk-on tennis courts, etc.   Thank you again and we hope to see you again in the future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great Time
review: Our 2 night stay was wonderful!  I want to give a big thank you to Julian who took care of us at the beach.   He set up 6 chairs, 3 umbrellas and a cabana for my group. As the sun moved he came back to reposition the umbrellas.  We ordered lunch and drinks from Mike right from our beach chairs.  I have never felt so pampered!   Julian was very friendly and helpful.  The resort is beautiful.  We even had a special treat of dolphins swimming by us.

title: All around excellence
review: Dear SherriL:  Thank you for your review and being our guest recently.   Glad you had a wonderful experience at our resort and made the most of the beach offerings.  Thank you for mentioning Julian for his exceptional care of you on the beach as well as Mike with food and beverage services.  I agree, seeing dolphins playing in their “playground” are a special treat.   We look forward to you visiting us again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Beautiful location on Longboat Key
review: We had an amazing 2 day stay at the hotel. The concierge and front desk were very helpful with restaurant suggestions My wife loved the yoga on the beach, she wasn't expecting that. The rooms were very nice, their was 2 sinks in the bathrooms which was great for my wife and I. The beach was an amazing experience, a young man by the name Julian took really great care of us. He recommended us to go kayaking which was a great idea. We saw about 5 dolphins while we were out there. Another young man named Matthew took care of my wife on our last day & he was very nice & welcoming. My wife didn't want to much sun & matthew was nice enough to block us with 2 umbrellas. Overall, we had a great experience.

title: A luxurious well managed resort with a great beach
review: We had a junior suite on the third floor with direct gulf views, for one night.  We came to check out Sarasota, as we know a bunch of people snow birding. The room was large and well appointed with a full kitchen. It had a large balcony, again with ample seating and great views. The bathroom was in two parts, shower, toilet and shower-bath in one and a sink large counter and closets in the other.  The building is concrete, and the elevators are practical. We slept with the balcony open; the splashing of the surf helped us to a sound sleep. The concierge and front desk were helpful with restaurant suggestions and with emailing a scanned document.  The resort fee of about $24 was not a real surprise. We booked on an web-based service, cost about $400.  We did not have a chance to…

title: Great Stay
review: Dear coccinea Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us for the one evening.  I appreciate your detailed account of the spacious junior suite and I’m glad our guest services team were helpful.  We hope you will return for a longer stay where you can take advantage of the amenities through the resort.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Longboat Keys finest
review: We stayed in Building 4 for 5 nights. The suite was lovely and we were very comfortable.  The view of the beach was stunning, and the sunsets were spectacular. We enjoyed dinner on 2 evenings and had lunch at the pool once. All the food was of a high standard, as were the cocktails! The singers in the lounge were great.  Spa staff were very nice too.  All the staff were helpful and pleasant and we had a nice chat with Rick Benninghove, the Manager. We look forward to returning in 2015, hopefully in the Spring. Finally, a great big thank you to housekeeping for handing in my husband's I phone to Security. When we phoned it to try and locate it, Security answered it and they then arranged to have it sent to us in Orlando. It duly arrived 2 days later, so thank you Security, a…

title: Difficult Review
review: Dear Patricia C  It warms my heart to know that you had such a wonderful stay with us.  I also enjoyed seeing you while you were on property and spending time chatting about your experience.  Thanks for mentioning that the staff were helpful and pleasant and for mentioning housekeeping and security proper;y handling of the found I phone. Glad you were able to truly enjoy the resort including the beach, Spa, restaurants and lounge.   I look forwards to welcoming you back again in the future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Decent resort but vacation ruined by poor weather
review: The hotel was beautiful , food was great ,personel  at the fron desk was top notch (thanks Rob ) . The guys on the beach were great. Be sure to ask for Yony he took great care making sure the chairs and positions on the beach were perfect. We had a fantastic time and will be back.

title: Perfect getaway for tennis fanatics!
review: One of the best tennis facilities around with a first class pro shop and excellent intruction for all levels, including kids.  Tennis concierge available to organize matches for hotel guests as well as numerous clinic options.  "Court 21" restaurant has full bar and healthy meal options for after your match!

title: I have never felt so warm and welcome
review: Dear Belinda L Thank you for the “5” rating.   Glad you enjoyed the tennnis and found our facility to be one of the bst with first class pro shop and excellent instruction.   We look forward to seeing you again soon. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Much More Than We Expected
review: Fantastic view from building 3 where we stayed. My husband and I loved every minute. The bellman were exceptionally helpful with bags and taking us to the other side of the resort. Calvin and rob at that entrance treated us like friends. Gloria and Sherman at concierges have excellent recommendations on dining and were so knowledgable. Ate off site but many opportunities with in. Beaches were flawless. With absolutely return just for this friendly staff. Please give thanks.

title: Excellent hotel with quote reservations.
review: Dear Sadiekins13 Thank you for the “5” review.  We share every review with our entire staff in our daily employee newsletter and it is great when our guests mention exceptional service and point our specific superstars.  Thank you for taking the time to recognize Calvin, Rob, Gloria and Sherman.  We hope to be able to host you again very soon.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Nice Room and beach access but nothing out of the ordinary for the price
review: We were spending the weekend in Sarasota and stayed at Longboat Key Club.  The rooms were spacious and ours had a great view of the sunrise.  We wish we had planned to stay longer because there was so much to do in beautiful surroundings like the fitness center, tennis, etc.

title: Nice place for a long weekend
review: We stayed here for 4 nights to escape the cold.  It was a nice, easy getaway.  We took advantage of the fully equipped kitchen to make our own breakfasts and lunches - with only 4-5 days, we wanted to soak up as much beach time as possible, then ventured out in Sarasota for dinners.  (Not sure how you would stay here without a rental car.)  Our room was beautiful and clean - and gave us a lovely view of the beach and water, which sometimes makes all the difference in making a shorter stay feel longer.  Great gym, which I took advantage of in the morning before hitting the beach.  The beach itself was wonderful and not overcrowded, the staff always helpful to set us up in a good spot.  For what we were looking for this trip - simple beach time with a nice room - this place met…

title: Nice hotel, nice beach but bad TV
review: Dear KP Thank you for being with us for 4 nights for your escape.  So glad you were able to really concentrate on enjoying the beach and soaking up the rays and our staff was able to make this time enjoyable!  Thanks for mentioning the suite was beautiful and clean and you enjoyed the view.   Please come see us again on your next escape from the cold. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Resort at Longboat Key Club
review: The resort at Longboat Key is very nice. Big rooms with beautiful views, a wonderful beach and great restaurant while not far from some excellent restaurants in Sarasota.   The one drawback was the TV. It didn't have any premium movie channels nor a pay per view option. It really didn't have a lot of options for regular cable service either. It's too bad the resort short changed their guests on entertainment. Otherwise the resort was fantastic.

title: Great Couples Getaway in Longboat Key FL
review: Dear Chip C  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  Glad you found the resort very nice and the suites large with beautiful views and you enjoyed our restaurants.   I’m sorry you felt the TV’s were lacking by not offering pay-per views.  We do offer over 150 channels of television with the majority of these in High definition.  Our goal is to offer you an expansize selection of channels like you are used to receiving at home.  We also have recent movies available for checkout from our concierge without charge.  We will certainly take your comments under consideration.  I greatly appreciate you being our guest.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Nice Setting, but Needs some upgrading
review: Beautiful property.  Highly recommend you have a car when you travel there.  While right on the beach, a walk to nearby St. Armand's Circle is 2.1 miles.  Not a bad walk at all, but there is no shuttle service in the evening for dinner.  Rooms are beautiful and very well kept every day!  Weather this year...AMAZING!  It's a bit pricey, so be prepared...Although, they do provide a shuttle to Publix and CVS (again, early in the day) and the 1 bedroom suites have a kitchen AND washer and dryer.  Great BONUS surprise!  Loved this place.

title: High expectations exceeded...hopeful returns!
review: We booked three nights in a one bedroom suite w/ beach view. Smiling satisfaction when we entered the spacious, clean, and well stocked Building  2 room with a great balcony and sunset views. Although just steps from a restaurant and poolside bar/grill, we also brought groceries ( full kitchen) to take to the beach. The sand and water are exceptional, add the delightful and complementary beds/chairs/umbrellas and attentive beach staff, and we could have been at a much more expensive all inclusive resort. The on-site food is above average, shuttles to associated restaurants take you to expensive but excellent eateries. I enjoyed the Tavern and Whiskey Bar. Longboat Key is quaint and accessible with big city food choices. We hope to return regularly.

title: Excellent All Around
review: Dear Jose R Thank you for being our guest and for the “5” review!  I am pleased you had an exceptional stay and enjoyed the spacious and clean suite where you enjoyed the sunsets.  Thanks for mentioning your positive experience on the beach as well as the high quality of the food items including the Tavern and Whiskey Bar.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Summary of my vacations with my kids
review: My husband and I enjoyed 4 nights at the Resort at Longboat Key Club. Check-in was easy and took no time.  We stayed in Bldg. 5, on the 5th floor which had beautiful sunsets over the Gulf.  Our room, the Guest Room, had 2 double beds, private balcony, wet bar, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and toaster. The room was clean and nicely decorated.   We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and a bottle of champagne was sent to our room. We spent most of our time either at the pool or beach. The food at Barefoots Bar and Grill, near the pool was outstanding. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. The beach is private and there is no extra charge to use a cabana, chairs or umbrellas.   I would stay here again!

title: Two nights at Longboat key resort October 2014
