review: Dear Edward R: Thank you for the "5" rating.  American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts Program is a great way to experience the resort. We appreciate you booking through them.  Glad you were able to enjoy the spacious 2 bedroom unit.  The beach is certainly one of the many highlights of the resort and makes you feel like you are on a private island.  The service charge is 20% and the majority of that goes to the service staff. Tipping extra is entirely at your discretion.  Again, thanks for the "5" rating and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Go to the Ritz for the same amount of money
review: Our stay at the LBK Resort was fabulous.The beautiful suite overlooking the gulf was amazing(thanks to Mr.Matthew Gordon for assigning the room).The food was so delicious.The golf was great.I can't say enough good things about LBK resort.You have to go

title: 2 Great Stays!
review: Dear YRRETELKNIHS:  Thank you for the wonderful "5" rating.  We appreciate you being our guest and I'm am very pleased the stay was "Fabulous".  It's wonderful that Matt was able to get you the view you were looking for. There are so many wonderful views from our suites.  We hope to see you again in the near future where you can play golf and enjoy the beach!!  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Just love this place!
review: I'd like to give you 2 1/2 stars but cannot so I will stick with 3.  First contact with hotel is their obnoxious call center when trying to book...unprofessional and young agents who cannot speak proper english and do not know what they are doing.  Very confusing!!  My husband and I usually stay with Fairmont so we are used to reserving through President Club reservations...it is like day and night compared to LBK.   Since we were paying top dollar we really expected a much higher caliber of resort but we were very disappointed. Room was ok but not deluxe which we expected. View was fair not great. I told the maid about about a leak in our bathroom sink which was never repaired during our 5 night stay (2304)...kept having to use towels to mop up the leak.  Buyer beware of their…

title: This place has it all, Beachfront, Awesome Rooms and Activities
review: The Resort @ Longboat Key Club is a great run property that has something for everyone.  The rooms (very spacious) and grounds are beautifully maintained (all the way to water).  The room has all the necessary kitchen amenities, great balconies and the best views of the gulf in Longboat key.  The location is very good, as this property is the first complex when you hit when entering Longboat key from the south end.  St Armand's circle (the real nightlife and dining spot in Sarasota) is just a few minutes drive as is Sarasota.    On this stay the hotel staff went out of their way to acknowledge a special occasion for us and made us feel very special.  This resort/hotel/condo complex has golf, spa, tennis courts and basketball courts ( my fav).  The beach front has staff on hand…

title: Stunning view of the Gulf, wide beach, great suites!
review: Dear ValueReviewer: Thank you for the “5” rating! Your review is appreciated.   I am truly pleased that you had a remarkable time with us and you were able to enjoy your special occasion.   We look forward to seeing you again for your 4th year visit! Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Excellent and Especially the Personnel
review: We recently stayed at Longboat Key with our two children, for the third time in three years.  We noticed that all of the lounge chairs and umbrellas around the pool have been replaced since our visit a year ago.  A lovely improvement! We are still very happy with this resort.  It's not very busy when we stay there the last week of January.  The beach is long and quiet. The deluxe two bedroom suite is huge and very comfortable.  I love the wide open view of the Gulf! The room was made up promptly each day.  We only ate a couple of meals at the resort.  A lunch by the pool was very tasty.  Room service one night for dinner was good.  The deluxe two bedroom suite has a full kitchen so we ate our breakfasts and some easy dinners in our suite.  There is a Publix grocery store a short…

title: Big rooms, beautiful and convienent location.
review: Dear hjps: Thank you for your “5” rating!   We appreciate you and your family coming back each of the last three years.  I’m happy you enjoyed the 1750 sq foot Deluxe Two Bedroom Suite and we look forward to seeing  you again next January. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Amazing Resort!
review: I just came back from an excellent stay at the Resort at Longboat Key Club, as a hotel guest (and not as a member).  The facilities were excellent and we had the perfect location facing the constant white-capped waves.  In particular, the fitness center and personnel were outstanding. Although we had the perfect room, we did lack one item: a washer and dryer, which was important for us given the length of stay (over a week, as well as having just spent the week prior elsewhere on the East Coast).  I brought the "problem" to the attention of the Manager, Mathew Gordon.  He was fabulous in his working through the issue with as many alternatives as conceivably.  Initially he provided us access to an unoccupied suite which had a washer and dryer.  Then he graciously upgraded us to a…

title: If you don't like cats, skip this "Resort"....
review: We just returned from 5 days & 4 nights at this hotel. We had stayed here 20 years ago, and it was absolutely lovely.  Our visit this time was very mediocre from start to finish.  Upon arrival, we noticed a cat or two lurking in bushes and near the pool area.  But, eventually, we realized that there are cats EVERYWHERE at this property.  We could only deduct that these are feral cats that have made their home there, and no one has gotten rid of them.  Walking along a path and seeing cats peering at you through the bushes is a bit creepy, if you're not expecting it. The weather wasn't great while we were there, so we thought we'd have a few spa treatments.  The spa was closed for "training".  The tiled area outside of our room was continuously wet - not sure why. Our sink backed…

title: Nice beach resort
review: Dear Tina B: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I’m sorry you had the issue with your sink and found the size of the resort a challenge. Our resort does spread over miles, due to the 45 holes of golf we offer. The majority of our activities are within walking distance, but we do offer golf cart and shuttle services to make it more convenient.  The award winning tennis center is a short car-ride away, but we also offer tennis courts within walking of your suite.   On the cats, the Island does have cats.  Removal of them just brings more into the property from around us. We do work with a local agency that spays and neuters them to maintain a small population as opposed to a large population   We are definitely a resort that is well suited for families as well as couples. We have a great deal of options for activities and it’s hard pressed not to be able to stay as busy or as relaxed as you wish to be.  A number of the items are outside and you experienced some less than perfect weather, which does limit the number of activities available. Fortunately, we are blessed with near perfect weather the majority of the time.     Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Rapid decrease. Very sad.
review: I attended a business seminar here and it was very easy to find coming from the Sarasota airport.  It is also close to St. Armand's Circle for shopping and dining.  The resort is clean and the rooms were large and nicely appointed.  Although we didn't use them, there was a kitchenette and washer/dryer in our room which would be nice for a longer stay.  Our room had a great ocean view and we enjoyed watching dolphins and mantarays.  The pool/beach area is close and we liked the covered beach chairs.  My husband had a great time fly fishing on the beach.   Unfortunately we didn't have time to explore the whole resort but what we saw was enough to make us want to come back.

title: Poor choice for a winter escape
review: Dear A_RAdventures:  Glad you were able to spend some time enjoying the resort while you were here for your business seminar.  I never get tired of watching the Dolphins frolic nearby!  Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you again in the near future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Another Good Experience
review: Myself and my family have been coming to The Longboat Key Club resort form over 20 years now, up to three times a year. We have always loved it here and and almost feel like it is our second home. However, unfortunately, over the last few years we have noticed a rapid decrease in the quality of the resort. All the rooms and poolside furniture desperately need a make over and refurb - especially the kitchens and the loungers around the pool (they are so cheap looking and not comforatble in the slightest). The main thing that we have noticed as a family is the dramatic change in the staff's attitude. The Longboat Key Club was always somewhere that made their customers feel valued, and nothing was too much trouble. We had a very strong relationship with Barbara who used to work on…

title: Beautiful Venue, Pretty Good Resort
review: My husband and I rented a suite for a week over New Year's Eve. The view of the Gulf is lovely, and the beach is great for taking long walks. There are lots of tennis courts and golf facilities. One puzzling/negative thing is that the restaurant spaces seem small relative to the number of rooms in the resort plus customers from outside the resort. On the days when rain and wind meant that the poolside restaurant could not be used, the Sands Pointe restaurant and the adjacent small Pointe Lounge just weren't adequate. Even on sunny days, people sometimes had to wait for a table at the poolside restaurant. The restaurants at Harborside didn't seem as crowded although we were unable to get a reservation at Portofino (one of the Harborside restaurants) on two of the nights we were…

title: Very nice resort, Best location, privacy, and great amenities
review: Dear rd_horse:  Thank you for your review of the resort and for being our guest.  All of our restaurants are private and only available to resort guests or club members. We offer several options within the resort in order to be able to provide great options.  The week you were with us is the busiest of the year with many families traveling to Florida. Typically, we have ample available lunch/dinner availability for our guests.  Our concierge are available to help our guests in dining options and can even secure reservations prior to arrival.  They may be reached at concierge@longboatkeyclub.com Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Fantastic Lazy break
review: Had a wonderful 3 night stay for our anniversary end of December.  We were given a beautiful king room with a wonderful gulf view upon checkin. Staff was extremely helpful and accomodating.  The beach and views are second to none. This place would be ranked number 1 if not for the cost. You get what you pay for here. Spa, fitness club, tennis, golf. Free beach chairs anf umbrellas.  It Is resort/club experience.  Be sure to make all reservations food, spa, golf, etc.. upon checking in. It can be confusing or overwhelming if you are not a member. A fantastic and relaxing stay. Don't forget to see st. Armands circle for shops, food, etc.. we will be back with family. Thank you again!!

title: NICE PLACE TO STAY
review: Dear Zachary2000:  Thank you for the “5” rating!   Great to hear that you had a wonderful anniversary with us.  I will enjoy sharing your review with our associates at our daily shift meetings and thanking them for being “helpful and accommodating”.  I agree, that it is a good idea to sit with the concierge early in your stay to have them help plan your experience. They may even begin to assist prior to checkin at concierge@longboatkeyclub.com.   Happy to hear it was a “Happy and relaxing stay” and we look forward to seeing you again in the near future. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Nice Resort
review: We had a two week holiday here starting Christmas Day and found that the hotel exceeded all expectations. The hotel room and room service were first class. Rooms cleaned to high standard each day. We were on the 7th floor and perhaps would have appreciated being a couple of floors down.  The hotel is very close to St Almands Circle which is a delightful tourist shopping area with restaurants and gift shops.  The hotel is just off a very nice white sandy beach with at tentative staff taking orders for the beach restaurant.  If you play golf (which we don't) or your just looking for a relaxing break this is a fantastic gated hotel complex.

title: Beautifull place to go
review: All days which we stay was excellent. We really enjoyed our time on the beach and swimming pool as well. I will recommended to best friend of mine, the suites are great for all families, tenins courts and golf resort are also great. Don't miss it.

title: Disappointing.
review: Dear Petra B Thank you for the “5” rating!  I’m glad you fully enjoyed your experience with us and thank you for recommending us to your friends.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Nice but the details can be an issue
review: I wouldn't return as we could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton for the same price. The first room they gave us wasn't what we paid for then they changed our room to what we had originally asked for. The hotel is changing hands so hopefully they will give it a face lift. Our elevator was being repaired and there was a black substance on the floor where the door closes. We paid luxury prices for a not so luxurious room. Staff friendly and very nice.

title: Better than the hotel I was supposed to stay at
review: Dear Bonniesuep” Thank you for being our guest and taking the time to review the resort.  I’m sorry that you had concerns with your suite location and am glad we were able to move you to the new location. Hopefully, you will decide to give us another opportunity on an upcoming visit.  I do appreciate you mentioning our staff being friendly and very nice.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Beautiful views, Loud mornings
review: We really enjoyed our time on the beach at this upscale resort.  The staff was very helpful at organizing our beach lounge chairs and umbrellas.  The rooms (we stayed in 2 different ones) were nice but they are nearing the end of their cycle and need to be updated.  This resort is at least partly made up of owner rental units and we had to change rooms when the owner wanted to come in.  They moved us from a 1 bedroom to a 2 bedroom unit and the price went up accordingly although they did waive the accompanying higher resort fee when we complained about it.  Please note that there is a resort fee on top of your room rate.  Additionally, Florida likes to add on a couple of extra taxes so the room rate can be considerably higher than what you first expect.  Also be aware that the…

title: Made our 25th anniversary wonderful!
review: This was our second stay at the Longboat Key Club.We were celebrating our 25th, having honeymooned in Long boat.Every staff member we encountered was friendly,courteous and helpful.We were upgrated to a lovely 1 BR suite w oceanview.The room, staff, service was stellar and we cant Thank them enough for a wonderful stay.We will be back next year!

title: Our Favorite Place for Many Years
review: Dear JeffS: Thank you for the “5” rating!   Glad you had a memorable experience for your 25th wedding anniversary.  We appreciate being part of it.   Thank you for the kind mention of our “stellar” staff.  We look forward to seeing you and your wife for your 26th Anniversary. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: View assume, maid service steals
review: We recently stayed at the Longboat Key Club and had a wonderful time. We want to give a special shout out to Ron in room service. He is very friendly and has delivered our meals for over 10 years now. He always enters with a smile and remembers us from other visits. Also I want to say the beach service guy name Brad( with beard) went out of his way to help us on the beach. He even made a special trip to office to mail a postcard for me. The resort has had many changes over our 15 years of visits but it still remains one of our favorite vacation spots. We only wish there was some sort of courtesy card/points/upgrades for being such a loyal visitor.

title: awesome beach!
review: Dear PamL  Thank you very much for your very nice review.  I have thanked Ronald and Brad for providing you excellent service.  It is always wonderful to see our associates specifically mentioned for their service spirit.   We look forward to seeing you again on your 16th visit. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort

title: Just to say thankyou
review: Location amazing, bartender amazing, made cleans our room while we're at the pool and confiscated all our food and alcohol, management compensated us only $30. Resort needs to be updated. Not the Marriott beds. Sofa bed was broken down hard to sleep bye

title: Enjoyable long weekend stay
review: We just finished our stay at Longboat Key Club (for a long weekend).  We would definitely go back!  The rooms were spacious and the view was fantastic.   Yes, the rooms are a bit dated, but quite clean and comfortable.  The staff is very accommodating and a pleasure to talk with.  You have to remember, this is a beach property and it is very typical of a beach property.  I travel frequently and I am very particular about my accommodations and we will definitely return to Longboat Key Club.   The restaurant was a typical hotel restaurant - not over the top but quite adequate with decent food.  There are plenty of other restaurants nearby (St. Armand's Circle) so for those who feel the food is "fair", then you certainly have other options.  Food prices are slightly higher than…

title: Great resort, poor & overpriced golf courses
review: Dear Susan T Thank you for the “5” rating!  It was our pleasure to host you for your long weekend where you enjoyed the fantastic views from your spacious suite. I would love to say hello to you on your future stay with us and to thank you in person for the very thoughtful review.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Just ok
review: We have been going to this resort annually since 1984. It offers a nice beach for my wife and 2 golf courses for me. Unfortunately the golf courses are in very poor condition and the price ($100 each) is ridiculous when compared to the many other good to great courses in the Sarasota/Bradenton area. They previously offered a disscount to resort guests, but have discontinued this since being purchased by new ownership.  Also, althought they brag of having 4 restaurnats, only 1 (an Italian fare restaurant named Portofino) is worth going to.

title: Nice room, but overpriced resort.
review: Dear Orrin B: We appreciate your review and your being a guest since 1984. A considerable investment has been made to upgrade the courses and major improvements will continue over a three year period. Our goal is to create the finest golf experience. While the particular discount you mention was not offered this year, it was replaced by several other options to gain value pricing with golf included. As of this writing, we have a  “Golf Play More” package listed on our website that includes daily rounds of golf for 2 and we also currently offer a “Resort Activity Pass” which includes unlimited afternoon golf. I've been playing golf at the Longboat Key Club for the past 8 years the courses are better now than ever.  The guests I have been speaking to have been very appreciative of the work done this year and their current conditions. Next time you are coming to visit the club, I would be happy to review available golf packages with you to be sure you see all your options. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: VERY  NICE ,1970's with kindness
review: My family and I stayed here for a weekend. It's supposed to be a high end hotel, but I thought the facility and rooms were pretty outdated. The location is spectacular. We saw manatees, dolphins, and lots of birds. It's nice, but I wouldn't stay there again, there are better choices out there. Plus there are lots of snobby rich people, why they choose to stay there is beyond me.

title: Longboat Key Club
review: We recently stayed at the Resort at Longboat Key Club.  We particularly enjoyed the beach and the tennis club.  We stayed in a junior suite with a golf course view.  There were just two of us, but the room would be comfortable for a small family. Our room was very nice - everything was in excellent condition.  We had a king bed, a couch (queen sleeper) and a side chair.  All were very comfortable.  In addition, the room had a small table for 4 people, a full sized refrigerator, stove (no oven), microwave, small dishwasher and a washer and dryer.  There was plenty of closet space and a large dressing area and bathroom.  The junior suites all have balconies with a patio table and chaise.  Unfortunately, if your room is on a lower level (we were on the 1st floor) - the balconies…

title: Above and beyond
review: Dear Roch2010:  It was our pleasure having you as our guests at the Resort.  Glad you enjoyed the Junior Suite, the size and the layout.   Thanks for your comment about the balcony.  The balcony is actually private for your suite, but the lowest floor also have the addition of a wooden deck, which is the shared element with the neighboring suite. In the lower floor one and two bedroom suites, the balcony and the wooden deck are not shared.  Glad you enjoyed the pool and beach areas and found them well equipped.    Thank you for specifically mentioning Zo at the Tennis Gardens. I am proud of her for being a superstar!  We look forward to having you visit us again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: LBK 1
review: First I want to say that longboat key clubs is one of my favorite getaways...as a centurion American Express holder I have stayed in many fine hotels and resorts and longboat key club is near the top.  I don't usually take time to write a review but after staying there this last weekend I had the privilege of dealing with Matthew Gordon at the front desk.  Matthew is someone who really understands customer service and knows how to go out of his way to make sure a guest receives the best treatment and service for a great vacation.  Unfortunately it is becoming more and more rare to find "team members" that understands this and when you find someone that does, it does not go unnoticed.  The resort is fantastic but in the end what I will remember most will be they way my family and…

title: Relax Florida Style
review: Dear Michael M  We appreciate you rating us a “5”!  Thank you for recognizing Matt Gordon.  I have also thanked him for making a positive impression on you and he certainly exemplifies our team here at the Resort at Longboat Key Club.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Fantastic Property in the middle of Paradise!
review: Perfect! Accommodations, Service and Facilities were perfect and we cannot wait to return. The beach has recovered from the storms of 2012. The landscaping at the resort and surrounding community is exquisite, a far cry from the dry conditions we returned to.

title: An amazing, serene, relaxing getaway
review: At the end of July my wife and I attend a conference in Orlando.  We decided last year to extend our stay in FL and drive across Tampa Bay to the Gulf coast where we stayed at The LongBoat Key Club.  The experience was so enjoyable that we went back again this year and the experience was even better. We booked the hotel through AmericanExpress where there was a Platinum deal on extra nights and other amenities.  We stayed in a Club Suite which for the 2 of use was quite luxurious. As we rolled to one side in bed we starred at the Gulf of Mexico. We also had a double terrace to uge on and dine on.  The beach is absolutely stunning.  The middle of the summer in Longboat is really hurricane season which from our experience means that it rains for about 20 minutes each day. During…

title: Paradise on the key
review: Dear Stewg Thank you for the very nice review. We hope to continue to be your getaway spot for years to come. I’m glad you enjoyed the stunning beach and were even able to get out for a boat ride while here. Our concierge appreciates your kind regards and I’m glad they were able to assist you in your plans while here.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Disappointing
review: We visited the resort for a weekend getaway to celebrate our anniversary in early October. We selected the property based on some simple criteria - a) must be ocean front, b) must have top tier amenities, and c) must have good tennis.. and boy were we not disappointed.   The property sits on a prime piece of gulf beach real estate, complete with white sand, and turquoise calm water (the water quality varies based on weather, but this time it was crystal clear). They have a well staffed beach/pool area, that offers bar service, outdoor restaurant/cafe, and a good array of watersports. To top it off the weather could not have been better, and while on the sand it was easy to forget we were in Florida and not in some exotic caribbean island.   We were equally impressed with the…

title: Heavenly Paradise!
review: Dear latinmon: Thank you for your very positive and thorough review.  I’m so glad you were able to celebrate your anniversary with us and you enjoyed your time poolside and at the beach. It is a remarkable beach and the sand is like sugar. Great to hear that you enjoyed your room and rate Tennis so favorably.  We look forward to having you back with us again soon. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Outstanding*
review: We stayed at this resort at the weekend.  I was really looking forward to it based on the reviews but have to say it didn't live up to my expectations.  I had reserved (and prepaid) a beach view room, and while we got this eventually, it was after first being put into a room on the ground level with no view of the beach.  The room we eventually got was in building 1 and had a great view or the beach.  The downside was that it stank of cigarette smoke, which the bellboy said was due to a known problem of staff smoking in the rooms (?).  We put up with the smell for the nice view having already had to move, but it really was not what I would expect from this kind of hotel.  I also found the food options a bit limited in the evening.  At the Islandside part of the resort where we…

title: Amazing!
review: I went with my 2 kids (5 and 3.5) my mom, my sister and her 2 kids (7 and 9 months). We stayed in building 3 in a double room suite. The view and the room was simply amazing. The water was unbelievable - warm and calm, perfect for the kids. Everyone at the resort was so kind and polite and couldn't be more helpful - the bellman, bartenders, waiters and more! Especially the wait staff at the Portofino restaurant at the marina - which was simply divine! I can't stop talking about the stay - i loved it and can't wait to go back!

title: Awesome TENNIS vacation
review: Dear clarybergs Sounds like the whole family had a great time out here on Longboat Key. We really appreciate your review and look forward to having you visit with us again in the near future.  Thank you for your favorable mention of the wait staff at Portofino as well as the bellman, bartenders, waiters and more! Thanks also for the “5” rating!  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations

title: Great Location
review: We were looking for a tennis destination.  The tennis gardens are worth the trip.  Tennis concierge Zoe will keep you playing as much as you want with good match ups. Court 21 Food bar makes a wicked smoothie and healthy breakfast.  Junior suite has washer/dryer in unit which is handy to wash tennis clothes.  Beach is nice. Staff is very friendly and not afraid to recommend some local cuisine hole in the wall gems!

title: Let down by after care
review: Dear SedonaSid:  We appreciate you being our guest and also the “5” rating.  Glad Zoe helped make your Tennis play exciting with proper match-ups.  Now that we are your Tennis Destination, please come back and visit again soon.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: More than we expected
review: We have stayed here many times when visiting this part of Florida.  Our suite overlooking the lagoon was lovely although could have done with a thorough clean as there was lots of dust settling into the corners of the walls around the skirting boards.  We only stayed 2 nights and therefore didn't use the restaurants. We had breakfast at First Watch in Sarasota usually opt to go to The Dry Dock Grill for supper but it was closed.We did have one lunch round the pool and this was a little expensive with the set service charge added on.  I never understand the purpose of a daily resort fee or what it means exactly other than to increase the amount of your bill at the end of the stay. Surely once you have paid the room rate and taxes that really is enough.  Yes, this is a super place…

title: Perfect location and great amenities
review: Stayed at the Longboat Key Club earlier this summer and was very happy with our choice.  The view from our suite at sunset was truly perfect, as was their private beach.  We ate once at Sands Pointe, the restaurant in their main building.  Food and service were both great, but not the best value.  A lot of dining options within a 5 minute drive to St. Armand's Circle as well, which the resort could be more cognizant of perhaps.  I decided to take a golf lesson and play a little.  They have 2 locations, but their Harbourside Course, which is the one off property with the marina, was the only course open.  We were told they alternate during the summer months.  The lesson was with their pro Joel and it was first class.  His ability to communicate and use the right words got through…

title: Way more than we could've asked for or imagined!
review: Dear CR8922 Thank you for the “5” rating!  I’m glad you enjoyed your time with us and the view was truly perfect.  Thank you for mentioning Joel’s lesson, as well as the spectacular service by Amanda, Lynda and Rob.  I’m proud that they left an impression with you. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Still Best Place In Longboat Key
review: Customer service is hard to find and this resort definitely goes above and beyond! From the time we arrived, we were greeted with friendly staff.  My husband mentioned on the phone while making reservations that it was my and my daughter's birthday. They surprised us with "birthday goodies" in our room including popcorn, candy and sodas for our daughter and a bottle of wine for me and my hubby!  They also upgraded us from a 1 bedroom suite to a 2 bedroom suite and gave us an early check-in.  The property is beautifully maintained and conveniently laid out, with any amenities that you could want.  The rooms are beautifully decorated and have spacious balconies.  We will definitely visit this property again!

title: Fabulous rooms...loved our junior suite!
review: Dear Lithiatravelgirl:  Thank you for the “5” rating!  We greatly appreciate it.   We appreciate your comments about the customer service being above and beyond and we look forward to you visiting us again in the near future. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Anniversary weekend
review: Fantastic service, best location on the Island, excellent updated rooms, there is no better platinum standard then the Longboat Key Club.  From the first time you are greeted until you check out, you will be well taken care of.  It's one place you will want to come back too in a hurry and hate to leave every time.

title: Top Notch!
review: The white sand beaches are incredible, and as we walked along the Gulf, we saw dolphins and stingrays just offshore. Every one on staff was eager to please- from the guys at the beach who set us up with umbrellas, to the wait staff at the restaurant on site. The food was marvelous, too! The pool was noisy with kids, so we stayed out on the beach most of the time. Our ocean side balcony gave us a ringside seat at the spectacular lightning and thunderstorms that rolled in around 5 pm on several of the days. We thoroughly enjoyed a massage at the spa - it was money well spent! Three of us stayed in a one-bedroom suite. My daughter found the pull out couch mattress uncomfortable, but within minutes of our phone call, they delivered a roll out bed that  was very comfortable, and…

title: Great beach location and exceptional rooms and service!
review: Dear Jania M  So glad you had a “top notch” stay with us.   Your experience is why we are in this business. Our goal is to provide you with the best service and accommodations and keeping our product pristine for you.   Since your recent visit, we have fully remodeled our already beautiful spa. The new spa was unveiled the last week of September and we are already receiving stellar comments about it.    We have also just replaced all the pool furnishings which are now beautiful and very colorful.    And yes, the WIFI has been recently upgraded and works very well. I have had IT verify that the beach area is also currently working very well also, so please return and feel free to “surf” at he beach.  Thank you for you positive comments concerning our associates. I appreciate the hard work they do and am proud that they took such great care of you.  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great beach and resort on Longboat Key
review: I stayed here on Business just last week and had an exceptional time! I had no time to enjoy the vacation side of the resort... pools, tennis, golf, spa etc etc etc.. But I did love my room, so close to the beach I could hear the waves gently roll onto the beach. I understand all their rooms have a Balcony or Patio, for me this is a big deal as I like to end the days sitting outside in the peace and quite, here I was spoiled as I got to watch a wonderful sun down! I will be back when I next hit the FL west coast and highly recommend you give this hotel a try on your next stay!

title: great beach
review: Dear Oliver J Thank you for the “5” rating!  So glad you enjoyed your business trip and were able to sit back and listen to the waves and sunset.   Please come back for vacation when you can plan to take advantage of all the resort has to offer. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Superb
review: Been coming to Longboat Key Club and Resort once a year for the last 5 years.  This is a great place to stay for a family or a couple.  Offers one of the best beaches in Florida to relax on, and plenty to do nearbye.  Rooms- We've always stayed in one of the 1 bedroom suite rooms.  Offers small kitchen, washer/dryer, living area, and patio.  The rooms are very nice, modern decor and very comfortable beds.  Have stayed in the ocean view rooms, which offer amazing views of the inlet, beach, and ocean, and have also stayed in the lagoon rooms.  They offer great views of the lagoon looking east.  The Lagoon building 6/7 is a 5 min walk from the rest of the resort but is a bit quieter because it is a little further removed.  Service- Overall the service at Longboat Key Club and…

title: My family and I have found a new sanctuary.
review: A paradise of relaxation which makes me want to move there. The wonderful staff were always respectful & looking to make our stay as peaceful & relaxing as can be. Just sorry we had to leave & that it took me so long find out about this hidden garden. Cheers! Thank you for the memories with my family.

title: Amazing view
review: Dear Rrrrrrrrryan  Thaaaaaankkkkk you for taking the time to review our property.  I appreciate your very kind comments about our staff.  I agree that we have an exceptional staff and they make it their #1 priority to attend to the guests needs. I am proud to work alongside such a wonderful team.   We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Family Resort
review: We were in a two room suite on 10th floor and the view was 5 star the room was luxury and facility's great, the device was decent especially at the beach however, we arrived perfectly at check in time to be told we had to wait 2 hours until the people leave the room, and then it will be cleaned. Supposedly they payed extra? Also we were offered free drinks whilst we wait however when we left they charged us anyway.   The worst bit was at 1am the fire alarm went off and was very loud! And on that day we were getting up at 6 to go to travel to the uk! But that's NOT the hotels fault i guess. But overall 5 star as we go there every year and normally have super service!

title: Can't wait to go back!
review: Dear Dan K: Thank you for the “5” rating! Glad you found the view and the facilities great.  We appreciate you visiting us each year.  I’m sorry you had to wait for your suit as our goal is to be ready for you. Also, I’m sure the fire alarm was a nuisance and I’m sorry it occurred.  Glad you enjoy your time with us and we look forward to seeing you again next year. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Awesome experience and first rate service
review: If you have children I would say it is a great place to stay but as a couple choose somewhere else.  The pool is very crowded on weekends with children.  As a family resort a 20% mandatory gratuity should not be required, things are tough enough for families and the resort should appreciate their business.  Other "hidden costs" tacked onto bill such as beach chair use. May I suggest that the door that leads to the pool filter room be replaced with a solid door instead of the louver door to quiet the 24/7 annoying engine noise.  Clean rooms/Great staff/Good Food/Nice place but not a romantic getaway for couples.

title: Anniversary trip
review: Just returned from a Wed-Sat trip to Longboat Key Club.  Professional staff, room was ready when we arrived (11am), beautiful view from 4th floor of Building 3, perfect sized kitchen, washer/dryer, Tommy Bahama toiletries, huge balcony and very comfortable king sized bed.  Didn't have any issues getting seats around pool ( "reserving chairs" was so much worse on a cruise).  Great drinks around pool bar; thank you Ed and Ian!  Took the van to dinner one night, which is nice when you want to have more than one drink.  Played golf at Harborside and ate at the Tavern before returning to resort.  Publix located three miles right down the road.  Next time will take advantage of free bicycles.  Can't wait to go back!

title: Perfect place to relax and get away!
review: Dear KellyGreen24: It's wonderful to read of your very successful Anniversary trip with us.  It sounds like you took advantage of many of the resorts features including the pool, Golf and the resort restaurants and bars.  I will be sure to pass along your wonderful complements of Ed and Ian!!  We look forward to having you visit us again soon.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Lovely resort but not perfect
review: My wife and I have been coming to LBK club for the past 4 years. It is the trip we look forward to the most each year. The service is amazing. The entire staff is wonderful. Brad and his guys down at the beach are awesome and they work very hard! Dawn at the lobby bar is our favorite! Sherman the concierge is always extremely helpful and friendly. I can't say enough about the staff members I have mentioned. They are the main reason we will keep coming back year after year.  Thanks,  Jeff Virgin

title: Beautiful facilities, beach area
review: Dear Virg2000: I’m so glad you have enjoyed your experience over the last 4 years.  I will share your kind words with Brad, Dawn, Sherman and the rest of the team.  Thank you again for the review and for your patronage of the Resort at Longboat Key Club.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Needs updating. Overpriced
review: When we arrived our suite was not ready and so we had to wait 1 hour 15 minutes for it, but still we had to change the next day as the suite allocated stunk of cigarette smoke in the living room and the main bedroom, with cigarette ash on the floor by the bed. This was very disappointing as these are non-smoking suite and we received only an apology from the bellboy who helped us move room, but no formal apology. The second suite was much nicer and had a better view. The Tommy Bahama amenities were lovely.  The beach was clean and the sea was warm and inviting. Beach staff were also friendly. The beach is lovely to go in the morning, as well as the pool.  The price of a tennis lesson was not clear, the $25 clinic is a certain times which was not clear and so one tennis lesson…

title: very average
review: Driving into the Longboat Key Club, one is certainly impressed by the huge expanse of the grounds, the manicured golf course, the well maintained tennis courts dotting the grounds.  THe check in was not bad either. Fast, smooth. You get the sense that these guys have been doing this for a long time.  The first and main disappointment sinks in when you approach your building. That's when you realize that these are luxury rooms. THe buildings and there are about 5 of them on the grounds look old. When you enter the rooms, you are not going to be impressed. they are basic rooms that I would rate as 3 stars.  Given the amount of money I paid per night, i was expecting much better rooms. The rooms are clean, the tennis courts are well maintained, the golf course is average, the food…

title: Never disappointed.
review: Dear TowelCarrier  Thank you for taking the time to review us.  I appreciate all of your positive comments about the golf, the tennis, the smooth checkin process, etc.  I’m sorry you were not as happy with your room and wish we could have showed you other options while there. I believe you stayed in one of our 23 guest rooms are the hotel type accommodations which are very comfortable and available for those who are planning to use them primarily for sleeping.  Many people enjoy these rooms. The remaining 198 units are expansive suites and very luxurious.  From a 675 sq foot Junior Suite to a 1750 Sq foot Deluxe Two Bedroom Suite, our accommodations are very we equipped and decorated with high end custom furnishings.   So hopefully, you will return to our property, but stay in one of our suites that are better suited to what you were looking for.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Very disappointing
review: Considering the sheer beauty of this property, one might overlook possible disappoints in service, but we have never had to.  Every time our family visits, we feel at home.  The rooms are always impeccable, the beach is clean and inviting, the grounds are well maintained and the service is top notch.  We all enjoy our personal space, so we are able to relax because of their spacious room layout and furnished kitchens.  The property is not far from any other destinations including fine dining or shopping venues.  We always look forward to our next trip "home".

title: great choice
review: Dear Richard M  Thank you for taking to time to offer your feedback.  It is very much appreciated that you recognize the “sheer beauty” of the resort and that you continue to visit us as a repeat customer.  Thanks for mentioning the clean beach and the service you experience with us on your trips “home” to the resort.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Would stay again...if they made some minor changes
review: Came for just one night, got there right at check in time and had to wait 2.5 hours to get a room. Had room service for dinner and the food was poor to fair at best. At least our room was far enough down that we were not right over the pool but being on the second floor we had more of a palm tree view than beach.

title: "Gulf view" . . . not so much!!!
review: While the room and immentites were nice, the view was not described accurately at all.  The "gulf view" as falsely described for suite 2302 is more a pool view and palm tree fronds view.   We chose the more expensive option and wanted to splurge a little to celebrate my 40th birthday and the view was VERY disappointing.  When I expressed my disappointmnet to the concierge upon my check out, she essentially dismissed me and said (as if it was common knowledge) that we booked a "junior" suite and none of the junior suites have a gulf view to which I replied, then perhaps it should be advertised as such.  Still, same dismissive attitude. But, that is ok there are plenty of other resorts who would appreciate my money and would want me to come back.  Not only would I not go back, I…

title: This place has an amazing staff and beautiful environment!!
review: Dear Joanna N:  I apologize you did not enjoy your view.  The Gulf view junior suites all have a view of the Gulf of Mexico.  Some do have more of a direct view than others, but they all have the view.  We also offer “Premium” junior suites that are located floors 4-6 with a more bird’s eye view of the Gulf.  We did not measure up in your expectations and I am sorry for that.  We would certainly like to have another chance with you to enjoy our resort. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: A VERY PLEASANT SURPRISE
review: We have a very large family, 20+ and have been vacationing in longboat key for just as many years. This year was the fourth year staying at the longboat key club and we always have a fabulous trip! Brad Blackwell is one of the staff members who goes above and beyond to make our stay amazing! He's not only friendly and helpful but he always works hard making each and every guest feel right at home! For any traveler, with families and children or for a romantic getaway, the longboat key club is the perfect place to vacation!!! Enjoy the white sand and clean rooms and stop by the beach hut and say hi to Brad(the beard guy) and trust me you'll be taken care of!

title: Loved it!
review: Dear Jmeluv21  What a wonderful review!  Thank you for taking the time to offer your feedback of the wonderful experience your family of over 20 people had at the resort.  We are so pleased you continue to choose the Resort at Longboat Key Club for your family get-together.  I am proud to work with Brad.  I completely agree with you that he “goes above and beyond”.  We have a great team of professionals who look forward to serving our valued guests such as yourselves.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: This place is the best to stay on the west coast, simply awesome
review: We have been to Longboat Key on a number of occasions, but this was our first stay at the Longboat Key Club. Our room a junior suite was in block 4 and overlooked the Gulf/sea. The room and the in room facilities were excellent with a small kitchenette, washing machine, dryer and dishwasher. This allowed us to save a little money by making our own breakfast and occasional lunch. The beach was on our door step with cabanas, sun loungers etc, with excellent beach staff and as required a bar service. There is also a pool but this tends to get crowded up with children and even though there are sun shades, can get very hot. There is also a bar here where we watched Murray win at Wimbledon ! Overall very pleased, it is on the expensive side but well worth that little extra once in a…

title: Don't go Hungry & without your $$$$ to Point Restaurant
review: After a long day on the beach, my wife and I were tired and wanted something simple to eat. Unfortunately, the only place at the resort to eat at the time was the Point Restaurant. I had a plate with four scallops & my wife had a very small filet. Both were good, but I was expecting an adult meal, not an appetizer. I don't mind paying for what I get, but $96 for two appetizer size meals is a little much. I feel we got ripped off. Also there was a 20% gratuity added, which is what I usually tip anyway, but I guess I looked like I couldn't be trusted to tip. Just a negative experience all around. Don't get me wrong. This is a wonderful resort, but I don't recommend the Point Restaurant. You can get three adult size meals for the price of one appetizer size meal at this place…

title: Work and Play
review: Dear Bruce S: Thank you for taking the time to review us.  I’m glad you found our resort to be wonderful, but sorry you did not enjoy the Sands Pointe Restaurant. It is a very popular spot for our guests and many options for dinner including a multiple course pre-fix menu that we normally offer as well.  We do have 3 other outlets open for dinner, (Barefoots upper deck, Portofino and the Tavern). Thank you again. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Nice, But Not What It Was
review: My sons went to baseball camp at nearby IMG, so my husband, daughter and I stayed at Longboat Key Club and Resort for a week in June 2013.    Room we rented was an ocean front suite.  The room was really great.  Clean, large, comfortable beds.  Well stocked kitchen.  Awesome balcony with beautiful views.....only complaint was housekeeping.   A couple of the days my husband had to work from the room so we called and just asked if the room could be cleaned after 4pm.....we were told "maybe, we don't usually do that."  There is no housekeeping after 4pm.    The pool was very nice but everyday we were there, only 1 waitress staffed the entire pool and beach area so getting a pool side drink/meal was not a smooth process.  I do not require that for a vacation site, but for the price…

title: It is officially Signature Certified
review: Dear erdocw:  Thanks for taking the time to review us.  I'm glad you liked your clean, large and comfortable suite.   I would certainly like to talk to you about your timing request so we can be sure the correct information is being relayed.  We offer T/D service in addition to daily service, so we can accommodate any timing requests you have.   We have 7 Gift shop areas.  The Lobby resort Shop, the Pool Store, I/S golf shop, I/s fitness shop, H/S golf Shop, The Tennis gardens shop and the Marina Store.  In addition to the ones right at the resort center, we can take you to our other shops.   Thank you and we look forward to seeing you again.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Mixed review
review: We had an exceptional experience at Longboat Key Club 5 years ago, but upon returning for this year's spring break, it was not the same.  Make no mistake, it is still a very nice resort.  But, it's clear that the investment in the property and the attention to the guest experience has waned.  It is not an inexpensive place to stay, and I question the current value of what they offer.  Most of my feelings are intangible, but in general, I'd say the main resort has grown tired.  The rooms feel a little worn,and  the staff seems the same.  I didn't perceive the same high-qaulity of people.  Perhaps a part of this is the significant investment made in the bayfront part of the property over the past several years.  The new tennis center must have eaten a bunch of cash, and that was…

title: Not the same
review: Took the family here for the Fourth of July holiday. This was our third visit in three years. In the past it's always been a fantastic vacation. Alas, this time it was not to be. Something was different, almost intangible. And not a good different. Now, not the beautiful scenery and awesome bay waters. It was with the employees. Their body language and tones seemed to us that they just didn't want to be there. The warmth and friendliness we got from past employees was just not there with the new ones. So in a nutshell:  What we liked: the beautiful scenery, the convenient location to St Armand and Sarasota, not paying for the parking, the golf course and the food in their pricey restaurant, not haggling for beach chairs and umbrellas and a full size coffee pot in your room. …

title: Amazing family resort, amazing location.
review: Location, location, location.  Right on a beautiful beach on the Gulf of Mexico.  Beach has cabanas, chairs, umbrellas all included in the resort fee.  Non-motorized water sports as well.  Beach has bar and food  service too.  Pool area is nicely maintained with service as well.  A bit undersized but the kids enjoyed it.  Restaurant right by the pool is convenient but pricey.  Very family friendly.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom deluxe condo with direct gulf views and it was perfect for our family of 5.  We made use of the kitchen and dining areas which helps defray the cost of eating out for every meal, especially breakfast.  Unit had a washer and dryer which is also nice when traveling with 3 children.  Bathrooms and kitchen are a bit outdated but very clean.  Who cares about…

title: Great long weekend retreat!
review: Dear Susan222  I agree the location is amazing.  Every day I arrive at Longboat Key, I am thankful that I am able to work in paradise.   I’m glad you enjoyed all the included amenities on the beach.   Thanks for your mention of the prompt and friendly service and we will look forward to seeing you again in the future.   Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great Resort Experience
review: From arrival check in was easy & efficient.  In our beach view room we enjoyed the beautiful decor of this very generously sized room and huge bathroom and dressing area.  The kitchen area was perfect with everything needed including a stackable washer/dryer.  The balcony area was nicely furnished with dining table and chairs as well as comfy loungers.  We really enjoyed bringing in the relaxing sound of the waves as the balcony doors push back easily.  We did have dinner in the first night.  Room Service was prompt and the food was enjoyable, especially dessert.   It was so convenient to have a frig in our room as we bought special desserts at a local bakery and we purchased food for the day and afternoon so my husband wouldn't miss his football game.  This was such a…

title: Amazing golf & a great beach
review: We have been a few times to LBKC, and once again had a great visit.  The resort staff was always accomodating and willing to help!  In fact I left behind a valuable and sentimental necklace. Realizing it 5 days after we checked out - imagine my suprise when I called the resort to find out froim Robert C., that Janet Y, from housekeeping, had done the right thing and turned in my necklace!  They both made my day!!!  Its a special kind of staff and management team that has poepl who do the right thing!  THANK YOU!!  We will see you next year!

title: Great stay with fun golf, tennis and shell hunting
review: We stayed in room 4302 (bldg 4, 3rd floor) with a beach view for three nights. It was a nice, spacious room with king bed, ample sitting area, small kitchen (w/washer and dryer) and large bathroom with two vanities and tub with shower. We also had two balconies with a lounge chair and patio table with chairs.  During our stay we played tennis on two occasions at the wonderful Tennis Gardens. I paid for one tennis clinic and as guests of the resort, we played singles for free. We brought our own rackets and borrowed balls. If we had wanted to play doubles, the facility would have found players for us to play. We had to drive to the facility but did not mind the 5 minute drive.   We also played a game of golf. The course we played was doing maintenance so we had to play the second…

title: poor representation
review: Dear TexasLCJE:  Thank you for staying with us and for your wonderful review of the resort.    I’m glad the suite was to your liking and I’m sure you enjoyed some sunsets from your balcony.  I will share your feedback to our Tennis Gardens Team about your experience. We offer Shuttles to everything on our property, so please let us take you to Tennis on your next trip.  Most of our guests do self park as you did, but here is no charge to valet.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Never Disappoints!
review: I booked a room at a reduced rate for 4 nights.  Upon entering my room I noticed a dark stain on the sheets of the "clean" linens and a lamp that was broken.  I was moved to the room next door.  In that room the sink and tub drain were slow to work, the wicker furniture was full of dust and dead skin, the bathroom lights were installed crooked over the mirror, and the shower curtain wasn't attached on the inside of the shower.  I just couldn't take the standing water in the shower and sink after 2 nights.  When I asked to check out early due to these conditions, they promptly charged me the normal rate that was $80 higher per night and said goodbye!  They showed no goodwill towards my disappointment! They show you one thing on the internet and another thing in person!  It is…

title: A faded resort which does not live up to its hype
review: Dear Lisa G:  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on the resort.  Since your stay we have spoken on the phone and we have addressed your concerns.  I assure you we have very stringent standards for our suites and I deeply regret there was a challenge with your suite.  We have reviewed procedure to be sure this is not an issue going forward.    As we discussed, the rate you were charged was the properly quoted rate as you were under a 4th night free special offer.  Upon our speaking we have discounted the nightly rate to what it would have averaged had you stayed.   Thank you also for your very positive verbal comments concerning our staff.  I appreciate that you felt they were all very courteous and professional.   As you indicated in your recent email,  you will consider returning in the future after our followup and I will look forward to that opportunity.   Yours in hospitality, Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: First Class Hotel
review: Just returned from our 4th visit to the Lonboat Key Club & Resort.  Stayed for 8 days and didn't want to leave.  My family and I stayed in a one bedroom suite in building 4 which has an amazing view of the of the gulf.  The room was spacious and comfortable with a HUGE balcony.  Admittedly some of the furniture is knicked and slightly scratched and could be replaced.  The beds are very comfy and the kitchen, washer & dryer are a nice plus.  Can't say enough about the staff who are very friendly and cant do enough for you.  We were there when Tropical Storm Andrea hit so the weather was not very good but we had an awesome time anyway.  Already looking forward to our next visit!!  Keep up the good work!

title: Will be Going Back for Sure, EXCELLENT RESORT!!
review: Our stay here for Memorial Weekend was great.  We reserved the Junior Suite which was large and comfortable. ( An extra TV will be a great addition)  It is nice that they offer the service of setting up beach chairs and umbrellas at no extra charge. The sand and beach are just to die for. this is by far the nicest beach I've been to in SW Florida.  Maid service was OK during the entire stay, no complaints. It would be nice if prices were a little lower. Overall will highly recommend it to everyone and will be going back for sure next year!!

title: Four Star on Facilities - One Star for Service
review: Dear Chuchi1:  Thank you for being our guest and rating us a “5 out of 5”!!    Memorial Day Weekend was a wonderful weekend on the island and I’m glad you were able to enjoy the pristine sand of Longboat Key.   Since you live nearby, please come back in August and September where you will find value rates available.  Thanks for recommending us to everyone.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Expected more, needs updating to former luxury status
review: Booked a last minute trip to visit my parents in Sarasota for the Memorial Day Weekend. Choice was either Long Boat Key or Lido Beach Resort (sister hotel).Booked a Junior Suite with Lagoon View at LBK.  In retrospect and looking over the reviews, thinking I made the wrong choice!  My trip did not start out well, no fault of the hotel's but they did absolutely NOTHING to assist in my difficult flight situation! My flight out of PHL was delayed (meant missing connection for SRQ) and the earliest I would arrive was about 8 pm (vs. original of 1 pm). Decision was made to switch to Tampa for a 12 noon arrival...so now, how to get to SRQ?  Was now in a rush, called Enterprise, they were unable to get a car for Tampa. Next call was to the concierge of LBK Resort. Asked about service…

title: Needs to improve.
review: There was a great Jet Blue Getaway that featured this 4 Diamond resort.  Upon further investigation, it appears this award was first given in 1983.  For 1983, the resort was probably considered very luxurious.....but it feels like it hasn't been truly updated since.  On the plus side, the junior suite is large and very comfortable. One the minus side  the tiles and grout  are dingy and definitely need to be replaced.  The kitchenette is more than ample, although there is no oven, so that's a bit odd, but I didn't come to bake, other than in the sunshine!  The a/c would not cool down below 70 degrees.  With 90 degree days, that is better than nothing but not refreshing enough.  The service people here are hit or miss....some are very accommodating, some seem to be annoyed that…

title: Wonderful resort right on a beautiful beach
review: This place is perfect except for the employes.They really did not go out their way in customer service.The room was good and very spacious,we were 5 people in a bedroom suite and it was very comfortable so for familes and friends this works out nice .There was a kitchen so we saved money and we were able to make our own breakfast or lunch.We went to dinner out every night.We did eat lunch at pool and the food was good.But the beach was perfection!! White sands and crystal blue water.I will go back.

title: Solid resort - relaxing beach
review: All in all, the Longboat Key Club is a very good beach resort, with everything that you need for an enjoyable and relaxing stay. What is a bit shocking in the beginning is the architecture of the buildings, but once you got used to that, there is not much to complain. We had a kind of junior suite with cooking facilities, and we liked the room very much. Nicely furnished, spacious, and very clean. The best though in this resort is the beach, and with that the excellent beach facilities and services. There is plenty of space on the beach to enjoy in small cabanas or with beds and umbrellas which are set-up by the very friendly and swift beach staff. We didn't play golf, but I am sure that golfers will enjoy the vast golf course. At the end of the day, I wouldn't mind coming back.…

title: What happened???
review: Sometimes it's painfully obvious when there's been an ownership / management change, this is one of those times. We've been coming here for years and the change is obvious...for the worse.   Let me start by saying that this resort is beautiful so there's only so much they can mess up but what they could mess up, they did. It seems like there are two types of employees here : new ones that are just bad and ones that have been here for a while that have a look on there face like :can you believe this?  Our room has an air conditioner that is so loud it's absurd. The bed is not attached to the headboard.  For those of you that don't realize why that's a big deal , well, I feel sorry for you.  The maid service is a joke. They literally make your bed and THAT'S IT!!!  Just called for…

title: Return trip was nice.
review: Dear EaglesfaninfL:  Your review states you stayed in June 2012, which was 5 months prior to the property changing ownership. Nonetheless, It’s disappointing to hear of your experience.     I believe that our associates are transitioning well to the new ownership/management and that if you read our recent reviews you will see that trend.  I expect our service levels to be high and consistent.  I would be happy to discuss with you, the A/C, Bed and housekeeping concerns so that we are sure to meet your expectations going forward.  I may be contacted easily at the resort or by email below. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Beautiful and Relaxing Vacation..LBKC Exceeded our Expectations!
review: Pool--Pool Bar is AMAZING!  Super bar keeps.  Would recommend not ordering menu drinks, just have a conversation with the bartender about what you like and have him make a recommendation or custom drink.  Banquet---Perfect food and service  Furniture outside of pool area, patio restaurant is pretty worn and needs replacing  Rooms---a dream.  Spa---tech was excellent, price was outrageous.  Got bill and there was an extra $40 resort fee. Crazy!  Spa waiting room just ok.

title: Best location and amenities on Longboat Key
review: Having enough of chilly New England we decided to fly down to Sarasota for sunshine, white sandy beach and tennis...and we had it all in spades.  The main campus includes 4 multi story buildings that are designed with the typical exterior cat walk.  Building four offers the quietest location as it does not overlook the pool.  Even though the architecture is a flash back to the seventies, the grounds and structure are impeccably well maintained.  The junior suite is extremely pleasant and comparable to a one bedrm apartment. We loved having breakfast on the waterfront balcony  and the turn-down service at night (with chocolate treat) is a nice touch to ending the day. The Tennis Center, located 3 miles from the main resort,  is a newly designed facility with everything a tennis…

title: 50-Kick n Stretch
review: This was a wonderful resort for 6 girl friends to meet to celebrate our year of turning 50!  It is a beautiful setting.  We had a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the lagoon and it was very spacious, and so much fun seeing all of the wild life- we saw lots of birds, fish, and even a manatee.  We had a hiccup in the very beginning of our trip, but the manager, Rick, worked it all out for us and we couldn't have picked a better place to celebrate our birthdays. The entire staff was friendly and eager to please everyone.  The pool setting is beautiful, as well as the comfy lounge chairs on the beach.  Another perk that we loved are the complimentary bikes that we rode every day. Overall, this trip could not have been better and Longboat Key Club is a great place to stay!!

title: Best Place in FL!  Seriously, from a Local
review: Dear Cricket242  Yes, the Resort at Longboat Key Club is a wonderful place for a Girls Getaway!!!!   I’m so glad you enjoyed your experience and I was able to impact your stay in a positive way.  Please come back to celebrate your 51st, and 52nd………….  Thank you for the review.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Excellent hotel
review: I live in FL and stayed at Longboat Key Resort for a conference my husband attended and was wonderfully surprised!  What a nice find, and it was only an hour from my home.  The rooms were gorgeous, spacious, fully equipped, with a beautiful view.  Not all buildings have a water view.  I highly recommend building 3 overlooking the pool, beach bar and beach.  The beach chairs and umbrellas are complimentary as are the towels.  There are waiters bringing food and cocktails to the beach and pool area.  All of the grounds were beautiful.  The staff was very professional and attentive.  Since this was a work function I don't have any idea how the prices are, but for a special get away, this resort can't be beat.

title: Wonderful experience all around
review: Dear Terri E Thank you very much for giving us a glowing review. We love that we are a “Locals Favorite”.  So glad you were able to be here during your husband’s recent conference.    We do offer Florida Resident specials, so please give us a call for a return trip since you are only an hour away. I have shared your comments with our F&B and Pool and Beach team.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Ying and Yang
review: After reading mixed reviews, we had our reservations about this property.  We were in a beach view club suite which was very modern, spacious and well appointed, including it's own washer/dryer which was a very nice feature!  Everything, pots, pans, dishes, diswasher, laundry soap, dish towels, etc.  was there for our use.  The resort is well kept, the views are amazing, directly on the Gulf.  The staff was very helpful, all requests were met with prompt replys.  There were a few small glitches (i.e. elevator wait time was ridiculous, we took the stairs down most days), but all in all, this is a very nice property & we would certainly return here should we desire to stay in Longboat Key again.

title: Great place to chill out
review: The resort remains a truly ideal place for a vacation The private beach is just that whilst for the more energetic their is golf and tennis We are returning for the fifteenth time shortly Well worth the trip from the UK

title: Over priced for less than outstanding facilities and amenities
review: The LBKC certainly has a wonderful location on a beautiful beach on the Gulf of Mexico, but I believe that it is significantly overpriced for the amenities provided. The buildings are old and not architecturally appealing. The lobby is very small with no fruit or even fruit infused water available. The pool is one of the smallest that i have ever seen at a 4 or 5 star resort and accordingly the pool area was very crowded. Lounge chairs crammed next to each other in rows - certainly not a relaxing setting. In the rooms, the hair dryer was of very cheap quality and the toiletries were from Tommy Bahama, not a high quality brand. The tennis facility is a 10 minute drive from the resort and the tennis office closes at 5 PM sharp. When I called at 5:10 to reserve a court for the next…

title: Longboat Key Club is a truly heavenly place! Can't wait for my next visit!
review: Dear Jaehh Thank you for writing a review on the Resort at Longboat Key Club.  I’m sorry you did find the amenities as to what you were looking for.   Our tennis center was just named in the top 25 tennis resorts worldwide through Tennis Resorts Online as well as #1 on the Florida West Coast by Tennis Magazine.  With 20 courts available, I trust you were able to get on to play.    We offer apples in our lobby 24 hours a day on the table beside the Concierge desk.  We also offer coffee in the morning and infused water in the lobby daily along the side table.  The flavor changes daily.  The pool is 76 feet in length and adjacent to the beach which is 1250 feet long.  We also have a second smaller pool available at our Marina at Harborside.   Again, thank you for your review and I hope you will consider a return trip to the Resort. Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: An excellent choice for families!
review: My boyfriend and I met his parents down at long boat key club after a week in Orlando. My boyfriend and family have been staying at this hotel for at least 15 years so i knew I was in for a treat as they have excellent taste! From the moment we arrived to when we left, it was like being in heaven. We had a beautiful room, lovely bathroom and stunning beach views. We had breakfast on our balcony overlooking the pool and beach then we'd spend most of our day either at the pool or on the beach. We ate lunch at the pool most days which was delicious, extensive menu to choose from. I used the gym most mornings which is a short walk from the main hotel but lovely as you walk through the grounds of the hotel. Gym is well air conditioned and had up to date equipment. I visited the…

title: Sea, Sun, great golf, good restuarants and shopping
review: Dear FasionGirl2012  Wow, a  10 out of 10!!!  I’m so glad you enjoyed your first experience with us.  Hopefully we will become your regular vacation spot as we are with your boyfriend and his family.  The Gulf does make a wonderful backdrop for the weddings that we host here and I’m glad you enjoyed watching the activity.   Sounds like you made the most of our extensive amenities but still took the time to slow down and enjoy the sunset, wine and all.   Thank you again for your review and we look forward to seeing you in the future.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great Location, Minor annoyances
review: We stayed at Longboat Key Club from April 15-19.  Great facility in a great location, located right on the beach and near St. Armand's Circle. Like other folks who have posted, the issues I had with this place had to do with housekeeping and a nagging issue with the air conditioning.   Upon arrival, we went to our room and the place looked great, but at closer look, there was a stray, used Q-Tip on the floor of the bathroom and for some reason a crumpled can of Red Bull between the bed and end table.  We also had to call maintenance two days in a row to get the AC to work properly. While maintenance came quickly and addressed the issue, it was annoying.   Lastly, we called the first 2 nights to have a sleeper sofa made up for the night...the second night, housekeeping said there…

title: Amazing
review: Dear ChrisMigs65  I'm glad you feel we are a great facility and great location.    I am disappointed you had the housekeeping issues you had.  This is something we will review with our housekeeping department as our standard is not to have anything but a perfect room released for our guests.  I assure you this is not our norm and I would welcome the opportunity to discuss it with you further. A/C's are reviewed and repaired replaced as needed.  Thank you very much for being our guest.   My direct number is 941-387-1567.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Top notch relaxed country club
review: this is the best resort in the state of Florida there is so much to do for adults and kids (Beach,Pool,Hot Tub,Tiki Bar, Golf, Driving Range, and bike rentals) we enjoyed our stay so much it was outstanding. And the employees make it even better especially Karl (bartender) and Kathy (Waitress and Barefoot's Grill) they are great to the kids and adults

title: Great place for a business meeting
review: Dear Doug D  Wow – Thanks for the “Best Resort in Florida” comment.  We greatly appreciate you being with us and taking the time to review.  I have shared your comments with Karl and Kathy and they are glowing with pride. I agree that they are exceptional associates.   We look forward to seeing you on your next trip to the Resort and Longboat Key Club  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Great but could be amazing
review: My husband and I stayed here in March for 5 nights.  We went to Longboat because my husband is a swimmer and it is difficult to find a hotel with an olympic size pool.  So I thought the ocean would be flat enough to swim- but no such luck-ocean was choppy. Be that as it may, we ended up having a relaxed and very pleasant time.
