There is everything to do or nothing to do. Beach was white sugar sand and at the end so very private. Beautiful view. Food was decent and every day at lunch they had live music and every night live music in the lounge.  The staff is very reserved but they aim to please.  If you like Country Clubs, this is the place.

title: Great location on the beach
review: We (2 adults) stayed for 2 weeks in late March. Hotel is split into 6 blocks which bear more than a passing resemblance to multi-storey car parks (i.e. not very attractive superficially). Each contains a range of basic to 'suite' rooms - we suspect mostly privately owned and managed by the 'club'. Each offers some element of self-catering. We had a basic 'Guest Room' which includes a wet bar (small kitchen). c400 sq ft in total. Pool and beach view. We were visiting 'snowbird' friends who over winter in a condo 10 mins up the beach so didn't take advantage of this hotel's many facilities, including an attractive golf course ($40 per round including buggy hire and club rental after 1pm - great value). The beach-side location is excellent. Pool is relatively small and quite…

title: If your priorities are tennis and beach, a good place to consider
review: My wife and I spent a five day getaway at Longboat Key Club & Resort.  Our number one consideration was the quality of the tennis program, as our goal was to escape New Hampshire's weather and play a lot!  We had only heard about Longboat Key and never spent any time in the general area, so it was all new to us.  We viewed this is an alternative to staying and playing in Naples.  The tennis facility is a three mile drive from the main resort.  You can drive yourself, or if you are patient, wait for transportation provided by the resort.  Not expecting this, at first I was a little put out.  In the end, the three mile drive was no problem at all.  We had a rental car and it was easy to get to.    The tennis facility is the nicest I have ever been too where I was able to play. …

title: Nice with teens
review: I took my 13 year old son to Longboat Key to spend time with some classmates on spring break. The resort is nice, the pool area is somewhat small for the size of the resort and the poolside restaurant is average.  The rooms were clean and it was nice to have a kitchenette.  I enjoyed the restaurant at the golf club/spa which is a short walk from the entrance of the hotel and found that the food options here were much healthier.  Spa was OK with great options, however, the spa receptionist didn't seem overly friendly or pleasant.  The beach in front of the hotel is beautiful and it was nice to be able to grab a kayak or paddleboard and just head out a short distance to the water.  I would recommend this resort to families.  If you want a romantic getaway, I think there may be…

title: A Gulf Coast Gem
review: The Longboat Key Club and Resort is situated directly on the  Gulf Of Mexico with a wide expanse of beach and magnificent water views. Long Boat Key is a barrier island situated just north of Sarasota and is only  20 minutes from the heart of downtown Sarasota,. You can use Sarasota Airport ( 25 minutes) or Tampa International airport  ( 1 hr. 15 minutes) to travel there, The resort consists of  5 low rise condominium type buildings with 1, 2, or 3 bedrooms, all have balconies or terraces. The buildings and units are impeccably maintained with upscale furnishings and amenities. Wi fi is even available on the beach and the large pool area. There are 5 restaurants available for guests ranging from the upscale Sands Point in the hotel to pool side  dining  at Barefoot's.  Two 18 …

title: wonderful
review: This was our second trip to this great resort. We had a two bedroom suite on the third floor. Went with family and enjoyed every minute.. The condo like property have rooms with all facilities..Modern, Clean.and well managed. We ate both on and off the property as local retaurants are pretty good. Fabulous beach. Friendly staff.. Not cheap but worth the money. St amands Circle just a short drive. Tennis and golf if you want too. This will be our regular end of summer spot..

title: Fantastic Girls Getaway!
review: Good location, food and service were great! We'll be back! Very relaxing! Pleasantly surprised with how nice the whole experience turned out! The only thing we have to complain about is there wasn't any jet skis to rent. Otherwise I would recommend highly!

title: Repeat Visit for Spring Break
review: We have Stayed at LBK club resort visiting family for over 20 years.  The hotel is the best opiton on Longboat and has great options of Tennis, Golf, Beach and Pool which make for a great array of activity for a family.   The resort is tired, both in physical appearance and in service.  It is clean and has all the ammentities, but really needs a face lift and finishing school for a lot of the staff on service.   Again, the location is fantastic as is the setting, but there is room for improvement. The rates are not commnensurate with the level of accomodations or service.

title: GREAT PLACE
review: This hotel is very clean and has everything for to enjoy a good time:  the most gorgeous beach at the golf of Mexico, nice pool and great restaurants for a family o a romantic dinner.  The location is also convenient for shopping and restaurants.

title: Property has gone downhill
review: I am so sad to be writing this review because I have been visiting the Longboat Key Club annually for five years and always had a good experience.  I am sorry to say that this property has gone downhill since new management took over last year.  My husband and I checked in for a few days for leisure.  The rooms were dirty, the service was terrible and the overall experience was so drastically different from previous years that we almost checked out of the hotel.  The rooms are in dire need of refurbishment, but at the very least the hotel should get a cleaning crew in there and give each room a deep cleaning. There was dust everywhere:  behind the beds, in the drawers, behind the night tables and on the mattress (I checked).  I have included pictures of the drawers (notice the…

title: Needs Updating
review: Room was a nice size with microwave and refrigerator.  On first entering the room looked really nice but after being there a few days it became apparent that it needed to be updated.  The beds were really hard and uncomfortable and had to call for a foam pad to be put on the bed.  Also found cheerios behind the night stand when I plugged in my charger.

title: Location Location!!
review: This hotel has a great location! Very clean. Only thing it is need of updating. Still in the 80's. Rooms are big. Staff is very nice and helpful. Registration gal upgraded us to a suite which was very nice to have two seperate rooms with kids.

title: Great Beach and Tennis Center
review: Second visit here.  Club suites are perfect for 2 (bathrooms a little dated but fine).  Ocean view is spectacular--breakfast on the balcony was perfect (made our own--Publix is right up the road a few miles - near the tennis center). Housekeeping was excellent--no issues at all.  Easy to arrange tennis lesson and matches with a little notice. Lunch at tennis center was fine.  Pool area tends to get crowded, especially with families, but plenty of room in pool and jacuzzi.  Towels are plentiful and beach set up crew very pleasant.  Short drive to downtown Sarasota where there is a good choice of restaurants and theater.  Overall a great vacation week at a very comfortable venue.

title: Wow, were we disappointed this time!
review: We have been long time fans of the LBKC & this resort has been one of our favorite Florida properties.  We've stayed here for years, usually in the two bedroom suite for two weeks at a time. This time we stayed in a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen. The balcony & views are beautiful & the room is well appointed but wear & tear that  should be easily fixed is really showing. The resort is in a good location & offers free beach set up which is a plus.  BUT....it seems that this resort is really declining in customer service. I was absolutely embarassed that we had recommended this to friends that came with us as well & reserved a two bedroom.  Each day our room was literally left dirty after house keeping. We had never had this problem in all of the years of visiting. We had…

title: Great place to "slip" in for the night
review: We moored our 37' sailboat there one night last November. I'm reviewing the Marina since the Maria itself does not have an identity of its own on Trip Advisor.  We were on our second day of a four-day sailing trip, bareboat starting in St. Pete. We found refuge in this little gem (well it's not little) and we very pleased. A little more costly than most of the Marinas we stayed at (our 37' Benetau cost about $125 for the night, others were about $80), but you get what you pay for and this place is one you could stay at for several nights and not get bored.  Let's talk basics. The Harbor Master (sorry can't remember her name) was very helpful at guiding us to the marina once we were within a nautical mile or so. She helped us dock and tie up, get electricity hooked up and we were…

title: A mixed bag
review: We stayed for 7 nights and overall we had a great time. The staff were friendly and helpful. The disappointment was the room in block 2. The views of the pool and beach were excellent but the bathroom was tiny and dated. The sink cupboard was dirty and had lots of signs of rust. We had a cockroach in the bathroom on the final day.  The cupboards in the bedroom were shabby and not at all what you would expect in this price range. The interconnecting door had no sound proofing so that we could hear the next door tv throughout our stay. The pool was lovely but the loungers quickly filled. The beach is fantastic and the resort grounds are excellent. The gym is good and would be brilliant if they had weight machines. Restaurants were mixed the pointe lounge and restaurant were good…

title: LBKC....Perfect Getaway
review: I have stayed at the Longboat Key Club many times and have always had a first class experience. From the moment that you drive through the gates you know that you are at someplace special. The staff is friendly, helpful and professional, from the front desk to the Concierge Gloria. I have stayed in several different locations within this condo resort hotel. The rooms are large and clean and the entire hotel has been recently updated. Breakfast is included with many of the packages and it is divine.   This is a first class property and not cheap and they do charge resort fees on top of your room charge. But the trip to the beach cant be beat, with everything already there at your fingertips.   The only downside to this property is the internet connection. Why they dont have…

title: Watch out for confusing room charges
review: Dear William15222:  Thanks for your review of your "Perfect Getaway".  You made Glorias day today reading your review and for that I thank you.  I'm glad you find the property special and appreciate you taking the time to review.   To your point on Wifi,  we have recently gone under contract with a company to upgrade our entire Wifi network and project the work to be completed over the next 30 days.  So in the near future, feel free to surf the net while on the balcony!!!  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Second visit-still one of our favorite resorts!
review: I stayed at the Longboat Key Club for 5 days in February. I was travelling with a group and received breakfast vouchers for all 5 mornings. The problem was check-out. I was charged for $200 for the drinks that our group enjoyed Friday night. I was also billed for breakfast that same morning, which was itemized under 'lunch'. I contested both charges and called our group's travel agent who then gave authorization to transfer the $200 charge to the master account. Then, just this morning, I was going over my credit card statement and noticed yet another charge for $6.00. This  was for 'telephone, online communications" for the day I was leaving. I did not recognize this charge and am in the process of having it removed from my credit card. Keep all your receipts!  I feel that the…

title: Paradise in Longboat Key
review: My wife and I just completed our second visit to the Longboat Key Club & Resort...we love staying there!  Unfortunately, Mother Nature didn't cooperate, as the temps were in the 50's-60's during our four day stay (still warmer than the weather we left back in cold, snowy Ohio).  We had reserved a one bedroom suite with a beach view, but learned at check-in that level of room wasn't available.  So we were upgraded to a two bedroom beach view suite in building two, overlooking the pool.  We love the layout of the suites...there is an abundance of living space.  The bedroom is large with lots of closet and dresser space.  The second sink/dressing area adjacent to the bathroom works out well for two people getting ready to start the day at the same time.  The washer/dryer unit is…

title: A Nice Choice
review: My family and I just returned from spending 4 nights during my son's Spring Break vacation at The Resort at Longboat Key Club. We stayed in the Deluxe 2 Bedroom suite (#2907) it was beautifully decorated, clean and well maintained. This size unit is more like a condo as it has a large living area, full kitchen, dining area, washer and dryer, 2 bedrooms and 2 large baths. The kitchen has granite countertops, dishwasher, microwave, and side by side refrigerator. There were snacks and beverages in the suite available for purchase. The pool and beach area were very nice. Towels and beach chairs are provided at no charge which was a big surprise to us since we are accustomed to paying $25/day for a beach set up. The only problem we had was with the poolside food service. We waited…

title: Overall a good experience-Kids Club not great
review: We had a 1 bedroom suite.  The room was nice, and our view was great.  The pool and beach are very nice, and the food at the hotel is very good.  The one downside was the Kids Club.  It was a huge disappointment.  The front desk could never give me information on the kids program and they were totally disinterested.  My child went 1 day, and they did very few activities outside.  Strange, since it was a beautiful day.  Also....the hotel internet service is terrible....almost impossible to check emails or do anything else on the computer.  That being said, I would stay here again.  I have been going to Longboat Key for many years, and it really is a beautiful spot.

title: Great site for a professional meeting!
review: Last week we held our medical conference at LBKC for the 3rd time. The resort is a great site for a small to medium sized group. We had a total of 80 attendees and vendors. The facilities, meeting rooms, reception areas and guest rooms are exceptional. The service is on point and the food is fabulous. The event staff are very accommodating. We are already planning our 4th meeting for next year!

title: Best getaway ever!
review: Dear ERFJennifer:  We appreciate your review of your meeting experience at the Resort at Longboat Key Club.  We greatly appreciate that you are planning for your 4th visit for next year.  Thanks for pointing out that we are a "Great Site for a Professional Meeting".     We recently remodeled our "Ringling Room" directly off the hotel lobby and it makes a great venue for meetings as functions.  We also have several other meeting/function options all through the Resort and Club including beachside, poolside, marina, tennis, etc.   Thank you again.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Beach Heaven
review: We just got back from our long getaway weekend at Longboat Key Club & Resort.  Our stressful lives needed a must deserved long weekend.  I can't say enough about our stay!  From the moment we arrived until our checkout, we enjoyed every minute of our stay.  The views were breathtaking, the room service and food were outstanding.  A special shout out to our new friend Bernard who couldnt do enough for us!!  We cannot wait to go back!  It's the PERFECT getaway destination!

title: Great location on the Key
review: This was my second trip to Longboat Key Club and Resort and I simply love staying there. The rooms are wonderful with the small kitchenettes and sitting areas. The balconies are large enough that you can actually enjoy your time out on them. The pool area and beach area are wonderful as well as the staff. Highly recommend staying here - the location is perfect - close to St. Armand's Circle and Sarasota, but far enough away that you can enjoy the peace and quiet.

title: Total relaxtion! Tennis and golf too!
review: If you want to stay at the most relaxing place in Florida, this is it! The west coast beaches are the best, the #1 rated beach in America is right around the corner, Siesta Key Beach. Here at LBK resort, they have #1 tennis facility in Florida. 25 Har Tru courts, match arranging, terrific pro's, oh and 2 challenging golf courses right on property. The pool is very nice, or go 20 yards further onto the beach. The best poolside bar with the best bartender Karl. He is a master mixer.

title: Beautiful inside and out.
review: Dear Bill M: I don’t think I can top your response of “If you want to stay at the most relaxing place in Florida, this is it!”, other than to simply say Thank You!    We greatly appreciate you and your family being our guest and look forward to seeing you again.  We have shared your comments with Tennis, golf and Karl the Bartender. Your comments mean the world to us.    Yours in Hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Overpriced, Average Resort Hotel
review: We stayed in  a suite which came very well equipped, and was beautiful, the inside and out, the view was to die for. Amex reserved the room which included $100. Spa and 40 breakfast The spa was clean and very nice. Had fruit and smoked salmon from room service which was very good.and quick.  Washer and drier in room was a nice touch, even though  a bit loud. All the staff was very friendly, spoke to you and was very helpful. Brought a extension cord to room in mins. The young man that helped with the luggage and parked car was very nice, the front desk knew me by name from check in.  The scallops&shrimp were cooked perfect, Caesar salad was one of the best ever had, white anchovies and capers, truffle mushroom soup  presented& tasted wonderful as was apple dessert, both a must…

title: The week day get away
review: Very disappointed. Not usually the type to pay close to the $389/night rate for a hotel but since it was my wife's 50th birthday, and the resort looked very good online, decided to give it a chance. My wife is really into tennis these days and the tennis program looked excellent. They have 20 clay courts which were very nice and well maintained. When my wife called, they assured her they would be ble to set her up with some matches with people with a similar skill level. She was also told there was a round robin  event Saturday afternoon after the clinic. They had a round robin but that was for members of the tennis club only. They had not set up any matches for her to play.  As a result, she attended a clinic, but got to play no matches.  We definitely would not have stayed…

title: Superb!!
review: Dear Danny: Thank you for taking the time to review our Resort. I am very sorry you did feel the value was there for you on this visit. Our Tennis Director or I would love to have the opportunity to speak with you about your wife’s experience as typically Tennis is a major highlight of our resort by our guests. You are correct in that we do not have Ice machines in the hallways as we offer ice makers in our Full size refrigerators in the suites and room service will deliver extra ice complimentary. I also appreciate your positive comments on the excellent service and friendly staff.  Hope you will come back to enjoy the view and we will be sure your tennis experience is perfect.  Yours in Hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Just Ordinary!
review: Really just an average place with well above average prices. The beach is gorgeous and our room was lovely (we had a jr. suite). The internet worked OK and the staff was fine...no problems at all...very cordial.   But this place really needs a refresh. It just looks and feels dated including the bathrooms, the lobby and the pool. And, despite other comments, I didn't see many kids or any kid friendly activities. I was hoping for more since we were looking for a place to have a family reunion...this just isn't it.

title: Good Staff, Property A Little Worn
review: We were here over New Year's. Staff generally tried hard but personnel a little uneven. Property is a bit worn/tired. Heard that there are new owners. Don't know, but saw that some renovation investment had started. Would suggest giving the resort some time to get its renovation projects further along. Location is great. Enjoyed the extensive golf facilities. Restaurants are ok.

title: fantastic hotel
review: we stayed at this hotel in February 2012 and it was fantastic the rooms are lovely and really spacious and the food was lovely. You can walk out from the hotel directly onto the beach. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Great Resort!
review: Dear KGraziose:  Thank you for the wonderful review.  We appreciate you continuing to be our guest at the Resort and hope we will see you again this year.   I have shared your review with our team and we appreciate the feedback.  Yours in hospitality,  Rick Benninghove, CHA Director of Resort Operations

title: What a boring Hotel-5 star? What a joke!
review: We love going to the Longboat Key Club Resort! The property is wonderful, the rooms and furnishings are beautiful and the staff is very accommodating! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a beach getaway!

title: Needs a major overhaul
review: We stayed here for winter holiday, after it was recommended by a number of people, the whole complex is only accessible through security gates, and then you head off to the resort, upon our arrival we had been allocated building 4. Our suite was overlooking the Gulf which was a very nice view, when we arrived in the room we found it to be a nice size with large bed and a corridor which led to the bathroom, the bathroom was quite disappointing as it was dated and very small, the bath was particularly useless as nothing more than a shower, the toilet was squeezed into a narrow space, I do not expect to fight with towels and toilet roll holders when I pay this amount of money. We settled down for the night as it had been a long journey, then we noticed the aircon which was very…

title: A great place to stay!
review: This is a really beautiful property, with a gorgeous stretch of beach and all the beach amenities needed.   All the rooms look out over the Gulf of Mexico, with spectacular views of the sunsets.  The upgrade to the one-bedroom apartments ("suites") is really worth it.   These enclaves are beautifully furnished, with fully-equipped kitchens and excellent in-room coffee.   Everyone is friendly, professional, and helpful, and the property does a lot to maintain a green footprint on this stunning part of the world.   It's very convenient to St. Armand's Circle, and then into the rest of Sarasota.  The place is kept immaculate and up-to-date.   If your travels take you to this area, this is the place to stay.

title: Expensive but lovely
review: An excellent place to stay if you are not on a budget. Rooms are well appointed with mini refrig coffee maker and microwave. Ours faced the ocean which gave us perfect sunsets. We stay for the tennis which is off site but worth the 5 min drive. Outstanding courts with the friendliest club director we have met (Sue). If you love tennis this is worth every dime. Bring extra money for the pro shop. Beautiful tennis outfits for men and women. We come back every year.

title: Wrok hard, play hard too
review: Dear Jennifer:  Thank you for the wonderful review.  Your room-type was our guest room with the mini-fridge and I’m happy to hear you found it well appointed.  All of our other suites offer a full size refrigerator and kitchens. Sue in tennis is amazing and we will be sure to recognize her for your thoughtful comments.  Our guests truly enjoy what our Tennis center has to offer. You mention the tennis center being offsite, but it is within the Longboat Key Club and Resort in our Harborside location.  Longboat Key Club and Resort has been named the #1 Tennis Resort on the Gulf Coast of Florida - and one of the Top Ten Tennis Resorts in America - by Tennis Magazine in 2012.   We look forward to seeing you again next year.  Yours in Hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort rick.benninghove@longboatkeyclub.com

title: Excellent Stay
review: This was a business trip for me but the hotel location and amenities made me wish that I was on vacation. good value, a little on the expensive side, staff always willing to assist. plenty to do nearby. Fly into sarasota airport if you can, tampa is further away and cost more to get there.

title: very nice resort
review: We were at LBK for a weddiing. While I have to say this is a rather expensive resort .........eveything was done very well. The room was very spacious and clean, with very nice toiletries that were larger size than the usual. Loved have the washer/dryer in the room.The pool is a little on the small side but very nicely maintained. The beach was awesome. The only downside was bug bites ..........almost everyone had them .........some much worse than others.People got them outdoors and were told they were  'no see ums' and we didn"t. Apparently you need bug spray,as well as sunscreen. That being said it was a wonderful trip.........

title: Great beach.... Sequested island!
review: Great shallow beach with very powdery soft white sands.  Excellent views... Room 3504 beachfront on building 3 very well kept, modern Parking is a very accesssible, no need for valet Wi-fi, beach lounges included in resort fee.. Service fees [tip] should not be an automatic 20%... I would recommend 15% if automatic and the customer can add more depending on satisfaction. Pool  too small for resort and very bland... otherwise pool area is acceptably nice. I would have given a 5 if it was not for the pool. 4.5 is my final grade.

title: Amazing resort. Best hotel of our trip.
review: Stayed only 3 nights during our 2 week Florida vacation (Orlando, Sarasota, then St Pete's Beach). This hotel and beach were so good it basically ruined our St Pete's stay. If you have a choice, pick Longboat Key!!  The whole area of Sarasota, St Armands Circle, and Longboat was really nice. It was quiet, clean, and classy throughout. The resort itself was really large, split over two locations 3 miles apart.. be aware of this when booking your room. We booked a Beach View Suite which was superb. Really spacious, great views, nice balcony, and large fridge freezer meaning we drank frozen cocktails watching sunset.  Bedbugs. Previous reviewers hinted at bedbugs. This worried us due to previous experiences. We didn't experience any bed bugs (and we checked thoroughly), but we did…

title: Nice place to stay and relax.
review: Deluxe 2 bdrm units have gorgeous views.  Beach service is wonderful.  Chairs and umbrellas were included with the resort fee.  Servers were attentive and quickly brought food and drinks.  I would recommend LB Key Club.  The resort is 30 years old and they have done a wonderful job maintaining the property.

title: Best resort in Florida
review: The Longboat Key Club is wonderful. The suites are clean, spacious and comfortable. The full kitchen is perfectly equipped.  The bed is so comfortable you won't want to get up but you will because you don't want to miss the beautiful pool area and beach area.   The staff are friendly, professional and very personable. Always helpful and greet you with a smile and by name. They are willing to help in any way.  The beach area is great. They set up your chairs and umbrella where you want it.  I cannot say enough about this resort. I look forward to my next trip.

title: Nice property, but quite pricey
review: We stayed at this resort in July for a wedding.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom room and it was very nice.  Decor was modern and updated and it was nice to have a washer and dryer in the unit.  We had a large balcony that extended the entire length of the unit, with access from both bedrooms and the living room area.  There was also a small balcony that came off of one of the bathrooms in the front.   The grounds of the resort were very well kept and the beach was beautiful, although there was a lot of sea weed that week.  However, everyone in our party made comments on how dissappointed they were with the pool area.  For a resort of this size, I would expect a MUCH larger pool area.  It is just one large, square pool.  For the money you are spending to stay here, I would have…

title: Great.Great.Great.
review: The have an awesome pool , a restaurant and of course the beach. The Beach is beautiful. The rooms are great (the suit is the BEST) They have the driving range there , Tennis , and a relaxing hot tub. I don't think it's possible to get bored at this hotel. The last time I stayed was around September 2010. I just selected 2012 because it wouldn't go back to 2010.

title: Great position, a little jaded!
review: We spent 7 nights here with a 16 year old in tow for a bit of relaxation after Disney! Great position as a very short drive (5 mins or so) into St Armands Circle and a pretty quick drive into Sarasota proper - I would suggest that a car is a must for getting around. The hotel is OK but is nothing exceptional, it's a bit jaded  - the pool area is tatty, new furniture, parasols and a new bar itself wouldn't go amiss although the pool is fine! The hotel restaurant was exceptionally quiet so we decided to give it a miss but breakfast and lunches were very good (top tip - share a maincourse at lunchtime as the portions are huge!) We had a huge 'room', better described as an 'apartment'  - huge balcony overlooking the sea with furniture, nice and quiet, very comfortable bed, good…

title: Wonderful anniversary weekend!
review: My husband and I were searching for a weekend FL beach location since we live in the Midwest. This hotel fit the bill. We loved our room, pool and beach. The rooms were very clean and stylish. The beach has wait staff which will bring you food and drinks which allowed us to really relax. We also spent a lot of time paying golf and tennis. The Longboat Key Tennis Gardens was so accommodating. The tennis concierge matched me up as a single while my husband played golf, with a group of ladies for doubles. They have a beautiful facility with hard and clay courts. My only caution is the hotel does not endorse restaurants were they do not have a partnership, so the concierge staff will push certain restaurants and not others. Just use Tripadvisor to find a place to eat. All in all a…

title: Disappointing hotel
review: Stayed here in August for 4 nights, the hotel is in a nice location, and the beach is gorgeous but for the money and it being a five star we won't go again. Good: view from the room was beautiful looking out over the Gulf. Upgraded us to a suite after our night of hell with the aircon unit. Felt very safe with our daughter who is six.  The bad bits Needs modernising from the outside, 4 grey blocks of concrete looking from the beach. Huge air conditioning unit sits inside the room in a vented cupboard, didn't notice it when we popped in and out during the first day, but at night!!!! Imagine yourself just drifting off in your bed to sleep and someone starts a jet engine up as the air on fan kicks in to cool the room down every 20 minutes or so, my wife jumped through the roof…

title: Another Great Stay!
review: This was our 5th stay and the resort never disappoints.  Consistently great service from all staff, impeccably clean accommodations, and delicious food make Longboat Key Club one of our most favorite places to stay.  You can't beat the location, directly on the beach.  Our favorite are the "club suites" with lots of extra space - huge patios, full sized kitchen table, washer/dryer, and a gigantic bathroom.  Although we enjoy the gulf view (beachfront) accommodations, we prefer the bay view rooms.  The bay is full of manatees and jumping fish, it's fun to watch! Oh, and plenty of covered parking at this resort, at no extra charge.

title: Average, overpriced hotel. Great location.  Beware of bed bugs!
review: Dear Kris:  Thank you for taking the time to review the Longboat Key Club and Resort and for returning to be with us for your 5th visit.  We are an easy drive from Orlando and I’m glad you continue to find your way to our paradise.   Our visiting Manatees are a beautiful sight to see from the Lagoon (Bay) View buildings. Even they love the turquoise waters of Longboat Key.  We hope to see you again soon.  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations Longboat Key Club and Resort

title: Enjoyable stay
review: Stayed here from 8/28-9/4.  The hotel is in a great location on a gorgeous beach but that's all it has going for it.  Way too much per night for what it is.  In fact ridiculously overpriced, $1900.00 for 7 nights and that includes nothing, plus they charge $14/day "resort fee".  The property is old and dated, room was ok, nothing special, although the shower (water pressure) was the best of any hotel we've been to before.  Very loud AC when it kicks on.  Pool area is very simple, service is inconsistent.  Food and drinks very expensive with an automatic 20% gratuity charged.  On the last day there, only one server was walking around and never came up to ask if we wanted anything, I ended up going to order lunch for my children directly at the bar.  After a long while of waiting…

title: Worst experience ever
review: Spent 4 nights in a huge 2 Bedroom Suite with a superb sea view and on the whole, it was very enjoyable. The accomodation was enormous and good value for the price, with a huge balcony.  The beach and pool were both super and we found all the staff that we encountered to be very friendly and efficient. The property is let down a little however, by its antique air conditioning. Clearly it's an older resort, and after the first night you do get used to the noise, but the sound of a small airplane taking off in the lounge area shouldn't be acceptable for a resort of this stature. Fix that and I'd not hesitate to return.

title: Bed Bugs
review: I drove 2 1/2 hours to get there and found out after I walked into the room they screwed my reservation up. Went to the front and ask for a change and was basically told I was out of luck. I even had my confirmation number which they said was wrong(they emailed it to me) I left pissed off and drove 2 1/2 hours home never to return again.

title: Fabulous
review: We had a beachfront, two bedroom two bath with a wrap around terrace.  Beautifully furnished and exceptionally clean.  Perfect kitchen.  Perfect in every way.  Love the Spa and the lotion used.  Our apartment was furnished in a sleek modern style we both like.

title: Nice but dated
review: Longboat Key was nice but dated. Something was biting us on the beach not sure what it was.We were getting red bumps on our legs. Our rooms were clean but dated and not as roomy as I would have thought. Service was very good but not excellant.  I'm rating this resort against the Casa Marina in Key West and Casa far exceed this resort. Our views were excellant just like the Casa was but the beach staff wasn't as attentive nor was the pool staff. Pricing was a bit less here than Casa.

title: Great family resort
review: This was our first stay at the hotel.  It has a great location on the beach and is a short ride from the Sarasota Airport, Mote Marine Acquarium, St Armand's Circle and other local attractions. Our room was surprisingly spacious and very clean, with a small kitchen sufficient for a light breakfast or lunch. We were a little concerned before we arrived about a few of the reviews commenting on poor service, but our experience was very positive, even though we checked in on a weekend when the hotel was fully occupied. Everyone was friendly and helpful, and the front desk was very accomodating when we asked to move to a different building after the weekend crowd checked out.  The beach is great and very close to an inlet that provided great fishing for my son.  The beach attendants…

title: fabulous
review: we vistited the resort on the 10th july this year, this was our second visit to long boat key club, and again we weren't disappointed.The apartments are  fabulous with everything you need if you want to cook. we ate most of the time in st armands circle where you have every type of restuarant you would want, our favourite was the italian, pizzas fantastic .We also went into siesta keys which is only 20 mins drive away and again plenty bars and restuarnts..  i would recommend this hotel for couples and families as there is plenty to do here.

title: Excellent beach-front resort.
review: Clean, modern and spacious rooms. Nice on site restaurants and bar. Excellent private beach with servers and beach cannopies. Will defenitely go back. It is a little expensive but it's worth the money..!

title: Wow has this place slipped in quality!!!
review: This is my fourth or fifth time staying at this hotel... but the last time was 8 or 9 years ago.  There's been a marked slip in service here!  Setting is of course gorgeous, but room was not ready at nearly 4 pm, and the check in staff was very unworried about that.  No housekeeping showed up... when I called close to 3 pm, phone rang many times and was finally answered by a different department.  Unapologetic, said they could clean till 5 (and that I could request a time - which would have been good to be told before I checked in), but at that point I wanted to rest and said not to bother.... so of course, who knocked on the door an hour later!  This used to be a top notch place in terms of service and cleanlliness.  Front door stained by sunscreened arms, dirt in crevices in…

title: What happened?
review: Stayed at LBK Club in early July.  This was our fifth visit and hands down our most disappointing. Where to begin?  From the diffident staff, to the rooms that were never cleaned properly, to the overall sense that our (repeat) business was not valued.  The last straw was when I tried to reserve for the July 4 bbq on the beach-- concierge informed us "sorry, we're full."  Would have been nice to be told about special events when I contacted the hotel 2 weeks prior--or even when we checked in.  Prior to our arrival at LBK Club we had stayed at the Peabody in Orlando.  It was our first visit to that hotel -- a much larger hotel-- where we could have easily been forgotten; however, much better service at 1/3 the price.  For years we raved about LBK Club to friends/colleagues.  Its…

title: Paradise and fun.
review: I have stayed at the LBK Club a few times.  My folks lived there and we stayed for big birthdays when we all could not fit in their apartment.  I wish I lived at the LBK club.  It is beautiful with a wonderful beach and great food.  You can sit on the Gulf of Mexico all day watching the dolphins, while a waitress or waiter walks by to take your "lunch" or "snack" order.  It feels completely decadent.  The rooms are huge and comfortable and the first time I saw where we were staying I gasped.  Highly recommend for a wonderful time.

title: Horrible check in service. They booked us on the wrong room & wouldn't help accommodate us in the correct room. Very rude servic
review: They booked us on wrong room & when we noticed they wouldn't accommodate us at all. Management & front desk were very rude. Lido Beach resort next time for sure! Much nicer staff !!! Never coming here again. We are repeated customers and to see the poor customer service this time we will not come again nor will we recommend it to our clients .

title: One of the best resort hotels in the USA
review: Our second visit to this resort hotel, and we left there having had another great time. How people mark this hotel with 1 star amazes me, they obviousy have no understanding of how great this place is. The rooms are clean, and are attended to every day. The staff are great and very helpful, its always good to see that the staff that we met two years ago are still working there. Its a great place for families, and a great location with many good restaurants only a 5 minite drive away. The Tennis facilities are world class, with excellent coaches (Thanks Ron and Maraj) and myself and my daughter really enjoyed making use of the tennis facilites. The pool area is very socialable, and its sssssooooooo nice to be on that beach. We will be back!

title: Fantastic view and great amenities
review: This is our third time coming to Longboat Key Club and Resort and we always enjoy it here. The accommodation is right on the beach so you can hear the waves lapping in from the Gulf as you sit on your beautiful deck overlooking the beach after a hard days sun bathing !!!!!!. We also really appreciated that the staff let us avail of an early check in although we know this depends on availability. The suites have a full kitchen so you can eat at home if you wish, however, there are wonderful restaurants nearby. We did not eat at the resort restaurant, but the menu was really good and we plan to eat here when we next come. The resort is one of only two hotels in Log Boat Key offering short term bookings and so for a short term break to the beach when vacationing in Orlando, this…

title: Treated very nicely upon arrival and all positive comments throughout our stay
review: We were greeted at our car when we arrived and several guys came right out and opened our car doors for us when we left to park our car.  We were upgraded from a club suite to a one bedroom suite which was beautiful!  2 sliding doors that opened to full length deck overlooking the gulf.  Full size kitchen with everything you need in it.  We had a massage beachside which was wonderful, very nice experience.

title: Terrible experience
review: If you're from Florida you will be disappointed. The rooms are like an old style holiday inn. Pool is tiny and the beach is rough. Siesta key is right next door and ten times better. This is all based on the price of $300 a night.   We woke up on our first morning of vacation to a business meeting of loud people at 7 a m next door.  Terrible

title: A tale of two hotels...
review: I stayed recently for 5 nights at this hotel with my wife and 2 children whilst on holiday in Florida. First the positives... a fantastic location right on the beach with clear blue water and white sands, big rooms which are well equipped with great views over the sea, lagoon or golf course ( we stayed in the lagoon room ). Very close to St Armands Circle (5 mins by car) which is superb for shopping and restaurants, there are free courtesy shuttles around the resort too. On to the negatives... the customer service was very poor indeed, the housekeeping was terrible, in fact the first night didn't see the room cleaned at all, we were then short on towels and had substandard cleaning even after a couple of complaints. The air con in the room was faulty and it took 3 reports and 2…

title: Heaven!
review: Been going there for nearly 20 years. Its a little piece of heaven on earth. Amazing location, fantastic white sandy beach  and warm water of the gulf. Great seafood in Armand circle--- Crab & Fin and for special occasions--- Chart house lonlongboat key drive.

title: Exceptional!!  Can't wait to return...
review: Stayed here with my wife and son in May of 2012.  We had an incredible stay.  This resort is a gem.  The room was fantastic.  Extremely comfortable bed.  Huge covered deck with lounge chairs and a table for 4.  Living area and kltchenette.  The bathroom was huge.  Plenty of closet space.  I really can't say enough about the room.  The location of our building was just a short walk to the beach/pool area.  The food on the resort is very good.  We had some fantastic meals during lunch, pool-side.  It's rare, that a lunch menu will have this level of food quality and vareity.  The pool area was well kept and never felt crowded.  The beach is gorgeous, with plenty of chairs with attached cabanas.  The beach also never felt crowded.  They have wait staff available all afternoon right…

title: Good But Not Great
review: The Longboat Key Club & Resort is a sprawling property with a great location on the beach only 5 minutes from St. Armand Circle and 10 minutes from downtown Sarasota. The hotel buildings are typical Florida beach buildings that are aging somewhat but the rooms have been modernized to include tile shower enclosures and floors, granite sink tops and updated furniture in the bedroom. However, attention to detail is not up to the standards of other west coast Florida properties in this price range. For example, the coffee pot had a hole in the filter which allowed coffee grinds to seep into the cup; only powdered dairy products were offerred even though the room was equipped with a refrigerator. The room safe was not working. The freezer portion of the refrigerator unit was not…

title: Great Room - poor kids club
review: Spacious room and well equipped kitchen with top appliances. Very confortable bed, spotless bathroom, good size seating area and fantastic balcony where you can have your breakfast overlooking the gulf. Kids club w indoor only activities :-( Library w books and dvds to borrow. Cozy little Longboat Key a short drive away w a few stores and nice seafood restaurants.

title: Fun time with the family or as a couple
review: My wife and I have been to the LBK Club twice now.  Once as a couple in May 2011 and most recently with our 3 year old.  Both experiences were fantastic.    Rooms The first trip we stayed in a unit toward the end of the building.  The living area and kitchen are quite a bit larger than a middle unit.  The great thing about the LBK Club is that all of the suites have views of the Gulf.  This trip, we were in a middle unit--4 adults, 2 kids--and it was roomy enough.  The bedrooms are nice as well, each one having it's own bathroom and walk in closet.  Many dressers as well.  TVs were a bit small, but nothing to complain about as TV watching was last on our list.  One room had a King bed, the other two twins.  Would like to see a unit with a king bed in each bedroom, however.   …

title: No stress!
review: Stayed here with our kids and a few other couples. This is the first time my stress level has been so low while at the beach. They provide chairs, cabanas, umbrellas so you don't have to bring anything. Pool was a great option too. Beach was very private. Rooms were clean, decent size plus had a small kitchen so was easy to store snacks and drinks. Great experience. A little expensive but worth it for a fun weekend.

title: Enjoyed Our Stay!
review: Hubby and I traveled to LBKC July 6-8. This resort is in a great location, very close to Lido Beach, St. Armand's Circle, and downtown Sarasota. Check in was a breeze and the reception staff were very friendly and welcoming. There is free self-parking (a nice plus), but a bellman will be happy to help you with your luggage if you need assistance. The service we encountered during our stay was above-par the entire weekend. Everyone, from waitstaff to shuttle drivers to the guys at the beach kiosk, were warm and friendly. We had a beach view club suite, which is ideal if you will be staying for any length of time. The suites have a nice kitchenette, fully stocked with everything you would need to cook. There is a tea kettle, full size coffee maker, blender, toaster, stove top,…

title: Beautiful resort but very expensive
review: Absolutely beautiful resort, we just couldnt get over the price of food and drinks. $12 well brand drinks plus ths automatic 20% service charge, so I am tipping the server $5 for 2 drinks. We decided to eat in the hotel bar for a late dinner, the server was great but $18 for 4 slivers of tuna is just outrageous after 3 appetizers and some wine, minus $200 we went to bed hungry. I would suggest staying here and enjoy the grounds but bring your own food or drive off property for food. The pool area was great , the outside bar servers were very attentive. We booked a suite with a king size bed which was great, large room that was clean and had a kitchen with a beautiful view.

title: Wonderful resort on a gorgeous stretch of beach
review: My husband and I and our 2 children (20 and 17) stayed here for 2 nights from June 27-29. Check in was quick and easy, and they had our room ready early. We stayed in a Club Suite room with a gorgeous view of the ocean from our balcony. The king size bed was comfortable, as was the pull-out couch and we also had a rollaway. Room size was great, and having the small kitchenette was a plus. The resort had mostly families with kids of all ages during our stay.   Longboat Key is a beautiful area and while walking the beach in the morning, there was hardly anyone around. The condos that line the beach are primarily inhabited by those who live there part of the year during the winters. We just missed Tropical Storm Debby, so there was a bit of seaweed here and there and the water…

title: Life is Good Here!
review: You can't go wrong here! Ive stayed several times, with kids and without, its my fav hotel in FL. The rooms are huge, plush, the pool is nice, the beach is perfect. Its a piece of paradise!

title: We love this property
review: A beachfront room at Longboat Key Club is a great choice of places to stay.  There are excellent restaurants in the area.  The hotel staff is attentive.  The property is clean and comfortable and the views are great.

title: 5 STARS
review: Attended a business conference recently and stayed for one night. The third floor room in building three faced the pool and the gulf. Outstanding view. The balconey is huge with a round table and chairs along with a lounge chair. Nice to have coffee on the balconey in the morning overlooking the water. The super cleanbedroom is very large with a galley kitchen with stove, mic, great coffe maker, powder creamer which i don't like,  and a real size frig. Bathroom has a tiled tub/shower with grab bars, safer for you in a strange place, large shower head and place to sit at the end of the tub. A lot of plush towels. sink in tub room and also outside the bath door is another long counter and mirror with one sink. All marble like counters. A lot of light in that area so you can see…

title: Great resort
review: Loved the resort. Staff couldn't have been more professional, pleasant or helpful. Our beach suite was immaculate with every amenity possible. Beautiful beach with cabanas which were gratis unlike most resorts. Close to St. Armands Circle, restaurants and shopping. Will definitely go back.

title: Holding on because of the view
review: I have stayed at this resort 3 times in the last 4 years.  I can honestly say it is located in one of the best locations you can find on the gulf side and close to St. Armands Circle where you can find shops, restaurants, and other retail.  The hotel itself sits in a perfect area for clean post-card worthy beach views and sunsets.  All rooms face the water (from what I can tell) and you won't be disappointed with the layout.  However, there is a lot lacking about the rest of the hotel in service.  In my opinion, when you come to a resort you want service.  Your money goes towards the access of these services and you want them staffed when the time comes.  Closing down a pool side bar at 7:00pm before the sunset, locking up a halfway house on a golf course by 3, and not offering…

title: Grossly overpriced. Old and horrible pool. Rip off!!!! There are so many better options for the price!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: This place is so over priced. I would recommend staying somewhere else. It's an old building and the pool is old and packed and it's just old and you an stay so many better places for the money. It's only worth paying under $200 nt and that's being generous. The only plus is you get a kitchenette but for the price ditch that and go somewhere more beautiful and new and have someone serve you at an upscale luxury resort. For the same price!!!

title: Spectactular beach, OK resort
review: We visited Longboat Key Club & Resort during a mid-week in early June 2012. We stayed in a club suite which is a one room studio with a king sized bed and sofa sleeper. We were located in Building 2 which had a great view of the gulf and was convenient to the pool, the beach, the main restaurant and lobby. Self- parking was plentiful and was close to the suite. It was clear from everyone we talked to that coming midweek was great since the resort was not full, so there were no crowds anywhere in the resort. The suite was clean and reasonably well kept, not modern but adequate, with a nice view of the pool and beach.   The hotel is in an outstanding location at the south end of Longboat Key, which puts it just a few minutes drive from Lido Key and Saint Armands Circle, and only…

title: Incredible
review: We stay at a two bedroom suite guau so big !! The resort is great. Checkin very easy they were waiting us. The pool ok and the beach... I have no words. Im from argentina and i recommed this resort

title: Nice Location, staff needs some improvement
review: My wife and i recently returned here for our anniversary.  We have also visited this property several times over the past ten years. So we are very familiar with LBK club.  First the good stuff - we had a romantic private dinner on the beach.  The food came from the main restaurant in the hotel.  Quality was excellent, menu was very appealing.  The service was also above average.  we were quite pleased with the dining experience and i would rate it a 4.5 out of 5.0.  The rooms were also very clean and have great views of the Gulf.  They are pretty average in terms of decor/appearance.  The issue is really the accomodating, or lack there of, nature of the staff.  My wife has had several issues with multiple charges (amounting to over $500) that they kind of shrug off and say…

title: Excellent
review: We just got back from 4 nights at the resort. The staff was very attentive and our room was spotless.We love the beach service as it all comes with the cost of the room.We stayed in Bldg # 2 and it was very quiet there. It overlooked the pool with a view of the ocean.We ate Breakfast every morning here and it was Great.We ate our dinners elsewhere as there are so many choices nearby. Great area for 4 day vacation.

title: great with very few hickups
review: the room is nice and the location is great! the personal very friendly and helpful. wi-fi is a problem....! must be solved! the room was never cleaned properly......, but it might be just the odd cleaning-lady.... third problem is the lack of sun on the balcony of the rooms in block 3! the resto is beautiful.... just the food is dreadfuland the cocktails even worse :-( but on the whole....very nice!! just go out for dinner

title: You will be nickel and dimed!!!!
review: I just came back from Longboat Key (May 26-28).  The place is very nice, the rooms are like any average room at a resort (unless you get the suite, which is quite lovely).  I must insist that you RENT A CAR if you stay at this hotel.  The price of food is ridiculous!!!!  Pina Colada's cost $12 (after they add the gratiuity in, which is added to EVERYTHING). Also, everything is added onto your room card, so if a person is not paying attention by the end of your stay you can have a monstrous bill.   That's why I HIGHLY recommend getting a rental, so you can go off site to other restaurants in the area as well as buying groceries (if you have a family, you can SAVE big time).  I will give credit where credit is due, the staff was very friendly and accomodating.

title: Lovely Property
review: We held our annual convention at the LBKC in April. From start to finish the event was top notch. Our rooms were very well appointed and very clean; the food is overpriced but St. Armands Circle is nearby so you have many other options available. As some of the other reviewers noted, we also had a couple of problems with the staff being snooty but most were helpful and courteous. All of our attendees enjoyed it so much that we plan to return in 2014.

title: Wonderful Service, but the rooms need a little TLC
review: We just returned from a getaway weekend with my husband and our 3 year old son.  We stayed in a 2 BR Deluxe on the gulf.   The PROS:   The rooms were huge, kitchen was large and the balcony was huge.  Lots of closet space too.   Everyone on the resort was extremely friendly.  I looooooved their service - everyone said hello to you, smiled at you and waited on you hand and foot.     The beach was wonderful.  We had no problems getting chairs at the beach or the pool.    The pool was a good size - lots of kids and parents.    The pool bar was nice, good drinks.  CONS:  The room while spacious, could use TLC.  The carpet needed to be cleaned and fixed - there was a huge piece of carpet pulling up in the main walk area.  It looked a bit dingy.   Like others have said, lots of hand…

title: BEWARE OF THE MOLD!
review: I really wanted to LOVE this resort as we carefully planned our 25th anniversary, birthday & Mother's Day trip here. If I had read the reviews here first about it being old & tired, loud ac unit, worn out light fixtures, and some snotty staff I would have thought twice about it. The HVAC units are so old and LOUD! After enduring a horrible musty odor coming from the vents my husband removed the HVAC filters. The amount of mold growing all over the unit made me gag. We were stunned & shocked that a place this expensive would allow this to happen. We have pictures of it and posted it to Yelp.  They cleaned it but we never used the unit again because that didn't solve the problem. Mold is dangerous & I still have 3 coughing children to prove it. If they have to see a Dr. Longboat…

title: Great quick weekend though a bit pricey
review: Trying to make the most of a quick weekend with family while my husband was at a business meeting, we stayed 2 nights at the Longboat Key Club in a 2 bedroom suite with my son and his 3 children.  Everything was close to perfect!  At close to $500 a night, it was not exceptionally high considering the expanse of the room we had.  However, this was low season!  Still, it was a great weekend.  The room had room service, the balcony wrapped around the whole suite and overlooked the Gulf and beach.  The balcony and the rooms were exceptionally safe for little ones.  The kitchen was fully equipped including a washer and drier.  The room included a cabana at the beach, bike rentals and for a reasonable fee, kayaks.  The beach was beautiful with sufficient shells to keep everyone…

title: Great Setting - Great Resort
review: I stayed at the Longboat Key Club & Resort in May 2012 and was very impressed by the place.  Unfortunately I had to spend much of my time in the conference room, but I did get to experience a bit of the resort in my spare time.  I stayed in a nice suite in building 6 which had a great view of the lagoon.  Rooms were nice and clean, although I could not get the TV remote to work.  Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  I also played a round of golf at their Harbourside Course.  The course was in pretty good shape (greens needed a little work).  The clubhouse was nice, but maybe a little understaffed.

title: Great way to spend out 50th Birthdays!
review: We spent this past weekend at the Longboat Key Club and had a great weekend.  We have been there several times and it is close to our home so we it makes it easy.  We stayed in building  #3 which is the high tower overlooking the pool.  Nice views!  Our stuite was a studio with a full kitchen.  We came in for two nights on an Island Romance Package and rescieved to two daily breakfast credits for our use and a dinner credit as part of our accomadations.  We arrived on Friday and checked in early, while we were at the beach the staff delivered a bottle of champange and chocolate covered strawberries with note wiching us a happy birthday.  We had breakfast in our suite each morning and dinner one night in the Whiskey Bar at the Bay side part of the resort and the second night at…

title: Rest & relaxation
review: We stayed for 4 nights in late April. We were fortunate enough to be able to treat ourselves to a club suite gulf view using our AAA discount. So worth it!  Front desk staff were pleasant at check-in and helped us to our room. We were in building 4, 4th floor. Room was updated/contemporary and clean. More than enough room for 2 adults. King bed was comfortable. Small kitchen an added plus. Bathroom was more than adequate. Over-sized balcony with 4 chairs/table and a lounge chair. Amazing gulf/sunset views. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we encountered friendly, helpful staff. Brad, on the beach, was great. All of the beach staff were happy to accommodate. We had no problem getting drink/food service on the beach. Pool area is small and tends to get crowded but…

title: Do not have your wedding here!
review: Wedding ceremony was nice, but the staff here treated the guests poorly.  There was no place for the groomsmen to get prepared, drinks never made it to the room where they were supposed to go, staff was incredibly rude and snobby to the wedding guests in the Lounge/bar area.  The reception was: staff didn't crack a smile or say anything, acted Incredibly put-out.  The food was cold and tasted like hospital food.  This place is *not* a top-notch resort-don't be fooled.

title: Family Vacation, 3 star resort
review: We were here for 4 nights in early April with two of our kids, 8 and 5. We stayed in a building with a lagoon view and it was fine and not a far walk to the pool/beach and restaurants. We were on the bottom floor and did not ever hear the guests next door or above, which was nice.  The room was a little small for the price. The kitchen was nice and it was good to have a washer/dryer but they were incredibly old and very noisy. Washing powder/detergent is not provided. THe bathroom was fine and clean and there was a lot of closet space. We did enjoy sitting out on the patio and watching the water and the birds outside.   The hotel claims six restaurants but we really only ate in the main one and by the pool. The other dining options must have been further away from the resort…

title: Old and tired resort
review: Great location on the beach with amazing views. The place needs a face lift, very dated and showing numerous signs of wear and tear. Rooms were large and clean, all the bi-fold closet doors were hanging off the track, noisy air conditioners. Rotting outside light fixtures around pool and stained mats for the chairs Room was not ready at check in, ready about an hour later. Our biggest issue was the pool area, 1 pool for 6 buildings ? Rude people by the pool who yelled across to each other taking up large areas of seats. Saw 2 kids diving in the NO Diving pool. Even with high winds we preferred the beach to the low end crowd around the pool. Never ate there. Should be better for the money.

title: Best family vacation spot-- top notch fun for all
review: Our family of four (kids ages 12 and 10) spent 6 days and nights.  We had the big studio suite with a king bed, and pullout queen sofa.  It worked out great.  The bathroom area was huge and excellent storage.  Surprise in addition to large fridge and kitchen was a washer and dryer, oven and dishwasher.  A large blacony overlooking pool and a view of the gulf added to the enjoyment.  No nickel and diming here: free towels, beach chairs and umbrellas, bike rentals, wifi, fitness center, and tennis courts.  Great on site golf courses.  Fantastic and reasonable tennis lessons.  The entire family cannot wait to return.

title: The Longboat Key Club is awesome.
review: I love going to the Longboat Key Club. Everything is awesome from the kayaks to the rooms. They have good tennis courts and outdoor activities. I love going to Longboat Key for vacations.

title: Could (probably was) be so much better
review: Staff were on the main very good but the whole place felt dated, no wifi , lots of concrete, tired rooms, sad pool, scrappy beach. Also when the room is a double and a sofa pull out, a simple divider down the middle would make it far more comfortable. Would love to know who designed the room as most of it is a corridor (supposed to be dressing room )  with cupboards and a sink, and a kitchen. The bathroom is very poor and the water pressure in the shower in just ok. My main tip is not to eat here as it feels like disney world, guests and 'members' only, and the food is poor at best, they really should take a look at what can be done by visiting dry dock grill. If they spend the money they are talking it will be great, otherwise (as with much in the area) best to look a little…

title: Amazing property, overpriced
review: The resort is absolutely breath-taking, especially the views from the suites. The beach area is well-maintained with lounge chairs, and umbrellas. The rooms are clean, and spacious.  Sleeping with our patio doors open listening to the waves at night was wonderful! Our suite was about $540 per night, plus tax, plus a 24.00 resort fee.  I've stayed in better places for less money.  Drinks and food were also overpriced and always included 20% and tax, as you can leave the resort and find amazing food elsewhere for less.   We were married there at sunset, which was the perfect location for a wedding.  The wedding coordinator, Whitney,  communicated well with me the entire 8 months leading up to the wedding.  She was great!  We originally wanted an ocean front room, but were told we…

title: Kids friendly with easy living
review: The rooms are wonderful and very large.  We stayed on the bayside which I would do it again because those views are worth the extra time it takes to walk to the pool. No meaningful nightlife and nothing really interesting to do other than be with your family and friends. Singles need not apply

title: A tranquil resort with beauty,warmth and a breathtaking gulf view!
review: The staff from the front desk, managers and wait staff were extrememly helpful.  Gloria, the concierge was gracious and fun to speak with.   Our gulf suite room was fabulous with a full kitchen,washer/dryer and double terrace..with well appointed amenities and decorated with taste!  Had 2 breakfasts/light dinner...not disappointed at all..quality is what they serve here.  For Valentine's Day there was a complimentary chocolate dipping buffet with a variety of fruit, pretzels, etc...a nice touch.  A gal/guy were playing on the small stage near the bar each night performing music from the 70's and on...Of course, requests were taken and performed. The ocean was only 66 temp. so we were disappointed but found solace in the warm pool/jacuzzi...Just walking on the beach brings a…

title: Gulf View, Great Beach, Calm Waters
review: The Longboat Key Club is enjoyable, though i'm not sure how it got it's Triple A Four Diamond Rating.  The beach was great, amazingly shallow for at least 100 yards into the Gulf.  Service in the restaurant was slow at times, but once the waiter arrived, things got better.  We did have an issue with the bartender one night.  She seemed to favor the regulars, ignoring us.  Once this was brought to the attention of the manager, he more than made up for it, comping our drink and dessert.  Room had fingerprints on the back of the bathroom door that never did get cleaned during our stay.  Overall, it was a relaxing stay, with some minor misses.

title: a great resort
review: The Longboat Key Club is a great place for the family. The food, staff and beach are great. I have been to the Longboat Key Club many times and have always been pleased by their service. Ever night i am put to sleep by the sound of the waves. The Longboat Key club has lots to do like golfing,tennis, swimming and more.

title: Home away from Home
review: Perfect place for R & R yet so close to wonderful St. Armand's square for shopping, dining and people watching. The staff is friendly and the accomodations are perfect ! Clean, convenient to beach !

title: Only a few "misses" among many hits
review: We stayed here for just two nights in March while catching some Spring Training baseball at nearby Ed Smith Stadium (Go Orioles!). The resort grew on us as we stayed. The somewhat aloof desk clerk was not overly welcoming, but a bell guy standing nearby heard us ask (unsuccessfully) to adjust our reservation so that we could have two rooms in the same building rather than on separate ends of the property, and took it upon himself to seek out the manager and made it happen. Props to Steve -- good stuff.   We had something they called Club Suites, which had king beds, a pull out sofa bed and sitting area (but in the same room as the bed), a full but narrow galley kitchen with an seating bar and large bathroom/dressing area. There are three "views" available for rooms -- one beach,…

title: Great relaxing getaway
review: Just returned from 8 nights in a lagoon-view club suite.  This was a perfect spot for us.  Building is separate from the main hotel, but just a few steps away. Beautiful, sandy beach and small pool are on the property as well. We appreciated the quiet location with views of dolphins/manatees from our balcony.  Dining within the resort is exceptional.  Staff is attentive and friendly.  Our room had everything we needed for the week and more.  Having the kitchen and washer/dryer was a plus.  Bed was very comfortable.   Only recommendation would be an adult pool, but then you have a HUGE beach area and the Gulf!   We hope to return in the future.

title: Well appointed lodging
review: I attended a meeting at this Resort and while I'm not usually one to stay at resorts, found this one a delight.  Room size was ample [we were in a suite], view of the ocean and a roomy balcony added to its character.  A huge bathroom and closets as well;  there was also a kitchen and good sized flat screen TV and very comfortable bed.  The resort has a large open bar area and hot tub and pool, then you can walk right out to the sands and the sea.  The Resort provides towels and covered cabana-type of lounge chairs which makes spending an afternoon in the sun possible.  Staff at the Resort were friendly and helpful.  The one caution I would have is that it's far down Longboat Key and closer to Sarasota and its airport than Tampa, where we came in.  But easy to get to [tho had the…

title: Alex who works by the pool-The best!
review: Came for a visit with family back in February.  We have been visiting Florida destinations for years.  Sanibel, Captiva, Marco Island, Naples and Ft. Myers.  We enjoyed this area and resort more than any we ever stayed at in Florida.  We stayed in tower #3 in the10th floor.  The views were AMAZING and the room was perfect. We stayed in a unit with a kitchen and laundry. The staff at this resort were also amazing.  Looking for opportunities help make our stay more enjoyable.  There is a man named Alex who works by the pool who blew us away with his high level customer service.  One of the hardest working, nicest guys we have ever met! We will be back!

title: Nice place and good tennis, but geared towards year-round members.
review: We were able to get a room her at the last minute for our children's winter break.  The place is very nice and well maintained.  The pool and beach were not crowded and we were able to get lounge chairs at both fairly easily.    We are tennis players and chose it because it is ranked as one of the better tennis resorts.  The tennis facilities are beautiful, but they are not at the resort, about three miles away -- something that they don't tell you.  Also, the tennis facilities are open to anyone who joins the Club and pays membership fees and dues.  Therefore, while they have many courts, a lot of them are booked for members' pre-set weekly games.  Sue does do a good job of arranging games for you if you ask, but they really have only one one-hour generic clinic a day.  The pro…

title: Wonderful location and wonderful beach
review: Hotel is either a fractional or timeshare property with fantastic location on Longboat Key located only a short distance from St. Armand's Circle with its mixture of high-end and affordable shopping, restaurants and nightlife. The resort is good for large family groups with children and is somewhat family-orientated. We do not have children though so if you are seeking privacy and a high-end luxury experience, this is not suitable despite the price of a Club Room King Gulf Suite being $459.00 per evening without tax, and also not including the $20.00 plus daily resort fee. If you go without children and want privacy away from the kids and the noise, buildings 1 & 4 are ideal as they do NOT overlook the pool area. We stayed in a Club Gulf King suite in building 4 which is private…

title: Wonderful Time!!!
review: My wife and I along with our 2-year old last August.  We were blown away!!!  From the moment we arrived, we felt welcome and relaxed.  The suite, the view, the pool, the beach - all exceeded our expectations!  Because we went in August, the beach and resort were virtually deserted and we felt like we had the run of the place.  I suppose many people believe Florida is too hot at that time of the year, but we found it to be ideal.  Between dipping in the pool and laying out on the beach, then cooling off in the gulf water and playing in the sand, we just had a wonderful time.  Each day in the afternoon it stormed a bit, but that made it a perfect transition time with our little one to come back inside and nap for a bit before heading out for the evening.    The only thing that…

title: Would have been nice to have the better building...
review: We returned to the hotel for a group meeting event for the first time in 4-5 years. They've redone the rooms, which was nice. Unfortunately they put most of our group in Building 6 and 7. A few people got in the oceanfront buildings (they didn't pay anything extra). The rooms in building 6 and 7 may be a little larger (I'm not positive) but the renovation was basically a paint job and some new furniture. Unfortunately attention to detail on the room wasn't a strength as there were numerous marks on the walls, etc but they were still above average.  The front desk on check-in was okay, but not overly friendly, but the pool staff, catering, and housekeeping were very friendly.  If we attend again, I'll certainly ask for a better building, but I was disappointed with our stay and…

title: A premium product at a premium price - we were not disappointed
review: The hotel and grounds are immaculately maintained and our beach view club suite was superb with stunning views over the Gulf of Mexico. The pool is heated to 85 degrees, with a plentiful supply of sun-beds and umbrellas – all managed by a great team of people – no one throws towels to reserve beds here! The adjacent Gulf beach is beautiful with white powdery sand – great for early morning walks and the amazing sun-sets. The beach also offers complementary sun-beds and steamer chairs. There are free bikes as well. But what sets the Longboat Key Club apart is the attentiveness of its staff. The front desk team was very professional and made us feel like valued customers from the moment we arrived. Everyone else also played their part - for example housekeeping delivered a…

title: Nice place to stay, this place is for relaxing!
review: We were there for a week (which unfortunately was cold :( ) but the staff seemed nice, I would say nice, but not overly helpful but did do thier job. It is a clean place, nice spacious rooms, nice grounds. The beach is nice (though could not swim.. freezing!!) lots of shells to find. What is nice is the chairs and cabanas are free, which unlike some places that charge for ev-er-y-thing! There is not much to do on the resort except swim, beach, drink and eat, Golf or use the fitness center (which is nice but a bit small but very modern). This is truly for a relaxing, do nothing vacation. In regards to the restaurants on property, we only tried Sands Pointe for lunch and a dinner. The food was good but greatly over priced.. which is not unusual within a resort property. I advise…

title: Sort of Deluxe
review: Ideally located at the beginning of Longboat Key...you are a very short drive from St. Armand"s Circle with restaurants and shopping yet directly on both the Gulf (great, great beach) and the inlet bay for fishing et al,. Hotel consists of multiple high rise, very ugly buildings with not much of a pathway to connect them. The main building has the main dining room where you also have breakfast and so you walk thru either a parking lot or on the edge thru ugly pathways to get to the main building. Rooms are spacious enough and most have terraces (ours overlooked the Gulf and beaches...very pleasant) Bathrooms could use some updating (tub/shower combo, leaky faucet etc) Staff is very friendly and helpful, parking is easy, food is better than adequate but not excellent....if you…

title: Great beach and resort
review: I cannot add much to the other reviews. I concur with all that has been said about this great resort property that is hidden in plane view.  There is nothing that you will not enjoy about staying at LKC.

title: Glorious in every way
review: Lovely accommodations, gracious staff, deliciously comfortable stay in every way.  Beach front, pools - an island get away that you can access by car!

title: A wonderful experience!
review: My family of four (including 7 and 5 yr old children) stayed at Longboat Key Club from Jan. 25th - 31st.  It was our first time in Longboat key and we were very happy with everything.  We stayed in a deluxe 2 bedroom suite with a 180 degree view of the beach and the Gulf of Mexico.  The view was stunning and we loved hearing the sound of the waves every time we opened one of the three balcony doors.  The suite included a full kitchen, washer & dryer and 3 televisions.  The rooms were bright and airy and nicely decorated.  Housekeeping made up our rooms promptly every day.  All of the hotel staff we interacted with were pleasant and helpful.   While the hotel was at almost 100% capacity it did not feel busy other than at the pool which was busy in the afternoons.  The beach is…

title: Hidden Gem
review: Easy to get to!  Easy to relax at! Modern! Clean! Views are great! Staff is very energetic and friendly! Food is above average! Don't tell anyone, keep it a secret!

title: Beautiful Room and View
