review: My husband and I recently stayed at the Longboat Key Club & Resort.  The room was spacious and very clean! The staff was so helpful and friendly from the very moment we checked in.  They were able to help us with our dinner arrangements and transportation.  And I cannot say enough about the waterfront view.  Love the LBKC&R!

title: VERY NICE room with BEACH VIEW
review: The Longboat Key Club and Resort was PERFECT for our anniversary get away. We got a room with a beach view to die for. It was so restful and NICE.There was plenty of room for two to sit on the balcony that overlooks the Gulf.   Everything was in excellent condition our room. It was high-end and had updated quality decor. They had very comfortable CLEAN bedding. CLEAN carpets and tile. Larger than usual shampoo. We had an unexpected kitchenette with glassware, silverware, microwave, stocked fridge, ice, etc. (No stove).  It was very QUIET in January. The Resort Grounds were very well maintained and beautiful. Thanks to Hotels.com we got a reasonable price too. I highly recommend LBK Club and would love to go back longer on our next visit.

title: After a rocky start, very enjoyable stay
review: My family and I chose the Longboat key club for a quick getaway in the sun and also to visit some local family. My husband and I had stayed at the Ritz Sarasota a few weeks prior, and that was very nice. I chose this hotel for this trip based on its location and the ability to have a large 2 bedroom suite on the beach, with the added amenities of a kitchen, living room and dining area. It also was about 40% less than 2 standard rooms at the Ritz. I was skeptical because I really like 5 star resorts, but I thought we would give it a whirl for a few days.  Here are the quick pros and cons:  Pros: Beautiful beach and location. Plenty of beach loungers and chaises around the pool. Very large oversized rooms, tastefully decorated. Quiet with large sliding glass doors to let in the…

title: Vacation of a Lifetime
review: Husband and I recently spent nine glorious days in a beachview club suite at the Longboat Key Club & Resort.  The time we were here was so enjoyable, we did not want to go home.  From the moment we checked in with the friendly and efficient front desk staff to the time we sadly had to leave, everything was top notch in terms of amenities and service.  If you like to golf, play tennis, enjoy the spa or just want to relax by the pool or on the beach, I would defintely recommend this resort.  This resort is also convenient to St. Armands Circle, museums, entertainment and many great restaurants.

title: Bed and odor
review: We stayed in unit 4505 which had a very poor bed (big v with two in bed) and odor only partly masked by scent sticks in the unit.  Dinner was nice and blend of amenities nice, however.

title: Stayed here three times now
review: I have stayed here three times now, Feb '10, Oct '10, and Sept '11.  Great beach.  Older property but rooms have been totally redone and are large and very, very nice.  Cuban sandwich and the on site resturant is the best I have ever had.  Great pool area, not crowded as it is a very large pool.  It is an expensive place, but very nice.  Workout room also very nice and large.  My wife got a massage and said it was very good.  This is a short dirve to St Armonds Circle and all the shopping.  The Met is cool store, worth a trip over to the Circle.  Also, Beach Bistro is a 25 minute drive to the north, well worth it.  One of my top 3 meals every.  My company has held two small conference here at LBK Club and Resort and they did a great job.

title: Excellent staff services!
review: If you to stay at a tennis/golf resort where the staff there are professional, friendly and are ready to assist you, then you must try Longboat Key Club and Resort.  It's a 4 stars resort, but the staff services are 5 stars.

title: Gorgeous beaches, great tennis & spa getaway
review: My husband and I recently returned from a 5 night stay here and loved every minute of it!  The resort is pricey but worth every penny – beautifully landscaped grounds, gorgeous white sandy beaches, and top-notch amenities.  The tennis center is especially nice, with impeccable clay courts, knowledgeable pros, free court times for resort guests and a helpful (and free) player matching service.  Each staff person we dealt with – from front desk personnel to the shuttle drivers, concierge, beach/pool staff, and tennis pro shop employees – was extremely friendly and dedicated to helping us have the best stay possible.  We’re a couple in our early 30’s and were probably among the youngest guests there, apart from some college-aged kids there with their families (most guests seem to…

title: Wonderful Trip
review: We loved it. The tennis center was gorgeous and the staff were so helpful and friendly. We played golf at the two courses aswell and they were v nice and one had lovely views. The food at the golf club was excellent, we had the Sunday Brunch buffet and it was great value aswell. Our room had a fabulous Gulf view and was v nice and comfortable. We swam in the pool aswell and used the hot tub. We stayed in Naples, Tampa and Orlando and this was our favourite place. The town was also v pretty and we had great food in the crab and fin. The Charthouse was v disappointing and expensive but the staff were great.

title: Wonderful!
review: My husband and I stayed at the resort December 2nd and 3rd.  I can't say enough good things!  When we arrived we were immediately welcomed.  Upon check-in, we received a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful two bedroom suite directly facing the gulf. The resort was gorgeous complete with all of the expected amenities.   We had a great experience and we will definitely return!

title: Fantastic
review: Wonderful location on a wonderful beach.  Quiet, relaxing, tidy.  As you would expect for the cost and location.  Definitely worth a visit.

title: Beautiful Beach Front Wedding
review: I stayed here for a friend's wedding and the staff really did a great job with the whole event.  The ceremony was on the beach and it was beautiful and the reception area was also lovely. Everything was just so well organized. The beach on the property is gorgeous and the pool/hot tub area is a great place to spend the afternoon. The staff at both locations was great at making sure we had all the towels/drinks/food we needed. And the prices are pretty fair for a hotel, so we could actually indulge! I got a treatment at the spa and that was ok and a little pricey for what it was, but I still recommend it. I also think this is a great place for families.  Most of the rooms are big and come with a kitchenette so you can have meals. There are also a lot of children there and the…

title: Seventh Heaven with Sunsets
review: Our 2nd visit, wonderful beachfront position, comfortable, spacious rooms, this year we could see the magnificent sunsets in to the sea from our 2nd balcony. Booked through Virgin. Free Coffee in reception in a.m Cookies in pm. Good food at reasonable prices in the restaurant except Thanksgiving evening, tired buffet. Air conditioning units are noisy and old fashioned. Staff friendly and efficient so far!

title: The Royal Treatment In A Beautiful Location.
review: If you are looking for a restful, quiet place to enjoy sugar white sands, beautiful views, dolphins swimming by while you relax on the beach, this is your place.  The suites are roomy, the staff are all friendly and the every amenity you could need is available.  I could not find one thing where they should improve.  We did not want to leave.

title: A Little Piece of Heaven!
review: Dear Wadleyfla:  Thank you for your steller review of the Longboat Key Club and Resort.   I love to share TripAdvisor review shuch as yours with our associate team.   We thank you for being our guest and hope to host you again in the near future.     Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations.

title: Fabulous hotel in a fabulous place
review: This is our favorite resort in the states!  We have been visiting LBKC since it opened and return every year to its incredible surroundings.  The resort is beautifully located on a sandy white beach, and the rest of the property is equally lovely.  The room are well maintained, though a bit pricey during season.  Because we are a family of 5, we usually stay in a deluxe 2 bedroom unit, which offers plenty of room, full washer/dryer, full kitchen, etc----very nice.  They offer numerous special rates and packages that are available at various times of the year. They offer a variety of fun activities, including 2 golf courses, awesome tennis facility, and water sport activities.  Their knowledgeable concierge can set you up with other activities and dining reservations in the area…

title: A lush beach front oasis
review: When staying at the Longboat Key Club & Resort for a work retreat, we were all treated like royalty.  There are a number of accomodation options however, I can only speak about the rooms facing the pool and the Gulf of Mexico which are beautifully decorated and well appointed.  The spa treatments are pricey, but an afternoon of pure relaxation and pampering was well worth it.  The lush landscape, breezy decor, tropical drinks, and attentive staff will entice you to never leave this gulf coast oasis.

title: Overall very nice place and I believe you will enjoy your visit here.
review: This resort has golfing, the beach, tennis, swimming pool, and a spa.   The complex has several accomodation buildings on the property; I stayed on the bay, rather than the beach.  This resort is expensive so staying on the bay was less expensive, I would recommend your doing so; the view was beautiful of the bay and close enough (to the main building, beache etc).    The resort charges a "resort fee" even though in my case I could not use the amenities because I was there on business.   I do not care for these types of extra charges in general, and I believe hotels are better off just charging the full price of the room rather than itemizing the daily rate in this way, especially if you cannot opt out of the charges.   The grounds are lovely, the food is good, and no problems…

title: Consistency make this a tempting annual stop
review: My wife and I like trying  new places, but we've made an exception for the Longboat Key Beach Club.  We stayed there for the fifth time in five years last month, and enjoyed it as much as our first four visits. Its the best property that is available on Longboat Key on a daily rental basis, and we like it because it is just a short drive (or hotel shuttle) to the restaurants and shops at St Armands Circle. We prefer the beach on Longboat Key better than others on Florida's west coast because its less crowded and cleaner. The LBKC also has plenty of beach cabanas, and there's attendants and bar service most afternoons. There a couple of golf courses that are relatively easy to get on in October. The property has a couple of good restaurants. We prefer Potifino's.   And there is a…

title: Our favorite hotel ever!!!!
review: Longboat Key Club is absolutely our favorite hotel we have ever stayed at!  We love how it's not cheesy hotel furniture and linens.  Everything is clean and modern.  We got married here back in July and they took care of everything!  Our family and friends all stayed there and said that, although it is a bit pricey, it was well worth the money.  Once you are there, you don't need to leave.  One piece of advice is to remember that they do add 20% tip to everything, including drinks, so watch out for that so you're not over-tipping.  You will LOVE this resort!  It is right on the beach and everything about it is perfect!  It's the most relaxing place we have ever stayed.  We have now stayed probably 6 times, and it's been worth every cent we spent.  Don't be afraid to do the…

title: Great location and beautiful accommodations
review: We spent 5 nights there last month and really enjoyed it. Our lagoon view club suite was very comfortable and had everything we needed. The beach and pool facilities were great and the staff there was terrific. The fitness center was above average and we had some great matches on the har tru tennis courts.  The only area for improvement was the front desk staff. It began with a variance in the nightly rate and a "you better have a written confirmation" response. On a couple of other occasions, they gave lackluster responses to our inquiries. The staff here was not up to the high standard of the rest of the resort.  We hope to return.

title: Our stay here was for a weekend wedding.
review: The resort was beautiful!  All the amenities you would expect from a golf/beach resort.  The staff was friendly and attentive, too.  The bartender, Brad, at the poolside bar is awesome!  Our guest room was one of the smaller rooms on the first floor, but I wouldn't recommend it. You can hear quite a lot of noise from other guests if there happens to be a party outside.  My parents had a room on the fourth floor and didn't hear a thing. Also sound travels too well from one room to another if you have a room that adjoins another.  We could hear every word being said by our neighbors.  That being said the room was clean, decorated nicely and cozy.  Lighting in our room was a bit lacking, but could have been because our room faced northwest and again was on the first floor.

title: Everything you need at the beach!
review: We go here every year and it never disappoints.  The property consists of 5 buildings, with either ocean, lagoon or golf views. For a family of four we always get a Jr. Suite that has everything you need from home, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, microwave, etc. Every room has a fantastic usable balcony, can't beat having coffee on it in the mornings. The pool isn't as large as many resorts but somehow is the perfect size.  There's a bar by the pool where the bartender put on a "snow" show for the kids by throwing shaved ice up into ceiling and it came raining down. The kids loved it. Casual restaurant outside serves really good food. Pool service is stellar, even at the beach! Which is THE best thing. Take a walk on the attached boardwalk and there you are, beach attendants…

title: Incredible place to stay!
review: We've stayed here a number of times, including our honeymoon, and can say enough wonderful things abou the LBK Club and Resort. First of all the views are spectacular and you will feel like you on an exoctic island in the bahamas without ever leaving the country!  The water is crystal clear and there are sailboats to rent which will really take you to see the sights. The service is amazing and the staff so helpful. We are tennis players and we loved playing tennis at the resort. John Woods is the head of the tennis program there and he is so kind and helpful we just wanted to hang at the tennis club all day. The food at the club is exceptional!  You are so close to great shopping and all the sites. There is no place else like this on Longboat Key. Don't miss it!

title: Great Beach Getaway!
review: The LBKC was a great stay for us. We are a family from 5 to 71 and the hotel catered to all  our needs. The beach staff was exceptional and would setup all the umbrellas/charis we needed quickly and efficiently. Thanks to all the friendly staff. The resort was wonderful and our room was very spacious. We reserved a two-bedroom suite with kitchen and it fit us just right. We were able to make our breakfasts and head out to the beach, then return for lunch (when the sun was at its strongest). Since we had a balcony with a beach view, we'd lunch out there to enjoy it.

title: Excellent gulf-front resort
review: Top-notch facility all around.  Friendly staff, clean room, great pool and beach, great food on site!  I have stayed here twice now and would recommend it to anyone wanting an enjoyable and relaxing gulf front stay!  Nearby Sarasota and St. Armands circle are enjoyable as well.

title: Super Lux - See How the "Other Half" Lives!
review: Total and complete understated elegance - no one looked down their noses at us - but I could tell this is a place where folks who in a certain "income bracket" go because the level of service and amenities provided at the Longboat Key Club are simply expected.  We stayed in a lagoon view suite - wow - don't pass it up because it is in a separate building - it was amazing with views of beautiful homes on the lagoon from a peaceful patio.  Our suite was clean, spacious, free covered parking, lovely bathroom and vanity area with all amenities you could ever want.  Comfy king bed, and kitchen was fully equiped - and it had a washer and dryer for goodness sake - nice to not bring home sweaty golf clothes!  The beautiful gulf is just a teensy walk past the pool - everywhere we went we…

title: Impressive
review: My boyfriend and I went during this labor day weekend and we were very happy to see how well kept and clean the resort is.  When we arrived the suite they gave us wasn't exactly ocean view, but we called the front desk and we were given a suite that was.  We enjoyed our stay tremendously.  We were not able to enjoy the beach due to the weather but we loved our suite so much we relaxed all day like we were at home only with the sound of the ocean waves.   One thing I must say is that the restaurants in the resort are quite pricy.  Almost better going off the property.  We will definetly return to this resort.

title: It Just Keeps Getting Better & Better
review: This is a great resort that has it all, great location, beautiful and spacious rooms, solid restaurants and one thing that has never changed over the years - a great staff.  They go out of their way to make your stay first rate.  I have always felt this is the best beach resort in Florida since we moved here 16 years ago and my feelings have never wavered.  Go behind the gates and enjoy a first class experience at Longboat key Club!

title: First class
review: Facilities, including pool and heath club were all well done. The room was well-furnished and immaculate, with a beautiful view of pool and (partial) of beach. Top drawer place.

title: True Resort In Every Sense of The Word
review: My wife and I stayed one night at Lido Beach "Resort" and checked out due to unsanitary conditions.  Before leaving I called the Longboat Key Club Resort and explained my situation.  The young lady in reservations was over the top attentive and empathic to our situation.  She offered to show us rooms before we rented one.  We opted not to waste time doing that and went ahead and rented a room for our remaining 3 nights.  Graciously, they gave us the Florida residence rate as a goodwill gesture, even though we are from Georgia.  She promised we would love the room and boy did we.  We got the mini suite.  One king bed, kitchen, living room area with two adjoining balconies facing the Gulf.  The room was updated with very comfortable furniture, an amazingly comfortable HUGE king…

title: Can't wait to go back!
review: Went with my husband and two small kids.  The suite was impeccable. clean, modern, very large and comfy.  Service was incredible; everyone was incredibly nice and accomodating.  The beach is beautiful and the attendants on the beach go the extra mile to make sure you have everything you need.  Only downside: price was a bit high so we couldn't stay longer but will most definately go back!

title: Great place for a girl's getaway
review: I take a girl's trip each year with 4 to 5 friends from high school (we are now in our 40's).  We usually stay in hotels, but this time decided to try a "condo style" place where we could all stay together and have the convenience of living room and kitchen.  We all loved it!  The place is quite pricey, but splitting the cost between 5 of us made it do-able.  The 2 bed/2 bath suite was incredibly spacious and very nicely decorated, and the washer/dryer came in handy.  We had rented a car so were able to shop at publix for breakfast, lunch, and snacks, then we went out each night for dinner.   We did not eat on property at all, and I'm glad we didn't.  We would make a big jug of our "cocktail of the day" and bring it down to the beach with us.  The proximity to St. Armands for…

title: Great Resort, Can't wait to go back!
review: Upon our arrival at 11:30pm in a driving rain storm I thought we would have been on our own, but it was fully staffed as if they were waiting for us! Our room was on the 10th floor and it was roomy and gorgeous facing the ocean so we could enjoy coffee along with the sounds of the ocean every morning. I am most impressed that you are not nickled and dimed at this resort, no extra charges for parking or umbrellas at the beach. This resort provides towels on the beach, as well as toiletries in the bathroom that are large enough for more than one shower. The facilities are clean and there is a full size coffee pot in the room. Who doesnt love that! On the days that we forgot to empty the coffee grounds before we hit the beach, the house keeping staff did it. The grounds were…

title: When Can I Go Back ?
review: A week at the beach in a hotel which offered excellent facilities, a great pool and private beach. Sunbeds, towels, cabanas are all provided and the pool / beach teams look after you well Rooms are very well appointed with super comfy beds and bedding. Plenty of space to live without having to keep working round the furniture or move one at time A 10 minute drive to St Armands Circle in the evening for some excellent eating and a quirky mix of shops

title: Mostly great, a few downers
review: Arrived after having requested (months in advance) a room on an upper level. We got a room on the 2nd floor. I asked if it was possible to be up higher as to avoid the visual obstruction of sea grapes and got the old, "We are totally booked."  Hmm.  However, the room was really lovely and the unobstructed part of the view was grand indeed. We had a Club Room and it was very spacious with a perfect size kitchen, huge bathroom, comfy bed and delightful sitting area. Everything in working order, clean as could be except for the outdoor dining table, which had a bit of gunk on it from a prior meal.   We did not eat at any of the restaurants and would suggest they put menus in the room so you could have some idea of what they offer. Summer hours tend to be a bit different at the…

title: Beautiful Beaches.....Blue Water
review: This is truly a place to relax and unwind...Beautiful beaches and clear blue waters...even the dolphins have a difficult time staying away!!!  Couples and families will enjoy the beaches and golf.

title: Amazing Place
review: We booked the lagoon view club suite and were pleasantly surprised at the luxurious room. Brand new appliances, washer, dryer, kitchen, big bathroom. The bed was also very comfortable. Fresh complimentary coffee is served in the morning by the lobby and then a scroll past the pool and you are right on the beach. The beach service is also great, just walk out, pick your spot, and they will set up chairs and umbrellas for you. Fitness studio was also a great plus. We ate in the room most of the time so cannot comment on the food at the restaurants, however it does seem a bit pricey. We will for sure be back very soon.

title: Tranquil views of the bay
review: We stayed in a room with a balcony overlooking the lagoon, and it provided great views of the lush greenery by the water's edge, beautiful homes along the side with their boats in dock, birds overhead, and fish literally jumping out of the water. The room was simply decorated but beautiful, and had wonderful amenities including a living room area, a kitchen (with refrigerator, dishwasher, stove, and kitchenware), and washer/dryer. It was comforting to go back to after a quiet but exhausting day in the Florida sun. We went to Portofino, which was one of the resaturants on the resort. The staff was very friendly and attentive, and the food was tasty and served in ample portions. The fried calamari appetizer was cooked perfectly and we commented that it could've been enough as a…

title: Absolutely lovely - thoroughly recommend
review: Thank you for being our guest and taking the time to review your stay at the Longboat Key Club and Resort.  Seeing the fish, dolphin and manatee that venture into the lagoon or along the beach always makes a wonderful experience.  We look forward to having you with us again in the near future when you can also venture onto our Golf courses and enjoy the Tennis center.   Yours in Hospitality,  Rick Benninghove Director of Resort Operations

title: A great base for us
review: This was our first visit and we were delighted with the 2 bedroom suite, which looked out onto the beach and sea.  The suite itself was large and well equipped.  The beach was just a short stroll from our terrace.  The tennis courts were nearby and we also used the swimming pool and sunbeds.  Would thoroughly recommend staying here and we hope to return in the not too distant future.

title: Beautiful Hotel but beware of all the hidden costs!
review: Just back from a 6 night stay in this beautiful resort.  We had booked and paid for, 8 months in advance, for a 2 bedroom suite.  When we checked in they gave us a 1 bedroom suite interconnecting to a double bedroom.  When I questioned about our 2 bedroom suite, they shrugged and said it was exactly the same thing.  I was very dubious about this and leaving the luggage still in the car, went up to check it out.  It seemed pretty much the same but slightly smaller than the 2 bedroom suite, so rather than creating a scene, we accepted it.  It did however niggle me that we had paid for something we didn't get!  This resort really is incredible however.  The views over the ocean are breathtaking!  The rooms are gorgeous, and the beds are particularly comfortable.  They charge you a…

title: Nice at first glance
review: We live about 65 miles from Longboat Key so decided to stay here checking in 7-1 and checking out 7-4. We reserved and were charged a deposit for a small suite which is one large room, kitchenette, good sized balcony, etc.  There are several buildings on the property. We booked over the phone and were assured of a beach front room. Upon check in we were offered a mai tai or glass of wine which is a nice touch. When we got to the room we were disappointed that it was directly overlooking the pool, not the beach. Called to request the room category we reserved and were  told they were fully booked and no other rooms were available. We stated we expected the room category we had reserved and already been charged a deposit for and she said she would call back. She called back and…

title: A Real Rip Off'
review: Whilst the hotel was average but acceptable we are moved to warn of the very poor restaurant facil;ities within the complex.  We visited the 'Sands Pointe' restaurant which is the only restaurant on the main complex and situated beside the reception area. [beware if you are a novice traveller - you could well feel that you are a captive audience]  As airline staff, the menu at this restaurant is the most sparse that we have encountered and was compounded by the cost - two courses and a glass of wine each COST $140  When we politely mentioned to the waiter that the menu was restrictive, we were met with a evening of surley service.  Guests beware as there are numerous other restaurants in the vicinity which offer far better quality and service at realistic prices.  In fairness to…

title: Really Nice Place
review: My husband and I invited some of our family to come and meet us at this resort for a short weekend.  It was very nice.  Clean, comfortable and spacious.  It was a bit pricey but I think nowadays anything descent is always going to cost more.  I would definately stay away from the fancy restaurants on site;  They are way too expensive and the food is not good.  The beach/pool cafe was pretty good.  We did that for lunch one day...for 3 of us it was about $65 for sandwiches and sodas!  The beach is very nice, some waves but still pretty safe for the kids.  The pool should be bigger but still nice and clean.  The good part is they have washers/dryers in the room so that was a plus.  We stayed in a golf view suite, the beach one was about $69 more per night and since we were paying…

title: Great location and solid value
review: My wife planned a trip here for the two of us to celebrate my birthday.  We live in the area, but Longboat Key has the feel of being far away.  After check-in, we proceeded to our "golf course view" suite.  The room was great, but there was no real golf course view.  Without unpacking we proceeded to upgrade to a gulf front suite.  This was a good move.  The room was very good, and I always put a premium on the room.  We had a kitchen, washer/dryer, a huge bathroom, mutiple closets and lots of room.  The bed was outstanding.  There were two balcony sections overlooking the Gulf of Mexico big enough for a lounge chair and table & chairs.  The resort looks like it could use a little paint, power washing and basic sprucing up, but it is certainly a very nice resort in a great…

title: Welcomed right away :-)
review: From the moment we arrived we received a heart felt welcome. The room is gorgeous. We rented a suite that had a king sized bed, sitting area, and complete kitchenette. Since we had been on the road for ten days it was a relief to stop in at the grocery store and get simple foods to prepare a few meals during our stay. Eating out is great but after awhile large heavy meals get tiring, so it was nice to pick up a baked chicken, lunch meats and cheese,plus some fruit. Once e had unpacked our belongings, the Gulf welcomed us with the most gorgeous sunset. The for an on core we had nature's fireworks with a lightning display. Sun, sand, water awaits us for the rest of our stay. Vicki and Murray

title: Recharging
review: We went there for the first time to enjoy the beach and tennis. The location is incredible. The tennis facilities are the best I have ever seen at any resort.  The spa was one of the top two spas I have had the pleasure of participating.

title: Consistently good
review: I just came back from my third stay at the Longboat Key Club.  The rooms are lovely, clean and reasonably sized.  The amenities and setting are great.  Highly recommend.

title: No shops no shoes no nothin
review: Longboat key is beautiful but the key club does not have any shops within the complex.  If you wanted a sun tan lotion or tee shirt you have to walk half mile to the golf club to obtain items or drive 2 miles to St Armands circle   The room seemed to be disheveled with the details not inspected. Bed was not made well, towels not crispy folded and staff members smoking in the stairwells .

title: Great!
review: A very pleasant place; a bit old-fashioned in some ways but the room and facilities are absolutely bang on. We had a club-suite, overlooking the pool; recently renovated I'd say, with everything that you would need for a week in the sun. You'll probably go there by car, so shopping in the Publix supermarket a couple of miles up the road will be no problem. We did eat in the restaurants; light-bites were really good although limited choices, breakfast was fine but not special. Pool service was non-existent, but no problem finding somewhere to lie. The pool itself is weirdly deep - half of it out of my depth and I'm 6 foot. Beach was very nice, a few steps from the hotel, clean, loads of shells and you swim with the fish. Bicycles available to borrow, and plenty of other stuff to…

title: An experience we will never forget
review: We staying at Longboat Key Resort for three nights in late April ( we got up early one morning to watch the royal wedding on TV!).  Our suite was AMAZING - 2 large bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, large sitting room, dining area, full kitchen with washing machine and dryer. 3 sets of patio doors from bedrooms and living area onto a very large balcony.  A fantastic view of the gulf.  We sat and watched fabulous sunsets.  We will never forget, thankyou Longboat Key Club & Resort, we will be back for our 4th visit for sure!!!!   Gail & Frank De'Ath

title: Fabulous resort with beautiful beach
review: My family stayed here for two weeks in a deluxe two bedroom that had a kitchen and balcony with an amazing ocean view. From the moment that  I stepped into the suite I was very pleased with the accomodations. It was spacious (1200 sq. ft I believe), beautifiully appointed, and very nice for entertaining as well as relaxing. And the views....the balcony was huge and spacious overlooking the ocean.  The beach was pristine, just like they show on their website photos. The beach service was prompt and came by often to check on us.   The sports facilities were fabulous. My husband is a tennis player and was pleased with his private lessons with instructors. And the children had a great time at the sports camp.  I would highly recommend this camp. I watched some of the instruction…

title: Perfect winter blues getaway!
review: We just spent 5 days and 4 nights and could not have been more pleased with the resort and our overall stay.  The weather was perfect, with plenty of beach cabanas and poolside chairs to accommodate the guests.  Short drive to a grocery store allowed us to have breakfast and snacks for the family and we ate out every night either at the hotel or at the St. Armand's area(5min drive).  Highly recommended resort!!!!

title: Not Worth the Price
review: I have been here 3 previous times and I thought that I would not return, but my daughter had a business trip and invited me to join her for a few days here. Again, as I have thought in the past, the location could not be better.  Lovely beach and spacious grounds.  The resort suffers because of its age.  For this resort to be worth the high prices, everything has to be done over.  That includes the walkways, which for the most part is fairly soiled cement, the room tiles, which have dirty grout, the carpeting and upholstery, which show stains and wear, the hallways need upgrading.  The pool area is crowded and there is never enough seating. We had a lovely time because we were together, but if there was a new resort on Longboat Key, no one would come here.

title: Liked it, but the weather wasn't at its best :(
review: My husband took me here as a surprise birthday weekend getaway. We drove down from Orlando and got caught in traffic so when we arrived the sun could barely be seen setting low in the sky. The weather in general that day in Orlando was sensational, and apparently it was there as well. Unfortunately, the rest of our time there was filled with fog so thick I couldn't even see the water from our room for most of one day. The day we left it was better, but overcast, dreary and windy.  Besides all of that, we would definitely come back here again. The rooms was very nice and the room we had was equipped with a full kitchen, including wine glasses, plates, pots and pans, etc. If we were staying for longer than just the weekend I could realistically see myself cooking a few meals in…

title: Excellent accommodations and beautiful beach.
review: Enjoed the resort - the suite was spacious and everything about it was first call.  The on-site restaurant had a very good restaurant and the poolside dining was quite nice.  The beach on the gulf was pristine with fine white sand.  And there is lots to do on Longboat Key from golfing to fishing and there is plenty to do in nearby Sarasota.  All in all, a very good experience.

title: great hotel,superb beach
review: My wife and i stayed at the longboat key club recently and had a great time.Apparantly all rooms have been renovated over the past year and our view each morning was of a white beach, framed by the light blue ,gulf of mexico.The gulf water is crystal clear and you could walk out around 30 meters and the water was still not up to my shoulders.Rooms include kitchen, washer/dryer,dish washer and flat screen tv. Read the small print when booking as there is a steep resort fee of around $50 per night.The staff were very polite and helpful and if you wanted to do something more energetic than lie on the beach there is a gym ,spa and18 holes of golf next to the hotel.There are around 20 clay tennis courts and a further 27 holes of golf a 7 minute drive away (north)by complimentary…

title: Still nice, but.....
review: We've stayed here maybe four times since 2002.  The beach is fantastic, tennis is great.  We love the area, but the hotel has gotten over crowded.  MOre pricey.  This year we just didn't think it was worth the money any more.  We also used to go because the rooms had kitchens and we had kids.  Now the kids are teenagers so not as important any more.

title: Disappointing
review: LBKC has been on our our list for a long time, so maybe our expectations were too high. Reservations told us that all the rooms were newly rennovated - but that's hard to believe.  Our first room (4206) needed a paint job, the bath tiling looked like it had been patched repeatedly, the safe and one phone didn't work. They moved us to 3404, which was in working order, but there was nothing newly rennovated about it. Killed a roach on the bedroom floor the second night! Won't be going back.

title: The friendliest Resort with so much to do
review: I stayed at the Longboat Key Club for a business trip.  The Staff was AMAZING.  I checked in and the staff was extremely friendly and placed me in a beautiful club suite overlooking the ocean.  The view was spectacular!  Later that evening the front desk made dinner reservations and the restaurant really took care of me because I was staying at the resort.  That evening I came back to the bar where I met some other guests, and enjoyed the music entertainment.  The room was so comfortable and elegant that being away on business was not a chore.  I had the opportunity to work out at the fitness facility and eat at several of the restaurants on the grounds.  The food and hospitality was again excellent.  My last day I had the opportunity to squeeze in 18 holes at the Harborside…

title: A great place to spend a few days
review: I highly suggest getting a room with a direct view of the water.  This is by far the nicest hotel in the area.  The rooms are large and clean.  They are starting to show a little wear, but nothing major.  The only issue I had was with the maid service.  They didn't refill our soaps and shampoos.  When you are paying over 200 a night I would expect this.  Nice place but not cheap.

title: Great location, room not worth the cost, loud AC, poor sound proofing
review: My wife and I stayed here recently. The check in process was good, although they only had us down for three days rather than four, however, this was fixed quickly. When we got to the room, the view was excellent. However, the bed was unstable with the foot raising up by about 6 inches when sitting on the head of the bed. There were cobwebs around the ceiling.   Then our evening was replete with hearing the TV from the adjacent room through the adjoining door. In addition, the AC was very loud when it clicked on. We did not sleep well any night while here.   The are additional costs that are not really understood upfront, including a resort fee and resort fee tax. We thus had an additional $50 per night in fees that were not expected.   We have done a fair amount of traveling and…

title: Repeat Visitors
review: Longboat Key Club & Resort is not perfect (room service meals, not service,could certainly could be improved) but the junior suites, personnel, amenities are difficult to match for the price and location. This was our choice four times in a row for a U.S. beach vacation. Hard pressed to come up with complaints. Always treated politely. Never had a problem with the rooms or staff who are always courtesy and professional . Location is wonderful offering guests many different options off the beach if they choose to leave the grounds. The resort itself makes vacationing quite easy with the no cash system and nice variety of eating/drinking establishments. Will certainly return.

title: EXCELLENT BUT CAN ADDITIONAL CHARGES BE JUSTIFIED?
review: This is the favourite destination in Florida for my wife and myself. We had stayed previously at this property on four separate occasions staying for two or three weeks each visit. This time the reservation department had been unable to accommodate us in our usual top suite overlooking the lagoon but they suggested a different suite which was on the first level and had direct access to the beach. We were a little concerned that the suite might not have been quite so good but in the event it was perfect.  We were welcomed back to the LBKC by the front desk staff, the concierge staff and by the manager. Also most of the other staff remembered us from our previous visits and this made us feel all the more "at home". Our two bedroom suite was up to the usual high standard. From our…

title: Fantastic place but need to fix Elevators.....
review: Everyone in our group loved everything but in the main building which has just been renovated they have only 1 very slow elevator working. There are no freight or service elevators so it stops on all floors for staff with large carts and such. Was told by staff it has been that way over 2 months. Don't understand it at all......

title: Incredible time and views
review: Arriving to Sarasota airport, , which I love as it is small and quaint, we hailed a taxi and arrived at this hotel/resort in 20 minutes. Cab fare was about $35 with tip. Check in , we were immediatly greeted and wisked to the front lobby, assured our luggage will be ready in our room. Check in was fast and pleasant. We stayed in the 2 bedroom, two bath suite with full kitchen, and family room, with breath-taking views from the bedrooms, family roomand kitchen. The whole back of the suite faced the ocean, so no matter where you were, you saw the ocena, an occasional morning dolphin show and sunsets out of this world. The hotel is extra clean, and grounds are well maintained. The elevator was slow, and didnt work one night, but it was no big deal. Hotel was slow when we were…

title: This is our favorite vacation spot of all.
review: From the moment that we pulled up at the resort until the minute that we checked out, the staff could not have been more attentive to our needs.  The bell man was there to open the car doors and greet us and then stayed with us until all of our luggage (and it seemed like worldly possessions) were in our suite.  Everything was perfect for our one week stay.  The resort was having maintenance done on some of the buildings and the hot tub was also being worked on but we go there for the beach which is pristine so it did not affect us or our time for relaxation.  Of the golf courses,  the three located at Harbourside were definately in better condition (Islandside greens need work).  All-in-all it was a wonderful vacation----we will be back again and again!

title: Will stay here again!
review: We spent the July 4th weekend at the resort.  It was wonderful!  Here is a summary of our likes and dislikes:  Likes: - super comfortable bed - good size room  - good size restroom - with plenty of counter space - good food at the lobby restaurant - nice evening entertainment at the lobby restaurant - nice welcoming drinks provided at check-in - nice touch! - pleasant staff - from valet attendants to front desk - short walk from beach (if staying at the lagoon - maybe 5 minutes) - nice views - fairly quiet - plenty of tennis courts that are not busy - nice beach area - tons of sand dollars when we went! - cabanas - nice hotel landscaping/ grounds - great for walks!  Dislikes: - waiters at the restaurant in the hotel  - wayfinding around the resort - need better signage - pool…

title: great experience
review: We had a great stay at the Longboat; we travelled there for a work convention and it was perfect.  The room had a kitchen which was perfect as I need to eat breakfast and don't always want to go out for food.  We had a great balcony which was good for early morning sun tanning.  It was right beside the pool, which is good if you have kids. We golfed, took some of the aerobic classes, spa and ate within the resort, all of which were great.   I would be more than happy to stay here again if I ever go back to Sarasota.   Thanks Longboat!!!

title: The Real Key to Relaxation
review: The Longboat Key Club & Resort, nestled on the Gulf of Mexico, is to a vacation what the champagne region of France is to making wine - the leader of the pack.  A short 15 minute drive from downtown Sarasota, a very busy cultural center, not only offers a true point of relaxation but it defines the word "service".  You don't feel like a guest, you feel like you're home.  Everyone from the concierge to the bellmen not only do their jobs, but go above and beyond in making sure that everyone feels pampered.  The food in the restaurant is world-class quality and those beautiful white beaches!  This is not only one of the best resorts in Florida, it is equal to many of those in which I have stayed around the world.

title: Room/grounds beautiful but customer service not up to par
review: We went to this resort for a wedding and at first were wowed by the service. We were met at the car by two attendants who opened our doors for us and escorted us inside for check-in. Our bell-hop carried our luggage up to our room and showed us around the room to get familiar with the amenities. He was probably the best staff we encountered over our 2 night stay.  The room was beautiful. It was just a regular "guest room" but it still had a kitchen, washer/dryer, dish washer, living room area, flat screen television, and a nice-sized bathroom. I cannot complain a bit about the room-- it was perfectly decorated and beautiful.  Because it is a wedding destination, trying to sleep with the noise of partying guests was difficult... but we had a wedding the next day, so we waited…

title: Beautiful Resot with LOUD AC (and construction noise)
review: This is a beautiful resort with a great location.  The staff is very friendly and helpfull.  We had a One bedroom Gulf Front sweet, which was very nice. Lots of room and lots of storage.  The Balconey was huge with a great view.  The only problem is you leave here more tired then when you arived.  The Air Conditioner is so loud you get woke up every time it comes on and goes off.  It is loud when running, nut the noise when it starts and stops is like getting hit in the head with pots and pans.  When we mentioned it to the staff we got frowns, and "sorry they are all like that".  The funney thing is they promote themselves as a "green" hotel, but the AC units are very old and need to be updated. They cannot be efficient, so they would save alot of electricity and money with…

title: We had a blast
review: Once again we visited Longboat Key Club and had an even better time than we did last time. We took no vaction last year due to a terminally ill pet, but the year before we had a Club Suite with a Lagoon view. That was nice, except  the bed and pull out were in the same room. Our teenager liked to go to sleep by 10pm, my wife likes to stay up and read a bit, and I like to watch TV late. That dynamic caused a problem. Since we didn't take a vacation last year, we decided to splurge on a two-bedroom. IT WAS AWESOME!  We got on the top floor with a perfect Gulf view from the balcony, and the bay side from the bedroom window. It ended up being the best vacation I ever had.

title: Nice BUT avoid at all cost during building works
review: We booked 5 days here as a break during our trip to florida to do disney, this was to be our relaxing part of the trip and in all the location, rooms etc were as expected BUT we were totally misinformed about building works. The hotel website informs you you cannot use the main pool Mon-Fri between 9-5 due to refurbishment, but you could use another pool and the beach, fine  we thought and booked. What it failed to tell you is that it is undergoing total major building works on the two main towers meaning that the noise levels, drilling, banging etc are intollerable around the pool and the beach infront, off to the other pool we go, it was not child friendly with a straight 5ft depth off the steps. We were forced to evacuate the hotel by 9am to public beaches each day which was…

title: Perfect vacation spot
review: This lovely resort has several buildings, all of which appear to be similarly equipped.  We stayed in a suite overlooking the golf course, the other half of our family outing stayed in a suite overlooking the lagoon.  Both were very attractively decorated, and fully equipped for those fortunate enough to stay for a week or so, with a fridge, stovetop burners, Bose radio, etc (no overhead fans - what's up with that?).  Very quiet, we never heard anything from a neighboring room, and the room was immaculate.  Three other buildings overlook the pool, the higher floors would have a gulf view.  We only had lunch at their poolside restaurant, served poolside, and they were fine.  Drinks were pretty darned good too!  The resort has several restaurants, one of which you'd have to drive…

title: Longboat Key Club and Resort is lovely with outstanding tennis facilities.
review: From the moment of arrival, the genuinely friendly staff made my 16 year old son and me feel welcome.  The room, two queen size beds with a balcony and an ocean view,  was immaculately clean with luxurious linens and perfect in size for us.   Suites have washer and dryer which we could have used.  Next time, I would request a ocean view room not facing the pool for a totally quiet balcony experience.    There were several eating options with incredibly delicious food with a tremendous variety of choices served by outstanding and efficient wait staff.  The beach was beautiful, quiet, and peaceful.  The umbrellas and chairs were complimentary provided by energetic young fellows willing to meet any request.  Kayaks were available to rent and thankfully no jetskis, sailboats,…

title: Beautiful beach and facilities
review: We just returned from a 4 day stay in an oceanfront club suite. Everything was very clean, and the beach and water was stunning. I can reccomend Portofino restaurant in the resort. It was delicious..so we went twice. I would reccomend a suite with kitchen because food and drinks were crazy expensive...$15 drinks with tip.so we brought lots of stuff with us, and there is a publix like 3 miles down the road. Lovely place...we will return next year.

title: A Gulf-Coast Paradise
review: Relax, Refresh and Rejuvenate at the beautiful resort.  Terrific rooms (suites have kitchenette, washer/dryer and many other amenities).  Beach and pool are excellent!  Lots to do or just relax.

title: Beautiful Resort - Great location and nice people !
review: We stayed 3 nights Sat, Sun and Monday.  Resort was crowded on Saturday and full of children.Sunday and Monday empty.  Our room (golf course view) was very nice, new and clean.  300 count egyptian sheets and plenty of towels.  We did have a small kitchenette which we did not use.  It was not your typical "kitchenette", very nice.  Granite bathroom and plenty big.  People were very nice.  Pool service on Saturday was excellent, Sunday and Monday was scant.  They do add a 20 percent service charge on your bill when you order drinks and food.  I did not appreciate that.  There is nothing to do at night,   You have to go out of the resort and make your own fun.  We never had either breakfast or dinner at the resort.  Only has a snack at the pool.  I will go back to this report, I…

title: We feel like an unwelcome guest
review: We are currently staying at the resort's one bedroom suites. My husband just can't put our finger on it - we just feel so unwelcome here.  We were just on the beach finally enjoying the shade of the unbrella and the cabana boys came along and took away the unbrella saying the be management said it was going to getting windier and the unbrellas need to come down.   I wonder if it had anything to do with it being 4:30 pm on a Sunday and the Cabana boys want to go home.   The wind wasn't affecting the unbrellas at all!    People looked very pissed.  One group of people were having a stand-off with the cabana boy.  Speaking of cabana boys - they are incredibly unfriendly and make you feel like you are a pain in the butt!  The welcome we had yesterday was NOT a welcome.  The woman at…

title: I want to go back!
review: I just got back from a quick three day stay at the resort and I wish I had stayed longer. My dad was participating in a conference and mom, brother (age 20) and I (age 23) tagged along for the fun. Many times I found myself saying, "I wish I could just live here"! The room was FANTASTIC. We stayed in building 7 overlooking the lagoon. Rumor has it that the lagoon views are more affordable than the beach view because you forgeo a larger room/balcony for the view of the beach & sun rise/set.   Being that we are from Florida, the allure of watching the sunset & seeing the beach wasn't as exciting as it would be if we were vacationing from somewhere up north. I would opt for a more affordable & bigger room any day!  My family had two club suites. One for my parents and one formy…

title: Fabulous beach resort but fabulously expensive charges
review: We have just returned from a wonderful holiday in Florida where we decided to spend the last few days of a hectic trip relaxing by the beach.  We selected LBKC based upon the excellent reviews.  We were not disappointed, the resort is immaculate and after requesting an upgrade we were thrilled with our suite in building four.  We had a beautiful view of the gulf and the private beach with a double balcony.  Decor and beds of high quality with great linens.  We had lunch by the pool most days and catered ourselves for convenience in our apartment, decent equipment for simple meals which we ate watching the sunset.  Our only gripe was the hidden costs, 20% service charge on all food and beverages, daily resort fee and daily room tax added.   We overheard other guests grumbling…

title: Repeat, relaxing vacations.
review: Excellent service. Rooms are more than adequate and very clean. Beach & services are excellent. Area is very nice.

title: good hotel
review: We stayed here for a week at the beginning of May.Bit dissappointed with the view from the room,we were at the back of building five.The washer/dryer was a good thing to have,with detergent being supplied. The staff were all very helpful and the couple of little problems we had were dealt with very quickly by housekeeping,although our bathrobes disappeared mid week and never returned! Overall we had a good experience with this hotel and would stay again.

title: Pure Heaven!
review: The rooms overlooking the lagoon are so beautiful! I wish I could live there year round. The room has all the comforts of home. I love all the closet and bathroom drawer space. The beach was very clean and the attendants always very helpful. We saw dolphins every day! This was our 3rd trip to Long Boat Key and the second time staying at the Long Boat Key Club Resort. We quickly realized our mistake in not staying there at our last visit and will not let that happen again! Thank you for such a wonderful resort and we can't wait to come back.

title: a wonderful place in a perfect location
review: We just came back from a wonderful stay at this resort.  We had a one bedroom, ocean view suite in building four.  What a spectacular view!  It took our breath away.  The hotel was spotless, the beach beautiful, and the staff extremely helpful.  We golfed one day (very expensive!), and ate a meal by the pool.  Otherwise, we cooked in our kitchen or ate with relatives at their homes on LBK.  So, I can't vouch for the restaurants at the hotel. But, the poolside meal was yummy, and I had a fabulous margarita!  It is an expensive place to stay, but this is a luxury resort.  And it feels like a luxury resort....so you get what you pay for.  There seemed to be a nice mix of people from elderly couples, to families with young kids.  We were there with teens.  My son loved the driving…

title: Beautiful Trip
review: We stayed at the LBK Resort a few weeks ago and absolutely loved it. The room was clean, well appointed and had a gorgeous view of the gulf. The property was safe and well lit. The beach side amenities were great. They have young men who will set you up with a cabana, or beach chairs and umbrella's at no fee. I suggest you tip them as they work very hard and very expect a tip. Tony, Ben and Calvin were the guys we used but all of them hustle and are very pleasant. We just  loved the view from the lanai. The pool was a bit crowded but it was spring break. I would love it if they could put in a beach side adult pool only but I am not sure there is the room. If we got up late all the pool side chairs were already taken but we came for the sand anyway.That would be the only way this…

title: Beautiful location, nice room amenities, needs some housekeeping
review: We stayed at the Long Boat Key Club in April 2010 and found the resort to be beautiful and the front desk very helpful. The pool is very nice and there were plenty of lounge chairs and tables despite having a fair number of people at the resort. The rooms had kitchens or kitchenettes and were a home away from home with one exception. We found that the housekeeping in the rooms left something to be desired. Housekeeping changed the linens and towels but I don't think the kitchen floor was washed in the whole 10 days we visited, lamps and tables needed dusting etc... The food at the resort was okay but not great and the drinks were on the expensive side. I paid $4.50 for a single fountain pop. The rooms are very comfortable but the beds are very, very soft.

title: We will be back to this resort!! Beautiful rooms and beaches
review: I did not know what to believe after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I am so happy we went through with our stay here during our spring break. The resort is very nice. We stayed in building #4. If you want to see spectacular sunsets and a view of the Gulf from every room, I would request this building. Very short walk to pool. Rooms on lower floors near pool could be noisy but we don't know that for sure. We were here with our 2 young kids and I let my youngest stay in the kids club for 3 of the 6 days we were there. That was really great too! Be advised that the Tennis Gardens, although beautiful are not right at the resort. You must drive about 3 miles away and if you don't have a car they will shuttle you there at no cost and they are very prompt when you call for your ride.…

title: Well-planned resort with good amenities
review: Private and scenic resort located at the south end of Longboat Key. Our ocean front suite had two small balconies - watching boats come through the bay channel was relaxing as was having am coffee with the delivered newspaper.  Our king bed was new like with good linens. You sleep with the sight/sounds of the ocean and the breeze is heaven. The living area had tasteful/quality furniture and the small kitchen was a gem, loved having a washer/dryer.  The bathroom was large with a long and spacious dressing area. The shower pressure was not too good.  The tennis courts are well-maintained and an easy walk. There is also a newer tennis facility up the road.  We enjoyed lunch on the beach - the menu should offer a good basic BLT or egg salad sandwich without all the gourmet "food…

title: Incredible Beach Location
review: If you want an incredible private beach location, an immaculate hotel room with terrific customer service, this is the place to stay.  The only downside is the cost.  Specifically the resort fee of $20/night is a little much with an average room running $375-425/night. Either drop the fee or round off the room rate.  The extra resort fee is somewhat insulting at checkout especially for an extended stay (it adds up quickly).

title: This Resort is Fabulous
review: This is the second time we've stayed at the Longboat Key Club & Resort for our traditional family spring break. Although very pricey, this is by far our favorite place to stay in Florida. Not only is the resort wonderful, but the Longboat Key/St. Armand's/Sarasota area is beautiful, easily accessible and a great base for seeing the sights on the west coast of Florida. The resort itself has tremendous amenities. A secluded private beach, golf course, fitness facilities, spa, and great restaurants. We stayed in a two bedroom suite which worked well for my wife and our two teenage sons as the suite was spacious and contained all the furnishings to make a family comfortable. "The kitchen was a tad bit small for a large suite and the kitchenware a bit slim to make a sophisticated…

title: One of the best options in the Sarasota area
review: Spent a week a LBKC this time and liked it twice as much as our first 3 day stay in 2008.  Stayed in a Jr suite overlooking the beach. Got a decent rate for the weekdays, but paid $70 more for the 3 weekend days.  Room was in excellent shape, as it was the first time. Had no trouble getting our desired tee times, but had trouble getting into the Portofina restaurant before 8:30. Food in all the restaurants was well prepared and very good.  It should be for the prices.  Thought the drink prices at the pool bar a bit over the top ($13 margaritas), but that was a self inflicted wound for playing the big shot and picking up tap for a happy hour with some friends.  The Hotel Staff was pleasant and prompt, including the response to a 9PM problem getting the hard wire internet to work.…

title: Sophisticated accommodations, gorgeous views, countless amenities and attentive staff at this deluxe Florida resort.
review: Immaculately maintained, high-end, deluxe accommodations, gorgeous views, and countless amenities make the Longboat Key Club & Resort a must stay Florida destination.  But what sets the Longboat Key Club apart from its competition is the attentiveness of its staff.  The concierges were particularly helpful, suggesting numerous activities and making a special reservation for my family at the nearby Chart House restaurant.  When we arrived at the restaurant we had a VIP table reserved overlooking the bay and special menus with our names printed on them.  My kids got a real kick out of the experience.  My nine year old daughter also received her first spa treatment in the Longboat Key Club spa, which was clearly the highlight of her stay.  In addition to golf, tennis, swimming and…

title: Another Nice Stay at the Longboat Key Club
review: We spent five nights during our second stay at the Longboat Key Club.  Beautiful pool and beach.  The room was spacious and had a kitchen.  I agree with other reviewers in that the room was a little worn.  Not enough to really bother me, but it does have some worn areas- dirty grout, little spots here and there.  If you are traveling with family, the kitchen is helpful, especially for a low cost breakfast.  All restaurants are pretty pricey as you would expect.  Our best and least priced meal was in St. Armand's Circle at the Columbia restaurant.  Also, Mote Aquarium is a fun place for the kids to roam and pet the stingrays.  Very close to LKC.  I would definitely recommend this hotel, but would not recommend its restaurants for children.  If you are looking for a gorgeous,…

title: nice location, good service, poor maintainence
review: Large resort with spacious rooms, lovely beach on pretty Longboat Key. Rooms and suites are well equipped by poorly maintained.  Grout between tiles are stained and dirty, bathtub caulking is moldy, and sofas and carpet are worn. All the walkways have worn and dirty cement. The entire resort has seen better days and needs an upgrade.

title: Great place to relax and unwind at the end of our trip
review: We had 6 nights at Longboat Key Club after some time in New York and Naples, FL.    The room was excellent - fully equipped kitchen, great for self catering breakfasts and lunch once we'd stocked up at Publix, about 4 miles away.  Also had a washing machine and drier which was useful.  Housekeeping constantly stock up your coffee, washing powder and dishwashing detergent supplies.  We had an ocean view room with excellent views of the pool, beach and sunsets.  Spacious balcony - plenty of room to sit, eat and relax out side.  Huge, comfy bed, large plasma tv, bose radio/cd player, tons of wardrobe space (and plenty of hangers).  Pretty much everything we wanted.  Only downside was the water pressure on the shower wasn't brilliant - but it was adequate. Also, much of the in-room…

title: nice location but very worn down
review: The resort is in a great location.  The staff was very good.  Surprised at the worn down look of the hotel.   Beach chairs were older and cabanas pieced together with plywood.  Our room had a great view but the bed was something out of an I love lucy show.  We kept sinking into the middle.  Requested another room and staff said all rooms were built at the same time.   When I checked out i found out i had a daily fee for cabanas. beach towels, parking and pool use.  The room was 400 and change/night and felt like i was in a holiday inn.  I would not go back if only for the added fees that were never explained. Its a shame because the location and set up is very nice.   The kicker was there is no wireless in the hotel..soI had to sit in my hotel room when working.

title: Great Choice for Tennis + Beach
review: We needed a tennis vacation with a great beach, and we got it.   New Tennis Gardens are simply outstanding - facilities, game arranging, service, setting.   Beach is equally so.    Hotel room was new and very comfortable, with nice in-room amenities and excellent gulf view on the balcony.   Fridge, sink and a few dishes makes it easy to breakfast on the balcony.  Shop at Publix next to the tennis.    Downsides are the 3 miles between the tennis gardens and the hotel/beach facility.  (Although there are still 4 courts on the beach side, we never used them).  Definitely need a car.   And the restaurant options at the hotel are limited to quiet, high end (and expensive) dining.  Nothing outside at night, and no life at all, completely quiet.  If you want something more casual,…

title: The gulf of Mexico at it's best.
review: I hosted a business meeting for my district at this location and I must say that I have never been involved in a meeting that went as smoothly as this one.  From the inital contact with the director of sales to the planning of the menus and breaks, they were always there to help and make suggestions.  They went the extra mile in contacting outside vendors for certain events and assisted with the billing.  Speaking of billing, there were no surprises when the final bill was presented and all was in order.  Any needs that arose during the meeting were addressed and met with true customer service in mind.   As for the facility itself, there is not a finer place to visit or work as the case was with my group.  Wonderful beach, golf courses, marina and the accomadations were some of…

title: Great "Girls Getaway" destination!
review: My Mom (just turned 80) and sister and I (both 50's) just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at this full service resort.  We chose their "Girls Getaway Package" which included 8 Spa Treatments, $50 comp at Breakfast each day with several locations on site to choose from, free shuttle service, and a photo session on the beach with a professional photographer (who was wonderful!).  We were given a beautiful and spacious 2 bedroom Suite overlooking the ocean with spectacular views.  The entire staff were extremely courteous and service oriented.  We rented a car and found it very easy to get over to St. Armands Circle for great shops and restaurants.  The 9000 sq ft spa was beyond our expectations and our experience was top shelf!  Would love to go back someday ...

title: Gorgeous location and accommodations
review: We stayed in a two bedroom oceanfront unit on the 10th floor for two nights.  The interior amenities were fabulous and so beautifully done.  The kitchen was well stocked with appliances and utensils -- it even had a bar set!  The balcony was the full length of the unit so that you could walk onto it from the living room and both bedrooms.  We only used the pool and beach, both of which were excellent.  The beach had nice lounge chairs with built in cabanas and the sand was very nice.  We had lunch at the pool bar and the coconut shrimp was excellent.  I had a massage at the spa which was grossly overpriced at $130.  The one problem with this place is that everything involves an extra charge.  For example, even printing at the business center entails an extra charge, as well as…

title: Very nice with minor issues
review: Our stay for five nights at Longboat Key was largely very enjoyable.  The room was clean and is good shape and had all the amenites that were promised.  The staff, for the most part, was friendly and helpful.  After making the reservation a couple months in advance of the trip, we were called and told that one of the two swimming pools would be closed for maintenance during our stay, but that the second pool would be open and was "close by".  I'm not sure what their definition of "close by" is, but a 4 mile drive does not fit mine.  We were not informed of that at the front desk at check-in and only discovered this after reading the informaiton in our room.  We never went to the pool and went to the beach instead which was fine.  However, we also requested an upper floor, but…

title: Superb service, beautiful beach, and great accomodations
review: I originally booked a room at the Hilton nearby based on the name brand.  Then, it dawned upon me that I should probably read their customer reviews before committing.  Well, the Hilton reviews weren't very good while the reviews for Longboat Key Club Resort were quite impressive.  I surprised my wife for her birthday and booked a stay at the property for 4 nights.  The room and view we had in building #1 on the 4th floor was great.  NIce balcony with chairs and table overlooking a stretch of beach that isn't used much for tanning or swimming.  We spent two days of our stay laying out on the beautiful beach and couldn't believe how nicely we were treated by the gentlemen setting up chairs and umbrellas.  We ate dinner at Portofino one night when we didn't feel like driving much…

title: Beautiful Location, pity about the hotel
review: We checked into this hotel following a stay at the Ritz Carlton in Orlando.  We stayed in a 2 bedroomed suite which was very nicely furnished and the view was fantastic. We found the showers in both the bathroom very poor. Either scalding hot water or freezing.  The times we ate in the hotel restaurant we felt ill afterwards. One morning we went down to the beach. We went to collect towels from the pool attendant who advised there were no towels left and as he didnt know how long they would be, not to bother waiting for them. The breakfasts were of poor quality and very expensive. Although the rooms were nicely decorated and large the pool was small and outdated and very busy.

title: Excellent location for a well earned rest
review: Stayed here for the last 4 nights of our 16 nights in Florida, hoping for a well earned rest. We weren't disappointed. What a fabulous location ovelooking the Gulf and the white sands of Long Boat Key. From the outside the buildings look old and dated but once inside the rooms, are light and airy and very modern. We had requested a Club View Suite and overlooked the Gulf and the pool. The king size bed was very comfortable - the teenagers didn't think the sofa bed was that comfy but it didn't stop them sleeping in it!! The room was cleaned daily and for once there were enough towels for all of us! The kitchenette was well equipped and even had a dishwasher and washing machine. The pool is very small and not really big enough for the size of the complex. The beach is well…

title: Ugly on the outside, beautiful on the inside, excellent view.
review: The building that is. 40 to 50 years old, the outside of the building reminds me of a "churched up" Soviet-style apartment building. The good news is that you'd probably be safe in a hurricane.  They've done their best to refurb the rooms. They are really nicely appointed. The beds are super-comfortable and the bedding, very plush. What gives it away is the old-style, worn sliding doors to the balcony and the other interior doors. Interior doors age is barely covered by subsequent coats of paint.  Our suite (I think all the "rooms" are suites) was on the 5th floor, facing the Gulf, as most of them do. Incredible, romantic, sunset west view rooms. "Ocean front, ocean view, ocean access" always mean different things. At this property, it means looking out to the Gulf waters (with…

title: Perfect Wedding, Perfect Place
review: We stayed at LBK for 8 nights at the beginning of July.  We also had our wedding there which was absolutely perfect.  Many of our friends and family also stayed at  LBK and the resort was very accommodating to everyone.    There are five  guest room buildings at the resort.  Building one was closed for repairs but is directly on the beach.  Buildings two and three are on top of the pool and close to the beach.  Building four is also close to the beach, but is away from the pool noise and traffic.  Building five is the furthest away from the pool, main building, and beach, but it over looks the golf course.  Each room has its own AC unit and hot water tanks, large flat screen TV, and balconies.  We stayed in Building 4 on the third floor with an ocean view. Our room number was…

title: Such a great place, very sad to leave
review: This place is GORGEOUS! We stayed in a large suite with a small kitchen. The staff are all very helpful. The pool is lovely and the private beach is just steps away. Cabanas, loungers, and towels are all provided.  Perfect location and within a 5 min drive of a Publix for self catering and St Armands circle for shopping and restaurants.   My only gripe would be that empty drinks glasses were left on the tables around the pool all day which didn't look too nice. The bar tender and the pool attendents could have cleared these away rather than waiting until the end of the day to do so.  All in all though, a fab stay and try the spa, it's got a great range of treatments.

title: Two extremely happy English families
review: It was our 2nd visit to a club suite at the resort, we were joined by our best friends first timers to U.S. We have been back in Blighty now for 3 weeks and are still depressed at having to come home! My family and I are 'lucky' enough to have gone to some truly wonderful places all around the world but WOW this place is just THE BEST !  From bar staff to concierge, from maids to the beach guys, FANTASTIC!  All this without any real stuffiness.   Just a pity the price doubles when we want to go back in Novemeber, so we'll be slumming it at the Ritz-carlton.   Our friends are truly smitten by this most beautiful place.

title: Nirvana on Longboat Key
review: My husband, college aged daughter and I checked in to this gated resort conveniently located close to St Armand Circle on June 17th after a disappointing one night stay at nearby  Lido Beach Resort.  Instantly I knew that we had found the perfect spot.  The reception staff was friendly and very accommodating, even showing us the suite before we checked in.  Our beachfront one bedroom suite was on the 3rd flloor of building 1 with a fabulous view.  The suite itself was recently updated with elegant and comfortable furnishings - granite counters in kitchen and bath,  LCD TV s in bedroom and living room, comfortable king sized bed, queen sleeper couch in living room, two closets, plenty of built in storage, even a small washer and dryer.  The kitchen was full sized and well…

title: WOW!! Loved it!
review: My family and I have been yearly visitors to the Longboat Key area for the past 15 years.  We are generally pretty loyal to a resort once we find a place that we love.  For the past 8 years we have stayed at the Lido Beach Resort but after a disappointing stay last year (the place is getting a little run down and dirty) we decided we needed a change and I'm so glad we did!  The Longboat Key Club and Resort was absolutly WONDERFUL.  From the moment we pulled up their friendly, curteous staff was available for whatever you needed and made us feel very welcome.  I had requested a room near the pool with a gulf view.  Our room was located in building 3 which is right in front of the pool and our balcony had a beautiful view directly facing the gulf.  We chose the club suite with the…

title: Location was fantastic and service was second to none
review: I did not know what to expect when I arrived at Longboat key as I had heard that it was an expensive residential area. The staff in the hotel were extremely helpful and when when we were shown to our room we we over the moon with the ocean view. The pool area was beautiful and very clean there was direct access to the beach which was white sands clear warm water and very peaceful,.You could sit for hours and watch the pelicans diving for fish and the dolphins playing in the water, the views accross the key were also lovely. In a car it was very easy to reach shops and restuarants and other beaches although there was no need as our beach was nicer anyway.

title: Great Family Getaway
review: Most of the reviews that I read on your site are right on target.  The positives: 1. Service: From check-in to check-out absolutely friendly and helpful. Lynda at the front desk was beyond accommodating with our room requests. Ivor, Sherman and Heather at concierge gave us great restaurant and other suggestions. The beach staff and bartenders also had a great positive attitude. 2. Location: Easily one of the best beaches in Florida-white powdery sand almost as clear water as the Bahamas. Outstanding for swimming, running and with breathtaking sunsets!!! Outstanding tennis facilities ( 4 courts by the hotel and 20+ at the "Harbourside" location- an easy 5 minute drive away). John the head pro was fantastic and such a nice guy. 3. Nearby activities: Boat rentals for skiing,…

title: ABSOLUTELY PERFECT FOR MY FAMILY !!!
review: I can't say enough good things about our recent eight night visit to Longboat Key Club & Resort.  We are VERY finnicky travelers in EVERY way.  I will be happy to answer any specific questions families considering LKC&R may have.  Couples only......this resort is perfect for you as well !!!

title: Ideal location with breathtaking sunsets and beautiful beaches.
review: This was an ideal spot to hit the beach with our three teenagers. Our two bedroom suite overlooking the Pacific was amazing. We all had plenty of space and the local grocery store and our beautiful full kitchen allowed us to grab breakfast at our leisure, run on the hard packed sand, search for sand dollars and look forward to each evenings' incredible sunset. We found plenty of great restaurants to explore and shops to visit. Loved Hemmingway's and The Dockside.The staff was kind and accommodating to my elderly parents.
