The great facilities gave all of us plenty of choices. The food was pricey but not out of line with the quality of this resort. We found a fabulous internet special and can't wait to return!!

title: Longboat Key Club- Nice but pricey.
review: We stayed at the Longboat Key Club over Memorial Day weekend, and while it is nice, it is pricey.  Our room was nice but at quite a hefty price. Golf rates, while discounted because we puchased two rounds, were still higher than other local courses and the resort course was not as nice. $14 for a wrap(in addition to a service fee, tax, and tax on the service fee) seemed a little pricey.These service fees are in additon to the $33 daily resort fee.  If you have deep pockets stay there - but there are plenty of condo rentals with a smiliar view at  much cheaper price.

title: There's a reason we go back every year
review: The best value out there. The attention to detail is unmatched. While some have said the food is expensive, it's less expensive than many other resorts. As noted, there are cheaper options for food in the area, so that's something to consider. Surrounding area is great. I've stayed here about 15 times and have never had a bad meal - at the resort or at any restaurant in the area.

title: My new favorite place!
review: The pictures for this resort did not paint a great picture for me prior to our visit.  I thought it would be an acceptable place to spend our vacation.  We couldn't have been more excited when we saw our suite and explored the resort...it was fantastic.  Everyone in the family loved this place!  The rooms, the service, the beach...everything was top notch and I will definitely come back next year!  Longboat key is a wonderful place!

title: Perfect in every way
review: We came to this resort after 4 days at the parks for some relaxation and it delivered!   Everyone we encountered at this beautiful resort was wonderful.  From check in to check out we could not ask for better service.  Not overbearing or pretentious but you know they were there for whatever you needed.   Cleaning staff was wonderful.   We had a club suite room and it was gorgeous.  We were in building 2 and I have to disagree with previous reviewer, even though we were overlooking the pool as well as the gulf it was quiet.  The pool sounds really didn't travel up or maybe it was great insulation once the sliders were closed?   In any case, having both views was fantastic to keep an eye on everyone.  There was a partition wall on the balcony so one side was a complete gulf view…

title: Fantastic Location, Great Price!!
review: We had reserved a room at this resort a couple years ago and cancelled due to the price and perception that it would be too upscale for our extended family.  After seeing a great rate on the internet, my husband & I decided to spend a week at the resort.  After staying here, we decided we definitely made a mistake when we cancelled our reservations a couple years ago!  The service and rooms are terrific.  At the recommendation of another tripadvisor traveler, we requested an upper floor in building 4.  A must-do!  This building overlooks the beach and is incredibly quiet.  The oceanview in buildings 2 & 3 actually overlook the pool which is incredibly busy and noisy from sunrise to sunset.  Building 4 is great!  We rented a club suite, which has a kitchen, seating area, sleeping…

title: Fantastic Family Holiday
review: We stayed at the Resort for 3 weeks for our first holiday with our 12 month old.   We couldn't have stayed at a better place.  We had a 2-bedroomed suite with full kitchen which was perfect for us as it had dishwasher, microwave plus washing machine and dryer.  We were on the 10th floor with stunning views over the beach.  The weather was perfect and the service impeccable.  We enjoyed hiring bikes and going to nearby St Armaund's circle for shopping and food.  Kilwins do great icecream and fudge!   Recommended tour: kayaking in the mangroves organised through the Mote Aquarium; segway tour of Sarasota organised through Florida Everglides.  We also enjoyed trips to Busch Gardens in Tampa and the Kennedy Space Center (a bit of a drive and not enough time as we only had one day,…

title: Great service - beautiful location
review: I have stayed at LBK Club on numerous occasions in the past ten years... But i have not been there since September 2007 so I was curious to see how things were at the resort after having read some things here and elsewhere about the state of the resort.  Stayed there for four nights from March 7 - 11 and I still have great things to say about the place.    The service was excellent -- from the front desk personnel, to the pool waiters, to the housekeeping staff, to the beach staff -- everyone was unfailingly helpful and pleasant.  One example -- I could not figure out how to cut on the ice maker in my frig.  I should have called and asked for help but did not realize that there was no ice until around 9:00 on the evening of my first day there. I just wanted a cup of ice for a…

title: Just perfect
review: Although this resort was  expensive I felt it was worth every penny and it  met my expectations. The club suite, ,beach view,  was large and furnished to a high standard. Quality equipment eg bone china crockery, the softest cotton sheets ever, heavy saucepans , lots of towels.  Didn't expect 2 balconies, one to dine on - one  to lie out on - but only  space for one sunbed. The beach view also included the pool and the sunset and  was amazing. The staff were nice, the housekeeping good, food at the pool restaurant excellent. Pool  area not that spacious and felt a bit cramped at times . It could also get noisy with piped music and kids shouting but the beach is very near , huge and quiet , if you like peace and quiet the beach would be best if pool is busy.  Plenty of good…

title: Not worth it
review: Pretend to be 4 star, actually maybe 2 star.  Terrible golf course, average tennis, expensive and below average food, especially bad when catered for business meetings.  Longboat is a nice island, look for another play to stay for sure!

title: Great Resort
review: We are just back from this resort where we stayed 12 days. We had a Clubsuite for the two of us and we enjoyed the  excellent service, loved the decoration, the new furniture, the fully equiped kitchen and the large flat TV. Beach service excellent, Swimming Pool ok but a little noisy atmosphere (especially during Thanksgiving).  We'll be back next year;

title: Very Nice Resort With Bad Golf Course
review: the club was very nice. the rooms were spacious and well furnished and the beach was pretty. meals were pricey and overall the club is not a very good value, especially since they tack on a 20% service fee to any fee (of which only a percentage goes to the host/hostess). the quality of the resort as a whole is top-notch, with good service and luxurious accomodations.   the golf, nonetheless, is horrible. the golf course is straight and boring, with little variety or personality. it is not very well kept and the grass is very choppy and overly soft. the greens are very slow.

title: Loved every minute of it
review: When we were at this resort about 2 years ago, renovations were just starting, this trip they were complete, wow. I don't remember the rooms being so nice, we had a club suite with a partial ocean view / part pool on the third floor, I have 0 complaints about this stay. I found the entire staff very nice, especially the wait staff. I loved the decor of the room, it was equipped with the softest hotel robes I have ever felt along with 2 types of towels, one set was super soft, the other was a nice bath sheet. Luckily the weather was just about perfect. We stayed at the hotel from Wed - Sunday.   SUGGESTION: If you are a pool person then I would recommend anyone staying over the weekend to get to the pool on Saturday around 9:30am or 10am if you want to get a chair, they all…

title: I miss the resort at long boat key
review: We had our wedding here last October and loved the resort and the staff. It was simply amazing. 5s all the way. I would definitely go back here again but my wife wants to go some other places in the U.S. before we go back to Florida. These were probably the cleanest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. The resort was beautifully maintained and the golf course was great as well. We had 75 guests come from Kentucky and Illinois and everyone that stayed at the resort loved it as well.  Karen who coordinates the weddings is amazing and I would highly recommend the resort for weddings. They can do 2 wedding at a time on each end of the resort but I dont think that they interfere with the rest of the resort.

title: Fantastic Fantastic Fantastic
review: We travelled with our two girls aged 6 & 2 to America to visit Disney and Sarasota. Our 1st stop at Disney was everything and more than expected. We stayed in the Animal Kingdom Lodge on the site. From the check in we were greeted with smiles and they never stopped. The hotel is fantastic for kids and from our window every day we saw Giraffe, Zebra grazing and lots lots more. The food although large portions was fantastic both in the hotel and Disney park. After 4 days in Disney we travelled by car to Sarasota. The drive was very easy and we felt safe driving. Our arrival at Longboat Key Club and Resort was again greeted with smiles and very friendly helpful staff. Our room was overlooking the sea in building four just by the sand and round the corner from the pool. It was…

title: First Class at a Fair Price
review: Our family (myself, spouse, and 15 year old daughter) visited the Resort from July 19-26th 2008, and found it to be everything it was advertised to be and more.   We flew Northwest into Tampa International (another great experience). We used alamo rent a car, which allowed us to select our own car. That was awesome. We selected a PT Cruiser because our daughter never rode in one. It was a good choice because it got great gas mileage.  It took about 50 minutes to drive from Tampa to Longboat. We got off 275 at Manatee and took a very scenic route 789 down the coastal islands into Longboat. Let me say this area is very, very clean. The resort is absolutely spotless and the landscaping is top notch.  Check-in took all of 5 minutes. Check-in time was 3pm, but we were handed our keys…

title: Wonderful Experience-Attended a wedding weekend
review: We stayed at this resort July 17th-21st. We were attending my girlfriend’s wedding.  We had a lagoon facing room on the 7th floor. The view was beautiful. The staff was courteous and attentive. Check in was at 3:00 and we arrived at 12:00 and our room was ready. We had out 21 month old with us and the pack and play we requested was already set up in the room. The rooms were renovated and very clean. The beds were very comfortable.        The beach was not crowded at all. We never had a problem getting a cabana and there was always someone offering to set it up.  There was also someone always walking around asking if you needed a drink.  The pool was a little crowded so it was sometimes hard to get a chair there. It is definitely a family resort, tons of kids.        The wedding…

title: Great vacation
review: We stayed here last week and had a very nice time.  I didn't realize there was a courtesy shuttle, but the hotel has bikes you can use, so we rode the bikes to St. Armand's circle for breakfast.  We only ate one meal at the hotel and that was lunch.  We thought it was very good, but there were so many other restaurants we wanted to try. We had a beachview suite and our room was clean, well maintained during our stay, and it was incredibly convenient to have a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, and washer & dryer! We were told that the hotel had been renovated recently and we thought the room was very nice.  Big beautiful bed, nice linens and towels, lovely sitting area and nice balcony.  The beach was great and it was nice having the choice of a cabana or beach chairs and umbrellas.…

title: A great family week at Longboat Key Club.
review: After a week touring Orlando and the theme parks, Longboat Key Club was a fantastic second week choice. The beach is breathtaking with the warm clear waters, fish swimming around your feet, beautiful shells brought in by the gentle waves and powder white sand - it was just perfect. The hotel food during the day at Barefoots was fantastic and the pool bar always gave a great service. We had a Club House Suite which was delightful with superb views over the creek and golfcourse. The only disappointment was that the courtesy bus service to St Armands Circle and the local restuarants stopped at 4pm. The restuarants in the hotel were far too formal in the evening and not suitable for children. However, 10mins walk from the hotel is the Dry Dock Grill - fabulous food and atmosphere.…

title: Longboat Key Club--a winner
review: We are just back from an eight-day stay at Longboat Key Club in Sarasota.  It could not have been better!  Our room, "ocean view club suite" had a marvelous bed,  double balcony, full kitchen and washer/dryer, terrific view.  The beach was uncrowded and lovely.  One caution:  if you like quiet at night, be sure to ask for building 1 or 4;  buildings 2 & 3  face the pool and things get active.   I'd request an upper floor(we were on the 2nd).  The property is pristine, spa is expensive but very good, fitness center small but complete.  We shall return!

title: Great Vacation - too short!
review: The suite was beautifully decorated, clean, and very large. We had a private deck below, and balconies. A short walk to the beach. We had views of the ocean.   The room service was excellent. The service at the pool was excellent. Everyone was polite, friendly, and the food was delicious!  I would recommend this place highly for anyone wanting to take a nice Florida vacation where you don't want to think about anything and just relax. The pool was great, the beach was fun. This was a great place for families - I wouldn't recommend this to a couple taking a honeymoon, just because there was alot of children there.

title: Beautiful Layout--Lacks Cleanliness
review: Beautiful layout for our best friends and my husband and I.  We go away every year together and this two bedroom suite is so perfect for us because both bedrooms are on the Gulf.   Unfortunately, the condo was not clean and our complaints the first day brought two staff members who came and cleaned out the refrigerator (that was filthy) and cleaned out the kitchen drawers and cabinets (that were also filthy) and put everything in the dishwasher.  The staff member said someone would be by the next day to thoroughly clean the condo and that never happened.    The rugs were stained in the living room and bedrooms and there was a half inch of dust on all the baseboards alond with the dust behind the beds and along the bed frames including cheerios and other items that were not…

title: Top Notch in Every Way
review: Spent a week at the Long Boat Key Club the first week of May.  My wife and I are pretty picky, and we give the experience a BIG thumbs up.  There is one major negative to this resort.  It is EXPENSIVE.  Obviously the room rates are high, but watch out when you order drinks (after mandatory gratuity and resort tax, a glass of wine and a mixed drink set my wife and I back $29).  But, that is really our only complaint.  Service was outstanding, accomodations were outstanding, food was fantastic, pool and beach perfect (although a few more chairs at the pool would help), and our room was truly top notch.  Some hints:  +  Going in early May was ideal.  The room rates are at their lowest, it wasn't overly crowded, and the weather was very warm - but not uncomfortably hot.  +  Take…

title: Oh dear Oh dear!
review: First impressions of the hotel aren't great. It's certainly not the prettiest of resorts - dreary grey tower blocks.  Keeping an open mind we checked into our two bedroomed suite and were pleasantly surprised. Cosmetically the suite is very appealing, lovely bedrooms, great lounge, well equipped kitchen and OK bathrooms.   The problems started when the air con kicked in. Well, to say it was noisy would be an understatement! We had to turn the TV up to almost full-blast to hear it! We called down to reception who came up and told us they had fixed it, but lo and behold the noise returned that evening. We had to turn it off at night to sleep!!  The toilet in our ensuite stopped flushing twice whilst we were there and the towel rail came off in my husband's hands.   On a positive…

title: Not worth the money
review: I don’t think the idea of this place works.  You rent a room (or small apartment) in a private golf club, when it’s not being used by its owners.  During March 8-15, we paid $900 per night plus taxes and daily resort fee.  This was for a two-bedroom suite at a discounted rate.  I think for the price we were expecting something a little out of the ordinary, but it’s anything but.  The layout is a decent sized living room, with a small kitchen attached, flanked by a bedroom on either side.  Our living room squeezed in a small couch (not quite big enough for an adult to stretch out on), two armchairs, a big coffee table, a desk (with no wireless internet) a large dining table and a tall entertainment unit.  It did not feel spacious.  The bedrooms are fine (the bed was comfortable),…

title: Great Choice for a Family Vacation
review: We booked this hotel directly from the resort website.  Thank you to another reviewer who suggested checking the Specials & Packages section for the best price.  We booked the Weekend Getaway and got a free fourth night -which was actually about $200 less than what we had originally booked with AAA.  Check in was quick and friendly.  We were not expecting to get into our room as it was only 9:30 am when we arrived.  To our delight the room was ready for us.  We had requested be on the top floor and this request was honored.    Building 5:  We opted for the golf course view because it looked a little more quiet and  away from the pool.  I turned out to be a great choice.  The view was actually much more than the golf course.  There were beautiful trees with landscaping all around…

title: Great for a family vacation, from a picky traveller
review: My husband I are used to staying at Conde Nast Gold List properties and have a prety high standard of travel.  Amex Travel had suggested this property when we requested a safe easy place to stay with our 8 month old baby boy.  For this trip we wanted to stay in the country since he hasn't completed his immunizations, and wanted to be near a decent hospital in case of emergency (yes, a bit neurotic).  After reading some of the reviews we were ready to cancel the trip - bug in the rooms, etc. - I was not willing to allow someone to spray the room with a little baby crawling around all over the place.  We finally decided to go anyway since we needed the break.    First let me say THERE WERE ZERO BUGS - we checked every cabinet right when we checked in and were prepared to have to…

title: VERY NICE 2 BR Suite but...
review: We had a 2 BR suite on the 7th floor of Building No. 2; a great location on the hotel property although I think all the buildings were convenient.  It had wonderful views, and a large balcony that stretched across the front of the bedrooms and living room accessible by sliders from each bedroom and the living room.  There was a table with 4 chairs on the balcony if you wanted to eat outside, a chaise lounge, and a couple other chairs outside the bedroom to enjoy the view of the beach.  The suite was very spacious and well appointed; each bedroom was large with very large closets.  There were a total of three large plasma TVs.  It had a large living room and a small kitchen with 2 counter seats.  It had ample supplies (hair dryer, iron and board, dishes, blender, pots, pans,…

title: Great stay
review: Loved the Longboat key club. Great staff, excellent service, perfect property and location.

title: Long Weekend in Sarasota
review: Classy place.  Found a deal online ($250 per night).

title: Lovely, with a few small "but ..."s
review: I stayed on the 4 days immediately before Christmas.  My wife and two teenage children had a two-bedroomed suite.  The suite had everything you could wish for and was very comfortable and exceptionally well-serviced.  The resort is centred around its pool and beach areas.  Again, this are attractive and very effectively administered, although the pool area lacked changing facilities and it never was clear to me where you were supposed to change between resort and pool-wear.  I used the restaurants and bar a fair bit: pricey but generally good quality and excellent service.  I was a little annoyed to have a $90 bottle of red wine chilled but this was probably the only "miss" on the catering.  The room service was equally good.  Of all he things we did take we forgot to take a…

title: Thoroughly reccomend Longboat key Clu
review: We (myself, Wife & 2 kids, 3yrs and 6months) stayed at Longboat Key Club mid Sep 07, after reading mixed reviews on here I was fairly nervous on arrival, esp after long flight with 2 kids. We'd opted for a 1 bed suite, beach view. The suite itself was very impressive after a refurb which I believe extends to whole resort? The air con was a bug bear, in the end we decided that rather than wake the kids up we'd turn it off whilst sleeping and this was never really a problem, maybe it would be if temp's were really high. Plasma TV's in both rooms, internet availible on them as well at low fee, well equipped kitchen massive plus. Cot provided as part of 'pack and play' kit.  The resort itself was great, pool size from pics was deceiving and whilst we were there we never failed to…

title: Not worth the money--and attitude
review: We stayed for our anniversary in a room that had loud a/c and bugs.  It was quite far from the beach...and the maids began knocking on our door at 1015am to get us out of the room.  We were charged a resort fee for each day--even the day that were were forced out of our room at 1045am.  No where in the confirmation was the resort fee mentioned--and when I inquired of why ...no response.  The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth.  There are too many other properties to choose from!

title: An Paradise..  Great location, Great hotel
review: My Wife and I stayed here on the final week of our USA Honeymoon.  We wanted somewhere to wind down and relax after visiting NY and Miami.  I have to say it ticked all the boxes.  Firstly our room was a club suite and overlooked a beautiful lagoon where we could watch Dolphins and Manatee’s play.  The view could not have been more idyllic. The room itself was huge.  We had as kitchen, dining area, queen size bed and a fantastic living room.  The hotel’s staff were so professional that they all knew your name and never forgot it.  The staff could not have been friendlier.  The food; pool bar or restaurant was 5 star and the waiters had an extensive knowledge of wine and the menu.  The hotel has its own private beach with fine white sand and beach boys to fluff your towels.  The…

title: Fantastic family beach resort - dream location but pricey food
review: We travelled for a beach weekend to Longboat Key Club (LBKC) from our holiday home in Orlando.  We were very hesitant as we drove up, it looked more like a time-share than a 5 * hotel and we were not aware that the rooms are actually apartments rather than hotel rooms.    However, we were delighted with our 2 bed suite overlooking the Gulf and beach - breathtaking views and the suite had obviously recently been made over - very modern and luxurious.  The kitchen was a dream - better than mine at home!  And travelling with 4 kids (twin babies of 10 months) it was a godsend for preparing and storing their food and milk.  We also had a full washer and dryer so were really self-sufficient.   The pool area was great with towel service for the loungers and the stunning beach (once…

title: Best way to enjoy Sarasota
review: I just got back from 2 weeks in Florida and 1 week at the Longboat Key Resort. As a Florida native, now living in Paris, I had never had the chance to just stay in a hotel and relax before. I was a bit apprehensive, but I can say that this was truly fantastic. Sarasota, well known for it's white sandy beaches, is also a hot place in Summer. Staying out on Longboat Key was the perfect choice.  Rooms: There are 4 buildings, but we stayed in building 2 which had easy access to the pool and the beach. They have guest rooms and suites. We upgraded to a suite on arrival (was feeling spoiled by then!) and had a fully equipped kitchen, refrigerator/toaster/dinnerware/washer/dryer, ensuite bathroom, balcony with view of the beach/pool/sunset, and overall very clean. A nice big high bed…

title: Fabulous!
review: Was a little apprehensive about booking this resort following previous reviews, but we were delighted with the Longboat key Club.  The rooms were spacious, clean, nicely decorated and roomy.  We had a room with a double bed and sofa bed (for the 2 children aged 9 and 6) and a very useful small kitchen area.  A sea view would have been lovely but the golf view still very nice!The pool (and the pool bar) and beach were glorious, the service excellent and the setting perfect. A couple of things to note:  The hotel restaurant is quite formal and expensive - try the golf club for breakfast - more reasonably priced, great choice and very friendly service.  For dinner try the Dry Dock a fantastic little restaurant about 1/2 mile away.   And do watch out for the standard 20% service…

title: Loved this resort, beautiful beach
review: My family and I recently visited this resort. Friends had told me this place was great so I went having high expectations and hope of not being disappointed. Fortunately, the resort was everything I had heard. The beach was beautiful, very well kept with endless white sand. The staff was very friendly, everything from the beach chair people to the room service foks. Food was a little pricey, but worth it, plus having a kitchen it cut down on the little expenses (I have children). We got a Beachview Club Suite, it was very roomey and filled with the great little conveniences.We booked our room through a website, [--]and saved alot of money so it left room for the fun stuff!

title: rooms have been redone  and are  great
review: gorgeous room with all possible amenities--everything top rate..highly recommended

title: Terrible Service
review: This overpriced resort was a disappointment from the beginning. I came with a wedding party and was turned off by the unattractive decor of the exterior of all the buildings. They look like jails. Second, the front desk staff was uninformed and unhelpful regarding my reservation. All elevator doors are rusted over.  The air conditioning was of poor quality, and was extremely loud and made a horrible rattling noise, making sleeping difficult. But worst of all, I checked out of my room at 11am (correct time) and went tdownstairs for brunch. At approximately noon, I realized that I had left two clothing items in the bathroom. I ran up to the room to find the housemaids cleaning, I wchecked the correct bathroom and my clothes were not there. The maid informed me that she she knew…

title: Dishonest
review: We stayed for our 5th visit  and probably last, to this hotel in May of this year.  We opted for a 1bed club suite in building 4 which has wonderful views of the Gulf of Mexico.  The suites in building 4 are accessed by a very tired lift/elevator similar to a service lift. It was dirty, smelly and needed a good clean.  The decor in our room was very dated although I gather the hotel is currently undergoing a refurbishment. The quality of the sheets, bed and pillows was poor. The bathroom facilities were adequate but not luxurious. Robes were provided and there was decent wardrobe space and hangers. We had to have a plumber out twice to un block the toilet, someone to fix the air cond and replace light bulbs. All hassle you don't need.  During our stay we were woken at 3am by a…

title: First Time Visitors Will be Back
review: We stayed at LBKC June 10-14 and took advantage of their special Sunday-Thursday package.  Hint: Before booking be sure to check the "packages" section of the website and be sure to mention the package when booking. We were toally impressed with the property.  Our room was newly refurnished and very comfortable.  Decor is bright and modern, bathroom has nice use of tile in the shower, carpeting is comfortable, and the kitchen is well stocked with useful items including an assortment of large knives.  The bed is one of the most comfortable I've slept in, and I travel on business staying at Westin, Hilton, etc.  This bed is better than those, by far. The property is clean, and well kept.  Not the meticulous attention of a Ritz-Carlton or Four Seasons, but very close.   The beach…

title: Beautiful Resort!
review: My fiance' and I stayed at the Longboat Key Club the weekend of May 4th. We were so happy with our stay. They are renovating the rooms and we actually got a room that had just been completed and we were the first to stay in it.  We had an ocean view  on the 6th floor of building 6 overlooking the gulf and the pool. We had a suite with a full kitchen, huge bathroom area, large living room (complete with a huge flat screen tv) and a super comfy king size bed. The room was quite big! The decor was fresh, modern and very 'beachy'.    The beach was beautiful. It was big and had very soft white powdery sand and attentive beach attendants. Sometimes they could be a bit pushy trying to get you to have them set up loungers and umbrellas when many were already available. They always…

title: Okay Hotel...wasn't too impressed.
review: We stayed at the Longboat Key Club, after reading comments on this website.    We were urged to stay at the Colony, but it didn't sound as nice.    We ended up going to the Colony often, as their restaurant was very nice, and all of the staff there was great.   The staff and amenities at the Longboat Key Club weren't as nice as we expected and the food was ridiculously overpriced, and not very good.   The hotel was clean, but that was about it.   I would recommend staying at the Colony.   The beach there was nice and they have a little playground on the sand for the kids.   The pool there looked nice to me.   The people staying there and the staff was so much warmer and nicer to us, that we regretted our choice.

title: Longboat Key Club keeps getting better
review: We have visited the Longboat Key Club for many years and each time we return, we find additional treasures that the Resort keeps adding.  Last year, they added a beautiful Spa which is amazing.  It has all the right touches and the service staff is suburb. The pool and beach is 2nd to none with personalized service. The island pool bar was my personal favorite spot, but the Club restaurants were also amazing with first class service and the best grouper I’ve had in years. In fact, the resort employees all were friendly and service was their top priority.   Now the suites!!!  The suites have always been the most spacious units in the area with 2 bedroom units up to 1,750 square feet!! I would say are now also leading the industry in their furnishings as well –and I travel a great…

title: Great facilities, service at the Longboat Key Club
review: Having read all the reviews here for LBKC, we booked our deluxe 2 bedroom suite for our family of 7.  Girls 6 & 4, boys 2 y.o & infant, plus babysitter.  It was a fantastic spot for our Easter break.  From our ground floor suite, we could go out of our private deck right to the beach access, a short walk to the pool and restaurants.  Loved the tennis, the Harborside Blue 9 hole course, the amazing spa.  Great facilities.  Good restaurants were Euphemia Hays, Cafe L'Europe, Chart House and Crab n Fin.  Capt. Greg Abbott took my husband and little girls fishing, and my husband marvelled at how great Cap't. Greg was with the kids.  A worthwhile outing.  St. Armand's Circle was a great walking/shopping/dining spot.  The kids' club was good; small size and my girls loved the outings;…

title: Longboat Key Resort is Awesome!
review: We had a wonderful time at your resort!! From the minute we checked in until the minute we checked out it was first class all the way! We were wit the USDTA tennis group and we had great tennis,golf,food,swimming,and a lot of fun memories that will never be forgotten. Thank you for the wonderful service !!!

title: Wonderful family stay
review: After much research we booked a week at the Longboat Key Club mid April. It was a wonderful vacation. The staff is outstanding. From the moment we arrived we were addressed by our name. Check-in was a breeze with bellmen greeting us in the driveway and taking care of everything.  After 24hour the staff knew our children by name. We enjoyed the pool and never had any trouble getting chairs. If you approach the pool/towel ‘boys’, they monitor the chaise lounges and will find chairs for you.  We traveled with two young children (age 1 and 4) and the room was good for us. We had the Club suite with the small kitchen which includes small wash/dryer; great with kids. I would have liked a larger room as our daughter slept on the pullout, which made it a bit crowded.  The price-jump to…

title: Better than the rest
review: The resort used to be one of the high class, now more of an middle of the road resort.  The condition is pretty good- a bit out dated in the rooms but not bad.  For instance the TV in our suite was a 14 inch set!   They have a resort style- short golf course with GPS in the carts.  Great pool on the beach and nice location at good prices.  Overall this is an above avaerage resort.

title: Longboat Key Club
review: We were there the week of April 1.  We got a fairly good rate through AARP---$80/night less than AAA.  Our room may have been somewhat run down, but, the view from the top floor of building 4 was spectacular.  We had a view all the way down Longboat Key.  I guess I expected the room to need some upkeep, so I wasn't too disappointed.  The grounds were very nice and the beach was unbelievable--very wide, soft and powdery.  So soft, it was almost hard to walk on!  The service was very good.  The beach attendants would bring an umbrella and a chaise to whever you wanted it, or fix a cabana for you.    I think what made up for the  dated room was that we had a huge balcony with a wonderful view.  And, the room wasn't THAT bad. We were able to fix frozen meals in the microwave.  The…

title: Great Service, Great Hotel, A Little Outdated
review: We recently stayed in a Club Suite at the Longboat Key Club, Room 4102.  At check-in, I was suprised to have been given a 1st floor room, after requesting a high floor, but I highly suggest it.  The seven buildings at the Longboat Key Club have a parking area on each "ground floor" of the building.  This means that the 1st Floor is on the 2nd Level.  Furthermore, 1st Floor rooms have both a balcony and a deck, w/ very easy beach access.  Our room was spacious, although most appliances were very outdated.  We used the pull-out couch, which was comfy, and the actual beds were awesome.  The balcony doors could really use a screen, as the only option was open (fresh air+bugs) or closed (no bugs, but only A/C).  Right up the street on Gulf of Mexico Drive is a Publix shopping center,…

title: Good overall, a few things to fix
review: We stayed at the resort for 3 nights in February.  Overall, our stay was good.  The checkin procedures were beautiful.  We pulled up to reception, went in and gave our credit card, picked up our keys and were immediately handed over to a bellman.  He had us follow his golf cart to the front of our building, where he took our car key and sent us to our room.  Two minutes later, he arrived with all our bags, stored them and handed us back our car key, telling us where he had parked our car. Rarely do we experience such a low stress check in.    Dinner in the main Sandspoint dining room was fabulous.  The menu was terrific and our waiter was great.  I wish they had suggested that we book a table for our first night when we reserved our room.  All were filled when we arrived, so we…

title: Mediocre
review: This resort was a disapointment on several different levels. The service in the main dining area and lobby left much to be desired. I was amazed at how many people were dissatisfied every single time I ate there over a five day stay. I can't remember the last time I consistently had slow and unfriendly service. Same problem at the pool bar and outside dining area. The rooms are okay and I must say that the beach is gorgeous. My husband and I were extremely tempted to switch over to the Ritz but he had meetings at the Key Club and it would have been an inconvenience. Note that the pricing was comparable. The Key Club was very overpriced!

title: I love this place
review: This place is amazing!!!  From the live entertainment in the lounge, the spa, golf courses I could go on and on! The Staff is so friendly and they go out of their way to help you.  I will be back again and again

title: Longboat Key Club is Wonderful!
review: We went to the Resort at Longboat Key Club after hearing lots of negative reviews about The Colony.   We were soooo happy we chose this property!   The rooms are beautiful, the housekeeping is immaculate and the service is really great.   Everyone was so happy to help us wherever we were on the property - the pool, out at the beach and on the tennis courts.   Their new tennis pro, Ron (or Don?), was especially great!!!!    Their tennis clinics are very fast paced and great exercise!   Cant wait to go back with our ladies' tennis team next time!!

title: All Positive
review: My wife and I just returned from a 7 night visit and you can see some photos of our Club Suite room.  I will only try to provide information which has not already been provided by others who like this resort.  Housekeeping does a complete job in the morning and there is evening turn down service ( turn down of the bed, replacement of used towels, trash removal and chocolates).  They provide an endless supply of coffee packages, dish washer and clothes washer soap for the units machines.  We probably encountered almost 50 staff members and almost without exception each was well trained and eager to please. The no extra charge high speed internet service worked well.  There is no extra fee for parking, unless you want valet service.  There is no extra charge for local or 800 phone…

title: turning a negative into a positive
review: We decided to stay at the Longboat Key Club for a two night getaway.  The property is very nice: large rooms, a nice pool area and a beautiful beach.  Unfortunately on our first night the fire alarm went off twice in the middle of the night as the result of a storm.  We had to evacuate while the alarm went off.  We didn't see any staff and the guests had to kind of fend for themselves.  When I told the manager the next day what had occurred, he was incredibly gracious, knocked something off the bill, sent us a personalized note of apology and a gift.  He thanked me for bringing the matter to his attention.  By acting in such a classy manner he totally changed my opinion of the hotel.  When the alarms went off I wanted to check out.  After the manager handled it in a first class…

title: Very Very Classy
review: My wife and I just spent 5 days at The Resort at Longboat Key.  We rented a gulf-front club suite.  The room was very clean which is important to my wife and had an awesome view of the gulf including a big balcony where I sat and read.  This was the most elegant beach resort I have ever seen.  Great restaurants, room service, beautiful golf courses, gulf front pool, tennis courts, marinas, and a spa that was pure luxury according to my wife.  The property is hugh like maybe 500 acres.  I did play golf which was one of the most scenic courses I've ever seen.  Everthing was first class and there was plenty of upscale shopping about 3 minutes away at St. Armands circle.   We ate dinner twice at the Charthouse restaurant which is also on the property.  Try their Godiva chocolate…

title: Exceptional Stay
review: Our family just celebrated our parent's 40th wedding anniversary at LKC. The stay was exceptional on every level....room, staff, food, beach/pool. I have to comment on the staff - they all did such a great job of taking care of anything that we needed...we were all very impressed. Special thanks to Richard who helped make the anniversary party such a big hit. Also, Jim in the pool deck /breakfast,lunch,dinner crew...always on top of things and had a great sense of humor! The musical talent was also top notch!!! We can't wait to return!

title: great retreat
review: Lovely accomodation great wild life (saw dolphins and fresh sea turtle nests) Excellent beach especially for shells collecting. Only problem we found was the reserving of the poolside sunbeds by guest who then left there belongings and failed to return for hours. Hotel policy stated that they would be removed after 1 hour. Unfortunately this was only policed if you requested a bed when non available. Having said that we did not fail to get beds when requested. Fantastic sunsets too. The best place to eat we found was, "The Crab and Fin" in nearby St Armands Circle.

title: fantastic resort
review: Just got back from a 3 night stay. Wonderful place and accommodations.We had a studio jr. suite overlooking the bay. The only disappointment is that we did not see any dolphins. The room was very clean and well equipped. There is no DVD , only a VCR. The kitchen is great with a full fridge. Definitely would go back again. The MOTE aquarium is very close and great to visit with the kids. St. Armand's Circle , also 5 mins. by car and nice to see . Staff extremely cordial and helpful. Really worth the money.

title: paradise
review: Had a superb week here 22 to 29 June 2006.  Accommodation was excellent and staff extremely helpful and friendly.  The location was wonderful.  We had a  gulf coast view which was definitely picture postcard.  What more can I say, other than we shall be returning.  Many thanks to all staff at the resort.

title: Wonderful
review: My boyfriend took me here as a surprise and actually proposed to me here. He had the entire staff in on making our weekend incredible. When we got to the room there was a dozen long stemmed roses in a gorgeous bouquet and after he proposed to me that night on the beach when we got back to our room there were chocolate covered strawberries. My fiance said he was so impressed with the staff. The grounds were incredible and the drinks were great. The beach was so private. The bed was super comfy. The restaurant at the hotel was very good. Would highly recommend the Chart House which is right down the road. We will go back for sure!

title: Well Worth The Money
review: Stayed 2 nights on 5th floor of building 3 - perfect and luxurious accomodations including a full kitchen.  Our suite overlooked the pool and the Gulf.  Everything was wonderful - all of the hotel staff we encountered were friendly and very helpful.  Only thing we would change is to not have a room overlooking the pool - tended to get quite a bit of noise from it until later in the evening (we kept our balcony doors open to enjoy the wonderful breeze and sound of the water.)  We will go back later this year and will try to get a suite in building 4 next time.

title: Fabulous Resort
review: This resort was as great as the reviews I found on Tripadvisor.  When we checked in, the front desk  told us when they can, they like to upgrade guests.  They "upgraded" us from our Club Suite to a Deluxe 2-bedroom condo.  This was much more than we had expected but with two kids, we certainly took advantage of the extra bedroom/bath and full kitchen. The beach is wonderful - with an abundant # of cabanas free of charge.  The pool was exceptionally clear and easily big enough to accomodate all the guests.  The only issue I could find with the whole place is there was not enough available lounge chairs at the pool.  I believe this is because guests would come down early, put a towel or item on chairs to "save" them for later - and also while they were out on the beach.   The…

title: what a great place
review: What a lovely getaway - i loved the resort - the beach was the best we had seen throughout our stay along  the Florida Gulf - it was peaceful and quiet and the staff were helpful and friendly.  (the boys on the beach are so good - nothing is too much trouble) The barman is excellent -   ask for Bimini but go careful on the Longboatinis.  We had a room in block 6 overlooking one of the water but not the beach and i actually preferred this as it was much quieter - watching dolphins feed twice a day, the fish jumping and the birds was a wonderful experience. As other reviewers said some guests are return visitors and are welcomed as such but i do find kissing all the staff in the bar and reception a bit much.  You do feel slightly put off by this as though it is a totally private…

title: Friendly staff, spacious rooms, a delight to stay in!
review: The Longboat Key Club offers something for everyone. During a busy season (spring break) the beach was relatively quiet and staff was always eager to set up a beach chair with canopy or umbrella. The clay tennis courts were plentiful, clean, and great to play on. The spa services (manicure and massage) were excellent. The staff was always friendly, courteous, and ready to help. The suite was spotless and spacious, and the in room washer, dryer was a nice convenience. The only negatives were a slow check in and not too helpful concierge desk. Our restaurant preferences were: Euphemia/Hay Loft, Zorias, and an Italian restaurant at 15 St. Armand's Circle.

title: A Beach Resort with a Country Club feel
review: My wife and I stayed at the Longboat Key Club or, as the locals call it, the "Inn on the Beach", for three days and nights during the second week of March 2006.   We had reserved a King room and were upgraded to a club suite.  Our two boys, age eight and five, stayed with their grandparents who spend the winter months in one of the many nearby apartment buildings on Longboat Key. When we booked, we checked with the reservation clerk to see if the boys could use the beach and pool during our stay and were told this would not be a problem. It was not; the boys enjoyed the pool and the beaches to the fullest.    The Club Suite Our room was on the fourth floor of building two overlooking the pool and beach, both of which were immaculately maintained.  The suite was configured with a…

title: Poor quality of service
review: The location is the only selling point of this property.  We have stayed at many beachfront properties, the difference at the LBKC is the lack or non-existence of service.  The resort charges a $25/night "service" charge per room.  There is also a 20% service charge with each drink and/or meal order.  What happened to rewarding quality of service rather than assuming your service is quality?  Even in a cashless resort, tipping can be done on each check.  The history of tipping is for a job well done, not because you showed up for work.  That overall lack of pride in the work is reflected in the quality of service provided at this resort.  We loved Sarasota and Longboat Key.  However, we will try other properties when we return.

title: Classiest Sarasota Getaway
review: Just returned from five days at The Resort at Longboat Key and have nothing but praise for this tastefully understated classic on Sarasota's most upscale barrier island. Service - at reception, on the two golf courses, at the private beach and in the Sands Pointe restaurant was attentive and friendly. Many of the guests were obviously repeat visitors. Sally Langham, the hotel's popular chanteuse, greeted some guests by name. Our 650-square foot club suite, newly remodeled, was perfect for our brief getaway. Can't wait to go back. Would like to save this secret for ourselves but, honestly, the Resort at Longboat Key Club deserves the credit.

title: Nice Location But Watch Out for Construction and Tacky Management!
review: We just returned from a week-long stay at this resort.  Our beach view one-bedroom suite was very well-appointed and had a great view of a long, white, sandy beach.  The Longboat Key area is very nice and quiet--which is exactly what we were looking for.  However, the resort needs some repairs and the management needs some customer relations training.    The first night, the fire alarm went off three times (they claim that they were false alarms) and we were forced to evacuate.  That same night, we noticed that our toilet was broken and needed to be repaired.  And a few days later, we had to ask housekeeping to bring us new pillowcases, because they had given us ones with stains on them.  Four days into our visit, we noticed ear-splitting banging and drilling coming from the…

title: fantastic ..UK..just relax
review: We have stayed many times in lONGBOAT KEY and have never found anywhere else in the world that feels as comfortable and relaxed..no crowds but good restaurants..stunning beaches,lots to do,but informal , safe, and no language barrier.  We stayed in August at this hotel for the first time and it was a very good experience all round..excellent restuarant and service.( best meal we had there even though you can eat out at a different restaurant every night) But we have to agree with another reviewer that stayed in August..that it was clear alot of tidying up was going on before owners weekend! If those standards were maintained all year round the whole feel of the resort would improve towards the 5star rating they would like.  A towel was left on the beach for 3 days half buried in…

title: Great...but a little expensive.
review: This is a great hotel -- on a beautiful stretch of beach on the gulf.  The hotel is next to some condos but no other hotels, and really feels very private and secluded.  Granted we went during the low season (September), I think even during high season it would feel that way.    It has a very nice restaurant and a bar at the pool.  It was great for our family (we brought two kids under 2 years...).    Also, our room had a washer and dryer, fridge and microwave.  Big plus:  The beach is literally several feet from the pool, which makes it easy to go back and forth and then up to your room.  Downside:  First, the only place to stay is the part of the hotel next to the lobbey (the cheaper rooms are a haul from the beach, and have a lousy view).   Second, the place is downright…

title: Great hotel - location - would definitely stay again!!!
review: This is a fabulous hotel - great location - great family hotel - they treat you like it's your home!  It was amazing and refreshing!

title: Longboat Key--The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
review: Our family has just returned from our annual stay at the Longboat Key Club Resort.  We have been very happy guests there for over 6 years and have had many great vacations there.  We love this property for its beautiful beachfront setting, large and well decorated suites, top notch tennis, great location and terrific service.  We are sad to report that we WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO RECOMMEND THIS PROPERTY  to friends at this time.  We felt it would be helpful to share comments with others considering a stay and encourage others with recent stays to provide their comments in the hope that current management can restore the property to the premier status it once enjoyed.    The Good:  The deluxe 2 bedroom suites are great for families.  They have a full size, well equipped kitchen,…

title: Nice Condo with Resort Hotel Features
review: June 17-19th, 2005 we stayed at the Long Boat Key Club for a friend's wedding.    Overall, we had a very nice stay.  The Long Boat Key club features a nice outdoor pool, direct beach access, an outdoor bar, a great fitness area, outdoor dining and tennis courts.  The staff was attentive and pleasant.    We only ate appetizers at the outdoor bar, but found them to be good and made fairly quickly.  Food and drinks are not cheap, but are priced at what I believe to be standard resort prices.  Our bay-view one bedroom was clean, fairly new looking and featured a small kitchen and dining table. The bathroom had a separate shower/toilet area from the dressing/sink area.   Unfortunately, we visisted during a nasty red tide and could not enjoy the beach, or even our balcony for the most…

title: Best of Longboat key
review: Just got back after spending memorial day weekend at Lonboat Key Club Resort. It was our 3rd time to stay there and the service and location can't be beat. It's located in a private gated golf course resort overlooking the beautiful white sandy beach and blue gulf waters, surrounded by tropical foliage and multimillion dollar homes and condos. you can relax in the morning enjoying breakfast by the pool overlooking the beach. For lunch they had a cookout or you can order from the restaurant. There's a poolside bar that serves fabulous tropical drinks while you listen to there live poolside entertainment (music). You truly feel like your a member of a country club with all the amenities without the stuffiness! The children love coming here as they get treated like royalty which…

title: life altering experience
review: If you stay at the Longboat Key Club, you must check out the fitness center and request a swedish massage. The spa didn't have the most luxurious furnishings, but the service was incredible. I walked away invigorated, refreshed and felt like a whole new person. It was the best massage I have ever had.

title: loved it !!!!!!
review: The staff??.Well, how much better can they treat you?...........I went there in January for a week and returned for another week.....the manager sent a card with flowers to our room on our return........come on !!!.Breakfast in the room was great.............service all around was very good........even the girls who cleaned the room were wonderful.......I had 8 guest on the deck and had lots of room left over.big decks..beautiful water views and a nice beach.my guest thought the furniture was just fine............very nice grounds .nice pool.very clean place all around.......of course, a great area...........and Armand Circle is a wonderful spot..great restaurants.............   and drive a little to other wonderful restaurants and theater...............there is a wonderful…

title: best in longboat key
review: the hotel is so nice and the sverice is like back in the 80s.

title: Great beaches worth the spend
review: The area is beautiful, the beaches are pristine, and the water doesn’t get much warmer (or clearer) as it does in Longboat Key.  The hotel has plenty of facilities, including golf course, tennis courts, pool & sauna, and a workout center (although I was disappointed that there were no Precor machines, only treadmills and Stepmasters!)  I did not have a great experience with the staff.  When we checked in, I politely asked if they could upgrade us from a golf view to an ocean view, and the clerk said he couldn’t as they were booked solid that night – despite that it was a weeknight and in the middle of the off season!  Sure enough, there were LOADS of empty parking spaces, and very few people milling about, it was hard to believe that they couldn’t upgrade us!  The golf course…
